story:
Whispers...

Words and images reminding us of a life that is created to be experienced---though broken we have a divine spark that beckons us.

“Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet."
---Plato

Not everyone understands poetry, it is at times incomprehensible and jagged, at other times a rhyming perfection---but ultimately it is the language of our heart. Poem is the overflow of our reality poured into words. These words and images sing the song of my soul and I hope they connect with yours.

Your gift will enable this project to expand into pages of words, color, images and art that hopefully will take you, if only for the briefest of moments, where the spirit leads.

I hope you will consider joining me on this journey and I pray along the way you will hear the whispers of my heart, as well as your own.

THANKS TO YOU THIS BOOK WAS PUBLISHED!

Buy Now on Kindle or Paperback.

What's Next?

Your patronage means that this book will have the chance to be put into the hands of people across the globe. It's your destiny to make a difference in the lives of every bullied, abused, eating disordered, dream chasing, or spiritually questioning human being. This book is an opportunity to let someone else know that they too are significant.

Funds raised through this campaign will go directly to printing/publishing cost, pre-sales, and as incentive for author Nicole Lockhart as she seeks to develop a documentary following the release of the novel. In Phase II: The Documentary of UNADEQUATE, Nicole reads the story aloud to a variety of communities around the world for a spectacular storytelling documentary bringing awareness to global issues, creative freeform, and the power of every human story.

Any funds exceeding our required funding goal will go directly to making that documentary a reality.

MAKE AN IMPACT!

...and just incase you're wondering; Yes, the title is purposely misspelled.

story:
The AN INSPIRED WALK Project Summary

My name is Dr. Julie Connor. I am a writer, motivating speaker, and goal-planning strategist. I invite others to dream big, plan well, work smart, and live with purpose and for  a purpose. The AN INSPIRED WALK Project provides tools to transform dreams into a powerful action plan. Funds from this campaign allow us to provide workshops  and resources for at-risk youth and families, support groups, and crisis centers at no charge.    

Throughout the last 25 years, I’ve shown adults and students how  to use practical goal-setting strategies. Those who want to pursue a passion, transition through a life change, or adopt a new positive habit want more than a pep talk; they need tools to experience success. Devices like planners and expensive software are good resources, but they don't work unless there’s a plan in place to use them. That’s where I come in. I’ll show you how to transform your dreams into goals, manageable steps, and a plan that ensures success.

 

The AN INSPIRED WALK Collection

When was the last time someone asked you about your dreams?  The four books in the AN INSPIRED WALK collection are packed with tools that will help you design a successful framework for reaching your goals.  The series include:

  • An Inspired Walk Action Guide This book lays out a simple process to define your goals with razor-sharp clarity.
  • An Inspired Walk Journal provides you with thought-provoking questions and opportunities to monitor your progress. The exercises ensure your plans align with your goals and dream. 
  • Divine in the Everyday is a collection of courageous stories written by everyday heroes who share their collective wisdom.  Monies from the sale of the book will be donated to Kansas City urban intervention programs for inner-city youth.
  • Divine in My Normal is a book filled with inspirational reflections and meditations that speak to your heart and celebrate the Divine in all of us.

I am convinced the tools you’ll find and the guidance I provide in the An Inspired Walk series inspire hope and provide easy, practical means that promote purposeful living. 

What We Need and What You Get

My goal is to raise $50,000.00 within two months.  Funding allows us to provide intervention and goal-setting workshops and resources with at-risk youth and families, support groups, and crisis centers at no cost to the participants.  The tools in the AN INSPIRED WALK collection empower adults and students with tools to create their own paths of success.  

There are lots of ways you can lend your support.  Check out our perks over at the right!  These tokens of appreciation will help us launch the AN INSPIRED WALK collection and continue our work with those who most desperately want to experience hope.

Follow Our Progress

You will be able to track our Indiegogo funding progress here and on my website at Inspiration With Julie, www.DrJulieConnor.com.  You can also sign up for free Daily Inspire-ations to receive a short e-mail with an inspiring message every day, follow my blog, or submit your own story of inspiration to share with
others.                 

Some of the stories submitted on the Tell Your Story link on my website at http://drjulieconnor.com/tell-your-story/ will be included (with authors’ permissions, of course) in my book, Divine in the Everyday.   

Other Ways You Can Help Us Inspire Others

Help us make some noise about the AN INSPIRED WALK campaign!  Check us out at my website, "Inspiration With Julie," and “like” us at www.DrJulieConnor.com.  You can also “like” us on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and LinkedIn.  And remember to use the handy Indiegogo share tools!   

Thank you for stopping by to learn about our AN INSPIRED WALK Project. With your help, we will continue to inspire each other, inspire a group, inspire a city, and inspire a world.

story:
Hi. We’re Elisabeth Thurston Fraser and Miya Hirabayashi, founders of YOU + ME* and the ad-free publishing platform Equals. For almost a year, we’ve been publishing essays and photography by talented women on our site. Now it’s time to go offline. 

Our Project

We believe women who write brilliant essays about compelling topics deserve to have their work in print. And that words are best enjoyed in the company of gorgeous photos and considered layouts. It's our mission to publish not just one, but a series of publications that meet those criteria.

The inaugural print edition of Equals includes 30 essays around the theme of "exploration," with four major sections devoted to cartography, uncharted territory, nostalgia, and souvenirs. Our contributors' words are enhanced by outstanding photography and custom illustrations. Here are just a few of our gorgeous spreads:

Over the next year, you can look forward to the second print edition of Equals and essay compilations from many of our online contributors.

Our Contributors 

Below are just a handful of the incredible writers whose work will be featured in our pages: 

Melanie Biehle is a Creative Marketing Strategist, Storyteller, and Cool Things Sharer. She’s the founder of Inward Facing Girl, where she documents her obsessions with creativity and psychology, contemporary art, design, photography, travel, magazines, and life in Seattle with The Adventure Club (aka, her husband and son). She optioned a romantic comedy screenplay in 2005, and her writing, graphic design, and photography have been featured on The Huffington Post, Sunset Magazine, Decor8, SF Girl by Bay, UPPERCASE and more.

Erin Boyle is a freelance writer and photographer in Brooklyn, New York. She writes Reading My Tea Leaves, a daily lifestyle blog chronicling life in a tiny apartment and other adventures related to living simply and sustainably.

Erin Loechner, a writer and former ad agency copywriter in Los Angeles, now resides in a sleepy Midwestern town with her husband Ken, daughter Bee and two dogs. A pioneer “design blogger” featuring trending products and lifestyle images, Loechner recently shifted her focus to a more personal quest for creativity on her award-winning site, Design for Mankind, listed as one of The London Time’s top 50 design blogs in the world. Loechner is a freelance writer for various web publications and magazines whose work has been featured in Glamour, Lucky, Dwell, Readymade, Nylon, Print Magazine and The Huffington Post.

Karey Mackin is a writer who would much rather be an artist, but is slowly coming to the realization that her best pictures are drawn with her words. It changed her life when she read that we all walk past a thousand stories every day, and that the best writers among us see about six. At last count, she's up to three. But only because her family is currently living in Jakarta where there's no shortage of monkeys dressed up as rhinestone cowboys.

Randon Billings Noble is an essayist. Her work has appeared in the Modern Love column of The New York Times; The Massachusetts Review; Passages North; Propeller Quarterly; Superstition Review; Brain, Child; The Millions and elsewhere.  You can read more of her work at www.randonbillingsnoble.com. In Equals in Print she interviews authors Andrea Barrett, Cheryl Strayed, and Pam Houston about exploration as it relates to writing and reading.

Kathleen Shannon is a branding and visioning consultant for creative entrepreneurs as a co-founder of Braid Creative. She is an art director turned free spirited champion for business-minded creatives. Her “don’t-just-dream-it-do-it” style pervades everything from her work to her life, home, food and adventures at www.andkathleen.com.

Carrie Allen Tipton writes and lectures about classical music, American popular music, religion, and Southern culture. Her work has appeared in Pop Matters, Deep South Magazine, Curator Magazine, Religion Dispatches, Black Grooves, and the Journal of the Society for American Music, among other places. New work is upcoming in Texas Heritage Magazine and the new Grove Dictionary of American Music. For more, visit www.carrieallentipton.com.

You can read about all of our contributors here. 

What We Need & What You Get

We're raising $15,000 to launch our publishing platform. In the near term that includes paying our contributors and support staff, printing our first run, and seeding our second publication. Like our site, this is an ad-free endeavor.

To reward you, as one of our early supporters, our first book is available through this campaign at 15% off. Orders placed during this campaign will also be shipped first. We hope you're eager to purchase a copy of Equals in print for your own coffee table/nightstand/bookshelf, but we happen think it makes a pretty amazing gift too.

Since Mother's Day and graduation season are just around the corner, we've created limited-edition gift packages perfect for the writers, readers, art-appreciators, and explorers in your life. If your gift-giving occasion will take place before the estimated ship date, don't fret; we're happy to send a handwritten card to you or the gift recipient. 

We'll send out emails after the campaign is over to ask for your preferences for your rewards. Thanks for your support! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider sharing this project with your social media networks and/or sending it to a friend.

If you think your work would be a good fit for our site or future print publications, please drop us a line!

story:
Who is Nelladet?

I am a wife, mother, friend & educator who is an an empty-nester on a quest to create, author, originate, or make anything that inspires—which could be dangerous at my age!  After surviving breast cancer, several major surgeries, and PTSD symptoms brought on by my mother's death during chemotherapy treatments, I wanted to create something healing. It is said writing can be the catalyst. While pondering for quite some time on the topics I wished to write about, I awoke in the morning hours with the idea of this book—the first of many short inspirational books to come. 

 

Can't is Merely a Contraction for Can Try is about lessons of courage, hope, and love. I hope readers will find strength and inspiration through its message as they travel a metaphorical journey in a little red car, with a mother and the daughter she hopes to empower through life's difficulties.

As Nellie flies over bumps, maneuvers around corners, and scrambles up hills in the little red car, her mother is always there to remind her about the importance of trying. But then, suddenly, Mother is gone and Nellie must face a steep, jagged mountain alone. Through her grief and despair, she remembers her mother’s most important piece of advice, and through it finds an even greater source of strength.

As a new writer, I have learned that as we notice and pay attention to the details of life, gratitude can grow in our hearts.  And when we revisit or remember our experiences, we can find ways we have been blessed, even in an unexpected and difficult journey.

It has always been my goal to reach out, telling a story that can generate understanding and love. I care about people and throughout my life I have dedicated my time to build my community, contribute to my church, and expand knowledge through education.

What YOU Get!

Can't is Merely a Contraction for Can Try will be released in April 2013 and available just in time for Mother's Day. The book is illustrated by award-winning artist Brian Hailes. 

The book will be a great gift for any person in your life who is traveling an unexpected journey or needs a little encouragement. It will make a fabulous Mother's Day gift too. You will also get the perk promised for whatever pre-ordered reward you sign up for. Please see the list to the right of the screen.

The Impact

Many women face the adversity of having to deal with breast cancer—1 in 3 before their lifetime is over. This book contains a timeless message of triumph over adversity. In the spirit of giving back, ten percent of the profits of this book will be donated to the Susan G. Komen foundation to help fight breast cancer. 

I would also like to set up an arts and humanities memorial scholarship in my mother's name. She passed away toward the end of my chemotherpay. Mom treasured education and although she never had the opportunity to receive a degree, she instilled in her children a desire to be lifelong learners. Between her seven children are eight degrees—a testament to her influence. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t afford to donate or pre-order, please pass this link along to your friends and join my social media sites listed below. You will not only get updates on the progress of the book as it goes through its production journey, but posts on home, family, education, relationships, techie stuff, and inspirational quotes.  Thank you for your help!

Campaign Team

BookWise Publishing: Karen Christofferson
Marketing Manager & Website Design:  Meagen Johnson
Marketing Assistants:  My Family & Friends
Illustrator:  Brian Hailes
Cover & Book Design:  Fran Platt
Print Broker:  Bill Ruesch

story:
Who am I
 
My name is Lauren White, I was originally from England near London and I now live in Utah with my 3 children and my husband.

I have always loved books, I love to curl up with a good book and loose my self in an imaginary world.  One day I thought of how wonderful it would be to have the opportunity to bring to life the imaginary world of Ava, the Elf.  I have been writing for years and now it is time to share the love that I have for writing with the world.


About this book

In the early spring of 2009, in a small town called Ogmore-by-sea in the Vale of Glamorgan Wales, there lived a 16-year-old girl by the name of Ava Deanull. Ava was fine with the idea of being invisible to everyone around her. She enjoyed being with her father, and listening to his stories about Elves, from long ago, and the battles they fought against one corrupt Elf named Blagnor. All Ava needed in life was her father Glen, and her best friend Jack.

All was good, until one day when her life was thrown off balance. Ava’s father had suddenly disappeared, leaving items, such as a mirror that has messages left on it from him to help her deal with her family secret, Ava is half Elf.  Now Ava will have the huge challenge of hiding what she really is, as she tries to hide her new ears as well as her powers that begin to reveal themselves, in more ways than one.

With the help of her best friend Jack, a keeper called Samuel and other interesting characters, Ava must learn how to control her new powers in order to help her father defeat Blagnor and his creatures called Tralons, who have broken free from the prison where they have been captive in for thousands of years.

What does it take to publish and promote a new book these days?

Printing and distributing books are the barest beginnings of what it takes to launch a new title in today's rapidly evolving world of publishing. Now the focus has shifted to a far broader scope: the added potential of a vibrant new world of e-books and audio books; Facebook and YouTube; websites and interactive blogs; teleseminars and social media. It's a technological publishing environment filled with promise and exciting new possibilities for reaching a worldwide audience with a life-changing message like the teachings of Oneness; an unprecedented opportunity for reaching more people, building links and creating community! At the same time, the new opportunities for spreading the word have created a need for technical support with the specialized know-how it now takes to bring a new book to life!  Now as Lauren prepares to launch "The Light of Silenddin" in today's totally transformed publishing environment, and reach out to a vast, rapidly expanding audience, she realizes that she can't do it alone anymore. To give "The Light of Silenddin" the outreach and momentum that's now possible, she’s going to need help. Naturally, she thought of you ... and hopes you'll be open to supporting the launch of this amazing new book!

We invite you to join Lauren by adding your own personal contribution to the energy of this effort, and help bring "The Light of Silenddinto life! Please visit us at www.thelightofsilenddin.blogspot.com/.

What We Need & What You Get

This wonderful book is almost ready for production. All that is left is the final edit and the production of the book.  The total cost to accomplish this and make it a great success is $10,000.

Tokens of Gratitude for your Support!

Priceless: Lauren’s boundless gratitude for spreading the word about this campaign to family and friends! Please share the link to this page with everyone you feel might resonate with it.

$10 Donation: A personal “thank you” e-mail from Lauren with one "Sneak Preview" chapter from The Light of Silenddin!

$20 Donation: A “The Light of Silenddin" T-Shirt! and "Sneak Preview" chapter from The Light of Silenddin!

Who am I
 
My name is Lauren White, I was originally from England near London and I now live in Utah with my 3 children and my husband.I have always loved books, I love to curl up with a good book and loose my self in an imaginary world.  One day I thought of how wonderful it would be to have the opportunity to bring to life the imaginary world of Ava, the Elf.  I have been writing for years and now it is time to share the love that I have for writing with the world.
About this book
In the early spring of 2009, in a small town called Ogmore-by-sea in the Vale of Glamorgan Wales, there lived a 16-year-old girl by the name of Ava Deanull. Ava was fine with the idea of being invisible to everyone around her. She enjoyed being with her father, and listening to his stories about Elves, from long ago, and the battles they fought against one corrupt Elf named Blagnor. All Ava needed in life was her father Glen, and her best friend Jack. All was good, until one day when her life was thrown off balance. Ava’s father had suddenly disappeared, leaving items, such as a mirror that has messages left on it from him to help her deal with her family secret, Ava is half Elf.  Now Ava will have the huge challenge of hiding what she really is, as she tries to hide her new ears as well as her powers that begin to reveal themselves, in more ways than one. With the help of her best friend Jack, a keeper called Samuel and other interesting characters, Ava must learn how to control her new powers in order to help her father defeat Blagnor and his creatures called Tralons, who have broken free from the prison where they have been captive in for thousands of years.


What does it take to publish and promote a new book these days?
Printing and distributing books are the barest beginnings of what it takes to launch a new title in today's rapidly evolving world of publishing. Now the focus has shifted to a far broader scope: the added potential of a vibrant new world of e-books and audio books; Facebook and YouTube; websites and interactive blogs; teleseminars and social media. It's a technological publishing environment filled with promise and exciting new possibilities for reaching a worldwide audience with a life-changing message like the teachings of Oneness; an unprecedented opportunity for reaching more people, building links and creating community! At the same time, the new opportunities for spreading the word have created a need for technical support with the specialized know-how it now takes to bring a new book to life!  Now as Lauren prepares to launch "The Light of Silenddin" in today's totally transformed publishing environment, and reach out to a vast, rapidly expanding audience, she realizes that she can't do it alone anymore. To give "The Light of Silenddin" the outreach and momentum that's now possible, she’s going to need help. Naturally, she thought of you ... and hopes you'll be open to supporting the launch of this amazing new book!
We invite you to join Lauren by adding your own personal contribution to the energy of this effort, and help bring "The Light of Silenddinto life! Please visit us at www.thelightofsilenddin.blogspot.com/.

This wonderful book is almost ready for production. All that is left is the final edit and the production of the book.  The total cost to accomplish this and make it a great success is $10,000.

story:
Short Summary

After almost 2 years, 30 cities, and 12,000 photos later, I find myself with a wealth of information after living some of my life in China and Taiwan, and have stories and experiences nearly exploding out of me.   Some are exciting.  Some are shocking.  Some are downright bizzare.  Some are just plain confusing.  It's long overdue to collect my thoughts in a meaningful way and try to unravel the mystery of this fascinating part of the world.  For a sample story, see below! 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding for this project will assist me in many ways.  As I expect this to be the highest quality production possible, I will need advanced professional editing tools for images and writing.  I will also need minimal support to dedicate the time (which I expect to be several months) to collect these stories and edit them.  Several are already written, and several will need to be constructed from journal entries, discussions with fellow travelers, and photographs. 

The Impact

China is still a question mark for most Americans.  Our knowledge is generally limited to the Great Wall, Terracotta Warriors, Beijing, Shanghai, Communism, and pollution.  But in reality, it is so much more.  If you want to whet your tongue, see the sample story below. Despite the mystery of China, it has become a major world player, and is extraordinarily linked to the United States.  This project promises to be a fascinating read for those who are interested in a drastically different culture trying to figure out who it is in the face of massive development, political controversy, technological explosion.  This will be especially interesting to those who intend to visit or do business with China, as the interaction with people and the usefulness of relationship building are distinctly different, and provide much of the basis for these stories.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, and share this campaign!  Please help spread the word about this project!  Any help to bring this book to fruition will be much appreciated.

Sample Story

The following is a story I wrote during my time as a teacher at a major Chinese university.  If you like what you read, please consider donating or sharing this campaign with others.

 

It's 6:00 AM.  I wake up in my bed to the sound of piercing Chinese voices: "YI! ER! SAN! SI!" which means "ONE! TWO! THREE! FOUR!"  It's the sound of my students beginning their day.  A whistle has woken them up at 5:30 and now they are running in formation around campus, a route which takes them close to the "foreign expert hotel" where I live.  They don't always wake me up, but today, between their yelling, the cold weather defeating my outdated heating, and the sun filtering through the yellow and grey air, I crawl out from under the mosquito net that I sleep beneath, get up and make myself a cup of tea.  I walk across my apartment, which was built and furnished in the 1950s, past my bathroom with its hastily taped shower head and a line of bricks cemented to the floor to serve as the shower area.

My students begin their day at 5:30 to the sound of a whistle.  They run from 6AM to 7AM and then eat breakfast.  At 7:30 they are sitting in their classroom.  Classes don't start until 8:00, but their ominous "captain" who I have never met but apparently controls every aspect of their day insists they study for a half hour before their first class. 

Of course, he is not in the room with then, and instead, the students start up the classroom computer and watch movies, listen to music, or look at reruns of American basketball games.  Sleeping is popular too; when I enter the room for an 8AM class, I'm usually greeted by 10 or 20 tops of the heads of my students. 

But the truth is, once I enter and start class, the students are genuinely happy to see me, and I'm happy to see them.  Teaching here is such a unique and interesting experience because it is such a crash of cultures, styles, and every class is fun for me.  The students enjoy it as well.  My class is the token "easy class" because their other teachers work them so hard and the atmosphere is so cold and pressuring, but actually most of the students work quite hard in my class.  The idea that learning can be fun had never occurred to my students.  We played "Simon Says" which I think is great for listening comprehension and vocabulary building.  The students had so much fun that now they ask me to play it, and when I tell them it's helped improve their English, they're shocked when they realize it's true. 

The students are in class nonstop from 8:00AM to 8:15PM with a break for lunch and dinner.  8:15PM to 9:30PM is their only free time (this schedule applies to the weekends, too) and at 9:30PM they are locked down in their dormitories.  For 30 minutes, they are allowed to brush their teeth, wash their clothes, fetch hot water for their showers (during this time I often seen them walking through campus with big plastic buckets of hot water with which to bathe) or study.  At exactly 10PM, all electricity to the building is cut off, and the students can do nothing but use the remaining battery on their cell phones to text each other or make calls, or chat with me online.  They don't even have alarm clocks, which is why they wake up each morning to a whistle.

There is also on-campus dining. I live in north campus, which is the oldest part of campus, and the food is honestly not great.  Everything is a la carte, and none of the dishware is ever truly clean, and you have to take your tray and dump it onto a mountain of food refuse when you're finished.  The whole process is extremely unappetizing.  There is, however, a dining hall just for teachers, and when I go there the environment is the same but the food is a bit better.  Sharing the teachers' dining hall is a restaurant that I occasionally eat at, and the food is quite good.  My favorites are "boloajipian," chunks of chicken and pineapple tossed together in an orange sauce, and "tie ban niuro," strips of beef sizzling on a bed of onion shoots, that arrives at the table on an iron skillet and with steam billowing off of it.  Both of those dishes, by the way, cost less than $3.

My students have it the worst of all in terms of food.  They have to eat in a special dining hall for all of their meals, and the food is the lowest quality I've eaten in China.  I ate there once, just to walk in their shoes, and I was given a metal tray with an ice cream scoop of rice, a scoop of some vegetable in sauce, and a small chicken patty.   My students said I came on a good day; the chicken patty was a rare treat. There was nothing to drink, and each student gets one tray of food.

But fortunately, there is salvation!  The Foreign Expert Cafe is quite literally a hole in the wall of the hotel where I live.  It caters almost specifically to the flight students, and even though the restaurant only has about 10 extremely dirty tables, the food is great and cheap, and they sell lots of alcohol and cigarettes.  I love eating there with students; I feel so alive and like such a local.  We huddle on stools around the tiny tables bundled up against the cold, and share steaming plates of various dishes - mushrooms and cabbage, chunks of beef and garlic, and chicken slices with green pepper are among my favorites.  We wash it all down with Qingdao Beer which the Chinese drink at room temperature but I get cold bottles because I'm a regular there and explained that Americans prefer cold beer.  A typical meal there for four people costs about $8. 

The student-teacher relationship is completely different in China. In class, the Chinese teachers stand in front of the board or projector and lecture.  The students do not ask questions because it is a sign that they are defective in learning, and if they don't understand something they just fall behind.  It doesn't help that in the Chinese language the word for "question" is exactly the same as "problem."  Furthermore, asking questions means the teacher is doing something wrong, and that implication is unacceptable here.  So you can imagine the students’ reactions when on the first day I sat down on top of the desk in the front row and every so often asked them "Do you guys have questions? How can I help you understand this better?" 

When I call on them, they immediately stand up and report their answer.  And if they don’t know the answer, they look like they’re about to cry and say, “Teacher, I’m so sorry.”  I keep trying to explain to them that the purpose of being in school is to LEARN and that if they don’t know something, that’s perfectly OK!

Last week I saw a group of students at the aforementioned cheap and delicious restaurant.  They were toasting constantly and had about 20 empty bottles of Tsingtao beer on their table.  The toasted, and after downing his glass, one of the students promptly vomited all over the table.  The restaurant employees did nothing; they didn't even give him some napkins.  But despite some obvious differences, through my students I can see that in some ways people are all the same: they love to laugh, and they're interested about life and the world.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Katy Schutte and I am a veteran improviser. I’ve done more than Malcolm Gladwell’s 10,000 hours of improv; teaching, performing and coaching since 2004 (and really, since I was a kid). I travel all over the world doing my art form and I want to give you the tools that I’ve picked up on the way.

I have spent the last year writing and editing my collected wisdom from all of those hours and the amazing teachers, students and fellow-performers that I’ve learned from. It’s a little different from the other improv books I’ve come across because it’s written as a 12-week course that you can do alone or with your improv group if you have one. Each week is full of exercises, essays, techniques and advice. It’s a really nice 300-page 8x10 inch paperback with lots of boxes and margins to write in!

Here’s the thing: I can’t print it without you and you can’t have a copy without me!

What I Need & What You Get

I want to do a print run of 100 (or more) copies, but I don’t have the money up-front to do that. I will be teaching and performing at the Maydays Improv Retreat in a few weeks that has 60 participants and is my deadline for this project. I’m also at various other festivals over the next year and beyond and would love to have copies to take along. A first print of 100+ copies is a test run that will give me a better idea of demand.

(UPDATED at £5216 funded) The money will cover:

  • Printing and delivery cost of first 50 books from Blurb (£363+)
  • 250 books from Blurb (£1727+)
  • Fees for IndieGoGo (5% - £263)
  • Bank transfer fee for IndieGoGo (£25)
  • Payment processing fees (£230)
  • Back pay for many months of unfunded work (£1000)
  • Two web domains for the book (£25)
  • Printing and postage of 5 proof copies (£60)
  • Printing and delivery of early manuscripts (£75)
  • Postage to customers (£980+)
  • Notebooks, postcards etc for perks (£170)
  • Launch party (£100)
  • Copy-editing and proof-reading (in-kind support)
  • Front cover design and type-setting (in-kind support)
  • I only start making money once 60 books are sold…
  • Contingency in case of any fuck-ups (10% - £380)

My perks are that you get the book. First. There may also be some nice personal messages and random stuff that I’ll throw in there too.

I’m only releasing real paper copies at this stage because the book has been designed to be written on, carried around and flipped through again and again. I could have made it cheaper, but I've chosen quality instead. I want it to be one of those books you like to hold on to. It’s not a short collection of essays, it is 73,000 words printed in an 8x10 inch book.

This is a huge deal for me because I’ve never written a book before! My goal from writing all these words is make you an even more awesome improviser. If this first print goes well I get to expand my horizons and sell the book – as well as my teaching and shows - to new corners of the world.

The Impact

This is a different improv book. I don’t believe in one philosophy of improv; each one is valuable and you can pick and choose from what you learn to discover your improv superpowers and continue to have the best time on stage (or wherever you improvise).

Despite this being my first book, I have been writing an improv blog since 2011 which gets thousands of hits on every article. I have performed and/or taught improv in Holland, Greece, Spain, Belgium, France, Ireland, Scotland, Germany, Sweden, Iceland, Portugal, Estonia, Finland, Sweden, Italy and the USA many of which I’ve been to multiple times.

I am the Artistic Director of the award-winning Maydays who have been performing and teaching since 2004, I also teach with Hoopla, which is the UK’s most popular improv school. The thing is, people always want a little more, to know what to do next when the course or the festival finishes, when I’m no longer there to help out or answer questions. Hopefully this will be an affordable way for everyone to keep working on their improv with a group or on their own; alongside, instead of or in-between other training.

I’ve been working with many people who have been giving their services and advice in kind. Fred Deakin generously designed the front cover and typeset the book and Victoria Hogg copy-edited, proof-read and provided constructive insight, both over many painstaking hours to get the book to the final stage where we are ready to print. All we need now is for you to pledge your money to buy a signed first edition copy.

This book is me reaching out. I want to make improv as inclusive and friendly as I possibly can and connect with even more improvisers from all over the world.

Risks & Challenges

I have never published a book before, so that’s scary. I am lucky enough to have had loads of friends give me professional advice and work on the practical stuff to get the book looking and reading great and being published just for you.

We have a time-crunch! With me and my team doing improv around the world all summer we’ve been working as fast as we can in different time zones to get this ready in time for the Maydays Improv Retreat. Almost one year ago at the same gathering, John Cremer handed me his most recent book and I vowed to write my own before the next retreat. That means pressing the first edition button on 13th September. Not only will I get my wish, but I’ll save postage for up to 60 people and have a soft launch with a bunch of excellent improvisers and friends.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can contribute financially, the only way people will hear about the book is if we tell them. I would love for you to get the word out to all the other improv groups and individuals you know about the book.

I’d love it if you told them in your own words, but if you don’t have time, here is a template message you can use:

Veteran improviser (and now my friend) @katyschutte has just written an improv workbook. Order a limited first edition copy by 13th September! https://igg.me/at/theimprovisersway

If you can’t afford to pledge money but still want to get improv advice, my blog is still out there to read for free and I’ll continue to answer as many questions as possible.

Thanks for listening, getting the word out and following me!

Short SummaryHello, my name is Katy Schutte and I am a veteran improviser. I’ve done more than Malcolm Gladwell’s 10,000 hours of improv; teaching, performing and coaching since 2004 (and really, since I was a kid). I travel all over the world doing my art form and I want to give you the tools that I’ve picked up on the way.I have spent the last year writing and editing my collected wisdom from all of those hours and the amazing teachers, students and fellow-performers that I’ve learned from. It’s a little different from the other improv books I’ve come across because it’s written as a 12-week course that you can do alone or with your improv group if you have one. Each week is full of exercises, essays, techniques and advice. It’s a really nice 300-page 8x10 inch paperback with lots of boxes and margins to write in!Here’s the thing: I can’t print it without you and you can’t have a copy without me!What I Need & What You GetI want to do a print run of 100 (or more) copies, but I don’t have the money up-front to do that. I will be teaching and performing at the Maydays Improv Retreat in a few weeks that has 60 participants and is my deadline for this project. I’m also at various other festivals over the next year and beyond and would love to have copies to take along. A first print of 100+ copies is a test run that will give me a better idea of demand.(UPDATED at £5216 funded) The money will cover:
Printing and delivery cost of first 50 books from Blurb (£363+)
250 books from Blurb (£1727+)
Fees for IndieGoGo (5% - £263)
Bank transfer fee for IndieGoGo (£25)
Payment processing fees (£230)
Back pay for many months of unfunded work (£1000)
Two web domains for the book (£25)
Printing and postage of 5 proof copies (£60)
Printing and delivery of early manuscripts (£75)
Postage to customers (£980+)
Notebooks, postcards etc for perks (£170)
Launch party (£100)
Copy-editing and proof-reading (in-kind support)
Front cover design and type-setting (in-kind support)
I only start making money once 60 books are sold…
Contingency in case of any fuck-ups (10% - £380)
My perks are that you get the book. First. There may also be some nice personal messages and random stuff that I’ll throw in there too.I’m only releasing real paper copies at this stage because the book has been designed to be written on, carried around and flipped through again and again. I could have made it cheaper, but I've chosen quality instead. I want it to be one of those books you like to hold on to. It’s not a short collection of essays, it is 73,000 words printed in an 8x10 inch book.This is a huge deal for me because I’ve never written a book before! My goal from writing all these words is make you an even more awesome improviser. If this first print goes well I get to expand my horizons and sell the book – as well as my teaching and shows - to new corners of the world.The ImpactThis is a different improv book. I don’t believe in one philosophy of improv; each one is valuable and you can pick and choose from what you learn to discover your improv superpowers and continue to have the best time on stage (or wherever you improvise).Despite this being my first book, I have been writing an improv blog since 2011 which gets thousands of hits on every article. I have performed and/or taught improv in Holland, Greece, Spain, Belgium, France, Ireland, Scotland, Germany, Sweden, Iceland, Portugal, Estonia, Finland, Sweden, Italy and the USA many of which I’ve been to multiple times.I am the Artistic Director of the award-winning Maydays who have been performing and teaching since 2004, I also teach with Hoopla, which is the UK’s most popular improv school. The thing is, people always want a little more, to know what to do next when the course or the festival finishes, when I’m no longer there to help out or answer questions. Hopefully this will be an affordable way for everyone to keep working on their improv with a group or on their own; alongside, instead of or in-between other training.I’ve been working with many people who have been giving their services and advice in kind. Fred Deakin generously designed the front cover and typeset the book and Victoria Hogg copy-edited, proof-read and provided constructive insight, both over many painstaking hours to get the book to the final stage where we are ready to print. All we need now is for you to pledge your money to buy a signed first edition copy.This book is me reaching out. I want to make improv as inclusive and friendly as I possibly can and connect with even more improvisers from all over the world.Risks & ChallengesI have never published a book before, so that’s scary. I am lucky enough to have had loads of friends give me professional advice and work on the practical stuff to get the book looking and reading great and being published just for you.We have a time-crunch! With me and my team doing improv around the world all summer we’ve been working as fast as we can in different time zones to get this ready in time for the Maydays Improv Retreat. Almost one year ago at the same gathering, John Cremer handed me his most recent book and I vowed to write my own before the next retreat. That means pressing the first edition button on 13th September. Not only will I get my wish, but I’ll save postage for up to 60 people and have a soft launch with a bunch of excellent improvisers and friends.Other Ways You Can HelpWhether or not you can contribute financially, the only way people will hear about the book is if we tell them. I would love for you to get the word out to all the other improv groups and individuals you know about the book.I’d love it if you told them in your own words, but if you don’t have time, here is a template message you can use:Veteran improviser (and now my friend) @katyschutte has just written an improv workbook. Order a limited first edition copy by 13th September! https://igg.me/at/theimproviserswayIf you can’t afford to pledge money but still want to get improv advice, my blog is still out there to read for free and I’ll continue to answer as many questions as possible.Thanks for listening, getting the word out and following me!

story:
Zdravo svima! Mi smo tri prijateljice: Amila Hrustić Batovanja, Hatidža Gušić i Masha Durkalić. Priču #ŽeneBiH započele smo spontano u martu 2018. godine, nakon razgovora u zajedničkom chatu na Facebooku. U tom momentu nalazile smo se na tri različite lokacije u svijetu (Prag–Sarajevo–Reykjavik); grupni chat nam je bio način da ostanemo u kontaktu.

Tokom jednog od naših razgovora (bio je 1. mart 2018. godine), pričale smo o tome na koje se sve načine obilježavaju 8. mart i Mjesec ženske historije (#WomensHistoryMonth) i skreće pažnja na borbu za rodnu ravnopravnost.  Razgovarajući o tome kako društvo slavi žene koje su doprinijele ovoj borbi, shvatile smo da se o izuzetnim ženama iz BiH vrlo malo govori. Željele smo napraviti nešto da to promijenimo, i pala nam je na pamet ideja da svakog dana marta, na našim ličnim profilima na društvenim mrežama, dijelimo po jedan vizual 30 žena iz BiH, sa pratećim mini biografijama – u nadi da će te priče doći do što više ljudi. 

Već narednog dana, 2. marta, na društvenim mrežama objavile smo prvi vizual sa kratkom biografijom Stake Skenderove, prve učiteljice i socijalne radnice u BiH. Za ovu malu kampanju izabrale smo žene koje su bile pionirke u svojim oblastima djelovanja, koje su se zalagale za emancipaciju i rodnu ravnopravnost, te koje su i nama bile inspirativne ličnosti. Ljudi su vrlo brzo počeli dijeliti ove sadržaje, te nam predlagati i druge žene o kojima bismo mogle pisati. Uskoro su se sa upitima počeli javljati i mediji, i priča se proširila dalje od naših privatnih profila na društvenim mrežama.

Reakcije na društvenim mrežama bile su mnogobrojne, pozitivne i ohrabrujuće. Vidjele smo da ljudi žele znati više o ovim ženama, kao i o mnogim drugim. No, mart se brzo završio, a mi smo shvatile da mjesec dana nije dovoljno da priče ovih značajnih žena ispričamo na opsežniji način.

Ohrabrene vašim reakcijama i prijedlozima, projekt smo odlučile proširiti u knjigu #ŽeneBiH – i zato vi ovo sada i čitate. Zamislile smo da knjiga bude zbirka biografija više od 50 žena koje su kroz historiju naše zemlje razbijale stereotipe, unapređivale prava žena, zalagale se za emancipaciju i bile prve u onome što su radile. U priču smo potom uključile i 50 bh. umjetnica, dizajnerica i/ili ilustratorica koje su napravile njihove portrete.

Knjiga #ŽeneBiH je spoj onoga čime se svaka od nas individualno bavi i onoga što nas kao prijateljice veže. Amila je magistrica produkt dizajna i više od sedam godina radi kao art direktorica u oblasti oglašavanja. Hatidža je diplomirana ekonomistica i projekt menadžerica sa dugogodišnjim iskustvom na različitim aktivističkim i feminističkim projektima. Masha je diplomirana novinarka i aktivistkinja koja se godinama bavi pisanjem i istraživanjem o ženama, ženskim pravima i ženskim pokretima. Ono što nas povezuje u ovom projektu su feminizam i principi solidarnosti i ravnopravnosti, prema kojima nastojimo živjeti i djelovati.

U vrijeme kada je ova ideja nastajala i dalje smo sve tri bile na različitim lokacijama u svijetu. Balansirajući vlastite rasporede i obaveze, svakodnevno smo komunicirale, istraživale, pisale, skicirale i dogovarale svaki detalj ove knjige.

Žene koje su mijenjale historiju BiH svakodnevno padaju u zaborav. Svjedočimo tome da je njihova imena nemoguće pronaći u školskim udžbenicima. Dokazi o njihovom postojanju gube se u savremenoj kulturi, a po njima su rijetko nazvani gradski trgovi, škole ili ulice. Mi želimo ispričati njihove priče, pokazati njihova lica i prisjetiti se njihovih postiguća. Podrškom knjizi #ŽeneBiH doprinosite oživljavanju naslijeđa ovih žena, kao i povećanju njihove vidljivosti.

Naš angažman na ovoj knjizi je u potpunosti volonterski, ali za izdavanje ove knjige potrebna su nam finansijska sredstva. Raduje nas što smo već uspjele prikupiti 49% sredstava za knjigu, zahvaljujući ličnim finansijskim investicijama pojedinaca i pojedinki, kao i podrškom sponzora/ica. Ovom kampanjom želimo prikupiti preostalih 51% finansijskih sredstava, kako bismo obezbijedile honorare za ilustratorice, lektoricu i ostale saradnice.

Potrudile smo se da ono što nudimo odgovara realnim cijenama, i da svako pronađe ponešto za sebe ili svoje prijatelje/ice, članove/ice porodice i kolege/ice.

Želimo izdati najmanje 500 primjeraka ove knjige, stoga jezgru ponude čini upravo knjiga #ŽeneBiH. Naš cilj je da se ova knjiga nađe u vašim domovima i javnim bibliotekama, te da vam približi fascinantne žene zbog kojih smo sve ovo i započele.

Što više donirate – mi vas više darujemo, pa tako u u kombinaciji sa knjigom nudimo i naljepnice, bedževe i torbe. Uz to imamo i specijalne ponude u ograničenoj količini – broševe sa minijaturnim portretima deset žena iz knjige, koje je izradila umjetnica Selma Mahmutović, te društvenu igricu Strašne žene. Tu su i posebne prednosti za one koji budu htjeli imati personalizirano izdanje knjige, a tokom kampanje predstavit ćemo i nove ponude.

Vjerujemo da ćete nam pomoći da postignemo naš postavljeni cilj i izdamo knjigu #ŽeneBiH.

Ovu inicijativu započele smo želeći da napravimo doprinos vidljivosti žena BiH i da ohrabrimo slične edukativne inicijative. Uložile smo svoje vrijeme, trud, talente i emocije. Uspjele smo doći ovako daleko samo zahvaljujući svakodnevnom angažmanu, predanosti i vjeri u ovu ideju. Ispred nas je još mnogo istraživanja i rada kako bismo knjigu finalizirale do planiranog roka.

Ova knjiga slavi žene koje su odlučile da se školuju onda kada to ženama nije bilo dozvoljeno, koje su bile (i jesu) ambasadorice bh. umjetnosti i kulture u svijetu; koje su se zalagale za ženska prava u vrijeme kada ona uopće nisu postojala; koje su položile svoje živote za borbu protiv fašizma; koje su postigle svjetske uspjehe u poljima svog djelovanja i koje su bile ili jesu jedno od najvećih blaga koje BiH ima.

Podržavajući izdavanje knjige #ŽeneBiH na bilo koji od izabranih načina, pomoći ćete nam da proširimo znanje o ovim ženama, kako bi njihova imena i njihovo naslijeđe postali poznati svima, te ćete doprinijeti očuvanju i oživljavanju ženske historije koja je nepravedno zapostavljena. Konačno, svojim doprinosom realizaciji knjige #ŽeneBiH omogućavate da buduće generacije djevojčica i dječaka budu upoznate sa naslijeđem ovih izuzetnih žena, koje su svojim radom i zalaganjem zadužile sve nas.

Od početka smo znale da ćemo se suočiti sa brojnim poteškoćama, jer nismo imale nikakav unaprijed obezbijeđen budžet, niti ikakvu sigurnost da će knjiga koju pravimo ikada ugledati svjetlo dana. Susrele smo se sa raznim pitanjima i komentarima, kojima su ljudi propitivali to da li smo sigurne da mi ovo možemo. Da – sigurne smo da mi ovo možemo, zato što želimo. Bez obzira na ishod kampanje, mi ćemo pronaći način da knjigu objavimo.

Uprkos tome što smo u realizaciju projekta uložile vlastito vrijeme, i pored radnih obaveza i ostalih životnih okolnosti, uspjele smo kreirati inicijativu baziranu na solidarnosti i suradnji koja je okupila ljude iz BiH, ali i šire. Ono što nam je pomoglo da istrajemo bila je kontinuirana podrška brojnih ljudi koji su nam se javljali, nudili nam svoju pomoć i motivirali nas da nastavimo.

Potrudile smo se da rizike minimiziramo koliko god je moguće, stoga putem ove kampanje prikupljamo pola iznosa potrebnog za izdavanje knjige. Ipak, ne možemo biti potpuno sigurne da će kampanja biti uspješna, ali vjerujemo da možemo računati na vašu podršku koju smo imale i do sada.

Razumijemo da nisu svi/e u situaciji da finansijski doprinesu realizaciji ove knjige. #ŽeneBiH možete podržati i na druge načine:

  • proslijedite ovu kampanju prijateljima/cama i poznanicima/ama putem e-maila;
  • podijelite kampanju na svojim društvenim mrežama
  • pratite #ŽeneBiH na društvenim mrežama Facebook Twitter Instagram

 

Pomozite nam da ove žene učinimo dijelom historije kojoj one ravnopravno pripadaju!

Ukoliko imate pitanja u vezi knjige #ŽeneBiH, kontaktirajte nas na info@zenebih.ba

 

Overview: The book #ŽeneBiH is an artistic, activist and research initiative that is comprised of biographies of over 50 BiH women who have broken stereotypes and advocated women’s rights and emancipation. Each woman was illustrated by a different woman illustrator/designer/artist from BiH. This is a book about first female artists, writers, poets,  social workers, national heroines, directors, scientists, musicians, doctors, activists, professors, deans, pilots and even soccer referees.

Greetings to all! We are three friends: Amila Hrustić Batovanja, Hatidža Gušić and Masha Durkalić. We began #ŽeneBiH story spontaneously in March 2018, after a group chat on Facebook. In that moment we were on three different locations in the world (Prague – Sarajevo – Reykjavik) and this group chat was our way of staying in touch.

During one of our conversations (it was March 1, 2018), we have discussed the ways #WomensHistoryMonth was being celebrated in terms of gender equality around the world. During this conversation, we have realized that in our home country women’s achievements and their strength are rarely, almost never on the public agenda. We wanted to start changing that for at least a month, and we decided to make our own social media campaign by sharing visuals with photos and biographies of remarkable BiH women, posting a story on a different woman each day, hoping that the stories will reach at least our friends and followers. The following day (March 2, 2018) we have posted our first visual with a short biography and photo of Staka Skenderova, the first teacher and social worker from BiH.

For this social media campaign, we have chosen women who were pioneers in their fields, who have advocated emancipation and gender equality, and who were an inspiration to us. Soon after the first visual was posted, people have started sharing it on their own profiles, and suggesting other remarkable women, the media followed, and the story went on beyond our personal social media profiles.

The positive reactions on social media were overwhelming, people were supportive and encouraged us to continue with our work. After the last visual was posted we came to realization that one month is not enough to celebrate all the women’s accomplishments and we wanted to continue sharing stories about these and more amazing women.

Encouraged by your reactions and suggestions, we have decided to expand this project into a book #ŽeneBiH and this is the reason you are now reading these lines. Our vision is that this book should be a collection of biographies of over 50 women who have broken stereotypes, advocated gender equality and emancipation, and were pioneers in their field of work. We have included 50 female BiH artists, designers and/or illustrators who have made unique portraits of these remarkable women.

The book #ŽeneBiH is a combination of our individual professional backgrounds and our friendship. Amila has a master’s degree in product design, and more than seven years of experience as an art director in advertising. Hatidža is an economist and a project manager with a feminist background leading projects on women’s empowerment. Masha is a journalist, researcher and an activist who has been writing and researching in the field of women’s human rights, women empowerment and feminist movements. The bond that binds us is feminism and principles of solidarity and equality we honor and live by.

In the time of the conception of this idea we were at three different locations in the world. By balancing our own schedules and responsibilities, we have communicated daily with each other, researched, wrote, drafted and visualized each detail of this book.

Women who have changed and shaped the history of BiH are being forgotten. We bear witness to them falling into oblivion and being erased from textbooks. The evidence of their existence is lost in modern culture, and we can rarely see a street, city square or a building named after one of them. We want to tell their stories, show their faces and honor their achievements. By supporting #ŽeneBiH you are contributing to the revival and visibility of their achievements.

Our work on this book is entirely voluntary, but we need funds in order to publish the book itself. We are pleased to have already secured 49% of the funds required for the book, thanks to individual personal donations, as well as the support of our sponsors. This campaign aims to collect the remaining 51% of the needed funds, in order to secure the fees for the illustrators, the proofreader, and other associates.

We made sure that our perks correspond to actual prices, and that everybody can find something for themselves, or their friends, family, and colleagues.

We wish to print at least 500 copies of this book, which means that the core perk is the #ŽeneBiH book itself. Our goal is that this book finds its place in your homes and public libraries, and to help you get to know the remarkable women who inspired us to embark on this journey.

The more you donate - the more we give in return, so the perks are a combination of the book and stickers, buttons, or tote bags. We also have a limited special offer - brooches with miniature portraits of ten women featured in the book created by artist Selma Mahmutović, as well as the Fierce Women card game. There are special perks for those of you who would like to own a personalized copy of the book, and we will be introducing even more perks during the campaign.

We believe that you will help us achieve our goal and make our dream of publishing this book come true.

We started this initiative wishing to contribute to the visibility of women in Bosnia and Herzegovina, and to encourage similar educational initiatives. We have invested our time, effort, talents, and emotions. We have made it this far thanks to everyday engagement, commitment, and our faith in this idea. We still have a lot of research and work ahead of us in order to finalize the book by the set deadline.

This book celebrates women who decided to pursue education even when women were not allowed to do so, who were (and are) ambassadors of BiH art and culture in the world, the women who promoted women’s rights at a time when they did not even exist, women who gave their lives in the fight against fascism, women who have achieved worldwide fame in their respective fields of work, and those who were or are one of the greatest treasures of BiH.

By supporting the publication of the book #ŽeneBiH in any way, you will help us spread the knowledge about these women, in order to make their names, accomplishments and heritage known to all, and contribute to the preservation and invigoration of the unjustly disregarded female history. Finally, with your contribution to making the book #ŽeneBiH possible, you are making sure that future generations of girls and boys will get to know the names and accomplishments of these extraordinary women, whose work and commitment indebted all of us.

Ever since the beginning, we knew that we will face numerous challenges, since we had no previously secured budget, or any certainty that the book we were creating will ever see the light of day. We encountered many inquiries and comments from people questioning whether we were sure we could do this. Yes - we are sure we can do this, because we want to. Regardless of the campaign’s outcome, we will find a way to publish the book.

Despite investing our own time in this project, even with our own work and personal commitments, we have succeeded in creating an initiative based on solidarity and cooperation that has brought together people from Bosnia and Herzegovina, and beyond. What kept us going was the continued support of many people who have contacted us, offered to help, and motivated us to carry on.

We made sure to minimize the risks as much as possible, so this campaign aims to gather half of the funds required to publish the book. However, we cannot be completely sure that the campaign will be successful, but we are counting on your support that we have had so far.

We are aware that not everyone can financially contribute to this project. You can also support #ŽeneBiH in other ways:

  • email the news about this campaign to your friends and acquaintances
  • share the campaign on your social media profiles
  • follow #ŽeneBiH on  Facebook Twitter Instagram

Help us make these women a part of history they rightfully belong to!

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at info@zenebih.ba
