中文点击这里. Click here for Chinese.

People are strange. Kids are stranger.
Hi, I’m josh. I am a teacher and photographer (jbeardfoto.com) living in Beijing, China. My work has been published in both America and Asia, and I have taught creativity training courses to all ages from toddlers to adult professionals. I'm also a kung-fu master at Mario Kart. That's me on my creative thinking chair. ;~).I run a blog called Strange Tiny People, which is all about how kids are pretty punk rock, and deserve a lot more respect than we often give them. If you think kids stuff is, well, kids stuff, then maybe there’s a problem with what we’re giving them. They deserve a better quality of education that, rather than assuming we know what they need, helps them to control the storm of ideas and creation already going on inside of them. Bella here finds your patty-cake to be severely lacking in power-chords.
That's why I have started the Strange Tiny People project, where I’ll be traveling to places all over Asia, helping train underprivileged children in creativity and story telling. These children are then going to use their stories to help me create a book, filled with their ideas, and their stories. Their stories will be accompanied by photographic illustrations, that I’ll shoot using the children themselves as the subjects. The kids will keep full copyright and credit of their creations. This is their first published gig, and hopefully the first of many in the future! Some Stories are short and happy, like this: Some have a powerful geo-political message, like this:And some are outright frightening, like this:(STP promotes creativity in all forms, and sees censorship as creativity asphyxiation.)Why Asia?In truth, this project is meant for everyone, of every culture, economic class, and cookie preference. Asia is simply the most available to me at this moment.From my years in the Chinese education system, I have seen that, unfortunately, Asian education often omits creativity and exploration learning in lieu of producing higher test scores and uniformity. While there is definitely a place for tradition and cohesiveness in culture, education that neglects personal identity in order to conform to rigid standards often leads to people who tend to follow orders instead of finding ways to produce results. I want to show that, through creative thinking, followers become leaders and produce much more for their society. Strange Tiny People is meant to be accessible to all children, and I very much intend to eventually visit as many possible locations and spread as much awesome as my feet will carry me. This is just the first leg on this journey, kiddos.
So, You're Helping Poor Kids To Become Starving Artists?...Creativity isn't just about artistic ability. People with a conditioned creative mind are able to realize different ways of solving problems, socialize and empathize with others, and are more open to very often unnoticed opportunities. From inventing the next cool gadget, to becoming an awesome painter, running for political office, or just making the best fried rice in town, creativity is often what separates being merely proficient in a skill and being a friggin Jedi Master at it.  You can't instruct creativity from a text book. It's a skill, and thus requires exercise to perform well, just like any muscle in an athlete's body. Once properly trained and conditioned, creativity becomes natural, and finds it's way into every thought, idea, and decision. You know those guys that seem like they just have it together, and make things seem easy where you're always struggling? Jobs, Picasso, Curie, Waits, Page, Tessla, Chopin, Spike. Those are the guys who have put in the time training their brains to work creatively. Now imagine these guys have had this training instilled since they were children. That's the kind of people I know I want for the next generation. Where is your dough going?   Does a $6k goal seem really low for a project involving almost a year of travel?? Like, really really low??  Like, that’s less than what McDonald’s pays their part time cashiers for a year???That’s because it is. For the past year, I have been saving my own personal money, taking extra jobs and dancing around on fire (no, really), and eating like a freshman college student (noodles, Asia, yeah). This venture will be funded with my money equally along with yours. You didn’t think I would just throw all that burden on your shoulders, did you? 





As a professional photographer, I have most of the equipment needed for high-end portraiture like this, however there are some specific travel-friendly equipment that is needed to do a project where there is a lot of location changing, especially when it’s all carried on my back! :*( . This equipment also needs to be insured. 



Transportation is the largest cost, but I'm keeping it down by only using non-flight transportation. Besides, you meet so many more cool people via trains/ buses/ boats/ cow.






Still have questions? Have an organization that you would like STP to teach at? Want to volunteer as an assistant? Then YOU RAWK! Head over to the FAQ on the website for more info:  http://www.strangetinypeople.com/faq/Perks:Let's talk about the cool schwag you get. Choose from these 4 images:Too strapped for cash/cheap for these top levels? No problem, take a collection with your friends so you can all reap the rewards. Scalp tickets and make some bonus profit. I don't care. I want to help you, use me.
If The Goal Isn't Met..OK, so this project is happening, one way or another. I've already been in contact with dozens of charities, low-income schools, and orphanage over many countries. We're going forward. Kids are gonna get awesome(r). I'll juggle irritated badgers on the street for cash if I have to.The difference your funding makes is how long it goes on. With only my personal money, it won't last long, and there are a lot of kids who will miss out on a lot of opportunities. It's also possible that this book will never make it into anyone's hands, and these guys' stories will never be heard. Other Ways You Can Help"But Josh, I have no monies!", you might be saying. First: Yes you do. Look, right there to your right, a nickel! (if not, keep looking. It's gotta be there). Point being, everyone has some cash they don't think they have, and every little bit helps. Donate whatever you can. Skip the Arby's drive-through once this week to make up for it. You'll be skinnier and you helped change kids lives. BAZZAM! Double-Karma-Kung-Fu-Madness.Second: If you still feel like that Arby's is more important than a starving child's future (ok ok, those Jamocha shakes really are off the chain), then there is still a way you can help: SHARE THIS THING LIKE MONO.Use your social might! Tweet, like the Facebook, spread the Google+, or write a blog post!Earn a FREE copy of the book by spreading the word! (more on the contest soon)Have a blog about children or photography? Own a news outlet? Work for a radio station? Have a community mahjong group?? Willing to bug your kids' elementary class??? Contact me at josh@strangetinypeople.com . I'd love to be a guest! And of course, all publicity is equally reciprocated on my page. Finally,With all tongue-in-cheek and humour aside. I thank you.I want to see this happen more than anything I have ever done in my life. You get very few precious times in your life where you feel like "this is absolutely what I'm supposed to be doing". Every bit you do to help this happen is a drop of hope for me and everyone I can help due to you. You are more important to more people than you will ever know.~Josh.





中文:
人奇怪，孩奇丽.
大家好，我是Josh。 我是老师也是摄影师（jbeardfoto.com）。我的作品在美国及亚洲发表，而且我所教的创造力训练课程，课程对象为各年龄段从幼儿到成人的专业人士。我也是一个马里奥电子游戏功夫大师。:D这是我的创意座位。 ;~) 

我有一张博客叫 Strange Tiny People, 是关于孩子可以相当的朋克，还值得我们更多的尊敬。如果你觉得孩子的东西很没意思，也许我们就应该重新考虑我们给他们的东西。孩子们应当有更好质量的教育，而不是我们去假设他们需要什么。我们要帮助他们开发他们心里的本来就有的想法和创造力。 安琪觉得你的《ABC‘s》被严重缺乏金属甩头。

这就是为什么我开展 Strange Tiny People 项目。我将旅行到很多亚洲地方给贫困儿童教创意和讲故事的方法。然后，这些孩子们将用他们自己的故事来帮助我建立一本书。他们的故事将伴随摄影插图。我将使用孩子本身为拍摄主角。孩子们将继续他们的作品的全部版权和信贷。这是他们第一次出版“违规记录”，而且希望成为许多在未来！
有一些故事是短的和开心的，就像这样：有一些拥有强大地缘政治消息,就像这样：


还有一些真的很可怕，就像这样：
（Strange Tiny People 提倡各种形式的创意，并认为审查使创造力窒息。）

为什么亚洲？
事实上这个项目旨在为所有儿童，每一种文化，每一种经济阶级，每一种饼干偏好。亚洲是目前对我最可用的。
从我多年在中国的教育体系，我所看到的，不幸的是，亚洲的教育常常忽略了创造性和探索性的学习方法以代替生产更高的测试分数和均匀性. 虽然传统和凝聚力的文化当然很重要，教育不重视自己的个性，以符合严格的标准，经常引起人们遵循，而不是想出办法来产生结果的订单。我想表明，通过创造性思维，追随者成为领导者，并为他们的社会产生更多的创造力。
Strange Tiny People是为了能够访问所有的孩子，我打算最终会参观尽可能多的可能的地点和分布尽可能多的真棒的想法。
这是我们的旅程的第一站，小子！你在帮助穷孩子们当饥饿艺术家?...
创意不只是艺术表现能力。人具有较强的创造性思维能找到不同的方法来解决问题，社交和同情他人，并更细心常常被忽视的机会。
从发明下一个超酷的小工具，成为一个真棒画家，竞选政治职位，或者只做城里最好的炒饭, 创意常常是区别仅仅精通一门技能，并成为大师吧。
创意思维就像一块肌肉，固化的思维方式会让大脑很多创意的部分得不到更多的训练. 跟运动员一样，如果他好好锻炼，他的肌肉会一直准备好了能用，因为他的肌肉训练好了，就是自动的。跑步，抬重的东西，打斗， 这样的很容易。所以我的课不是教孩子什么想法很创意什么不创意，我的课就教他们怎么把他们的脑子给锻炼。
这个课程会帮助孩子们开阔他们的思路，用更多的视角和方式看世界，训练他们平常可能不注意的创意思维。Jobs
, 
Picasso
, 
沈括
, 
左小祖咒
, 
艾未未
, 
Tessla
, 
Chopin
, 
姜文

. 

那些是已经投入时间训练他们的大脑创造性地工作的家伙。 
现在想象一下，这些家伙小时候有受过这个训练的话。我希望人类的下一代是这样的人。
还有问题吗？你想STP任教于你的组织？希望志愿担任助理？那么你是真牛！
到网站上的常见问题解答的详细信息：http://www.strangetinypeople.com/faq/

如果目标是不符合.. 
是这样的，这个项目会发生，这样或那样。我已经接触过很多慈善机构，低收入的学校，孤儿院在许多国家。我们正在前进。孩子会变得更棒。
您的资助措施将决定这个项目进展多长时间。只有我个人的钱，也不会持续很长时间，会有很多孩子错过很多机会。这也有可能这本书将永远不会被公布，孩子们的故事将永远不会被听到。其他的方法可以帮助

第一个事：错了，你有。你看，在那儿你身边，一块钱！（没有？请继续寻找）。关键是，每个人都有一些他们不认为他们有的现金，每一点是很有帮助的。捐赠任何你能负担得起。跳过麦当劳的这个星期一次。你会减肥，而你帮助改变孩子们的生活。哇！双赢！
第二个事：如果你还觉得麦当劳比一个饥饿的孩子的未来更重要（好好，那奶昔真的美味的），还有一种方法可以帮助：分享此活动！
•  用社交网络！人人，QQ，微博，微信， Facebook, Twitter, or write a blog post!

与所有的幽默预留。我感谢你。
我希望这个项目的发生比任何我生命中的事都重要，你曾经也说不定经历过这种感觉。任何一点你的帮助都是实现我梦想的基石，每一个我可能帮助的小孩也都归功于你。
你比你所知道的更重要。

story:
The Journey to Waveland

In 1964, over a thousand volunteers, including many college students, went to Mississippi to call attention to that state’s brutal repression of African Americans.  They taught in Freedom Schools and helped register voters for an inclusive “Mississippi Freedom Democratic Party” in the hope of challenging the legitimacy of the all-white Mississippi delegates at the Democratic Convention in Atlantic City.

Waveland is the name of a town in Mississippi where activists from the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee (SNCC) gathered in the aftermath of 1964’s Freedom Summer to discuss the future of what they called “the Movement”.  After Atlantic City, they’d lost all faith in conventional politics, but what other politics existed?  In the words of legendary organizer Bob Moses, they were on a boat in the middle of the ocean, and their boat had to be rebuilt to stay afloat and had to stay afloat in order to be rebuilt; and to complicate matters, because they were in the middle of the ocean, they would have to build the boat themselves. 

The Journey to the novel Waveland 

Simone Zelitch’s forthcoming novel Waveland (The Head and the Hand Press 2015) grew out of her fascination with SNCC, an interracial “beloved community” that had its origins in the student lunch counter sit-ins that spread throughout the South.  SNCC rejected top-down leadership and compromise, and served as a model for the great liberation movements of the ’60s and ’70s.   

Yet the novel also begins with a bedtime story:  “Once there was a girl who does everything wrong.” Years after Freedom Summer Beth Fine — who is white and Jewish — tells her daughter about the time she participated in a wade-in to segregate a pool without knowing how to swim; or the time she drove down a Mississippi highway, hit a cow, and ended up in jail for prostitution.  Beth believes in questioning authority, but as her commitment to the Movement deepens, the questions begin to change, and the nature of authority becomes harder to determine. The summer ends, and Beth remains, struggling to find a place as a white ally in an organization increasingly under siege and adrift. 

Simone has always been fascinated by people and events that have been written out of history: medieval peasants who want to turn the world upside-down; biblical heretics who challenge the authority of Moses and Aaron. Her 2001 novel, Louisa, follows a bitter, chain-smoking holocaust survivor and her German daughter-in-law to the newly established state of Israel and explores the contradictions and challenges of Zionism and displacement and the nature of forgiveness.  

When we first created The Head and the Hand Press, we defined the style of books we want to publish as “those that have the power to change and entertain.”  We were instantly drawn into the vulnerability, introspection, strength and courage of Beth Fine. And we were equally compelled with the struggles and triumph of the characters in the world Beth inhabits, fighting each day for basic human rights and democratic principles. And we could not be more honored to bring this novel to the world and add the story of Beth to the legacy of SNCC and Freedom Summer. 

How You Can Help Us On This Journey 

The passionate and talented staff of The Head & The Hand Press have been working with Simone on this book for almost a year, doing second, third, and fourth readings, as well as collaborating with Simone on our signature design process that has come to define our books. Through our attention to detail, we strive to create a physical reading experience that matches the intellectual experience the author intended when she conceived the book. And now we need your help to raise the remaining funds to send this book to the printer.

In addition to defraying the printing expenses, we will use part of the funds we raise to send Simone with copies of Waveland to the Jewish Book Council for its upcoming conference, where she will have the opportunity join its network of authors. As each major Civil Rights anniversary passes, Jewish organizations have been finding ways to celebrate the disproportionate number of Jews who volunteered in Mississippi Freedom Schools or marched with Martin Luther King in Selma.Waveland is one of the few novels to focus on the role of Jews in the Movement, and if Simone attends the conference, she will have an opportunity to pitch Waveland to representatives from synagogues, Jewish community centers and book fairs, and festivals from across the country. 

If sending Waveland to the Jewish Book Council matters to you, please explore those contributor packages. If you simply want to hold this book in your hand and read the story, we hope you find something appealing among all of the other great contributor packages we are offering, such as the vintage Mississippi postcards that Simone will mail to you with a personal note during her trip to Hebron in the West Bank this summer.

Although we feel books are still the most powerful medium to bring stories like Waveland to the world, the costs of printing are becoming increasingly prohibitive as publishing enters the digital age. But as we hope you agree, a book doesn’t need to be plugged in or downloaded on expensive equipment. A book can easily be passed into the hands of anyone, no matter who they are or where they come from, and that book can change a person’s life. It’s a combination of your support and our creative approach to publishing literature that gets these books to print, and puts them into the hands of our readers. And we at The Head & The Hand Press thank you for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are compelled, but unable to make a contribution at this time, there are many ways that you can help us:

• Spread the Word Please keep up with this page and The Head & The Hand’s page to attend and tell your networks about our reading events, promotions and reviews of Waveland

• Bring Simone and Waveland to Your Community We are always looking for opportunities for Simone to share Waveland. If you would like to discuss an event or other media opportunity, please contact Claire Margheim at press@theheadandthehand.com. 

Simone's Previous Work and Distinctions 

Simone Zelitch's previous books include Louisa, which gained a starred review from Publishers Weekly and Kirkus as well as praise from the New York Times. She also the author of Moses in Sinai and The Confession of Jack Straw. Once a Peace Corps Volunteer in Hungary, Simone is now a professor at the Community College of Philadelphia where she coordinates the English Degree and established the Creative Writing Certificate Program.

story:
Short Summary

So here is the deal, I am a combat veteran, writer and artist. I was also the Subject of the documentary Poster Girl. 

I started to use art and writing as a means of healing and processing my experiences with war and PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder.)

My poems have been published in other people's books and my art has been shown in other exhibits and even printed in text books( yes I am purposely trying to make myself sound good so you'll fund me). I want to create a book of my own to have my own space for my own representation of my experiences. I have written some very visceral poems and prose regarding my time in war and as a struggling veteran. I've created some amazing thought provoking art as well. With "I Was There Too" I will be pairing that writing with visual art inspired by them. IE; paintings, photos, sculpture, and mixed media. As the bulk of the writing for it is already done, around 90%) I'm raising funds to cover the cost of art supplies, and then self publishing costs. Which include editing, printing, reviewing and then paying to have copies made.

I hope to set an example for other veterans that our voices matter, and also to change the traditional gender narrative of war.

What I Need 

I need approximately $7500 U.S dollars to cover the cost of art supplies, publishing, reviewing and editing. 

If I don't reach my goal and am unable to publish, I will keep a small portion for my own art supplies and donate the rest to other art programs for veterans. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • If you can't dontate thats ok! You can contribute by sharing my fundraiser, commenting on the campaign or helping spread the word. 
  • You can follow me on twitter @robynnlm and help me spread updates about new perks and special offers. You can also view my instagram RiotRobynn to see my campaign in action. I also have a Facebook group "I Was There Too."
  • OH! and.....comment, comment, comment! The more comments on my campaign, means the more recognizable it becomes.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
About

Hi! My name is Jenny Jo and I have a Reiki Healing Practice in Northwest Washington. I also do Crystal Psychic Readings and Clairvoyant Counseling sessions in person and by phone.

I just started writing this year and one of my pre-published works has already won an award! http://chantireviews.com/

However, I set aside my award-winning manuscript (a middle-grades fantasy series) to write this book: Create Powerful Stone Oracles. I want to share my knowledge on how to connect with the energy of stones for the purpose of doing psychic readings, because the more we intentionally connect our energy with other beings and with the earth (including stones), the more we raise the universal collective consciousness on our planet.

My dream is to teach workshops on this subject and have my students use this book as a tool to develop their own powerful oracles. With a little help from you, my friends, I'll get there!

What I Need 

Meeting my $500 goal will ensure that my book gets published, with a custom cover, required editing & formatting and a high quality ISBN barcode.

Priorities:

1) ISBN                     $125
2) Cover Design    $200 - $300
3) Editing                 $0 - $200
4) Formatting         $0 - $200

Cover Design notes: I have a good friend who is a genius with graphic design, but expensive...and it seems I always want the difficult stuff - because it's the most awesome!

Editing notes: I have been using/abusing a good friend's generous offer of editing, but I really ought to pay her.

Formatting notes: I am using a template for the formatting, but I am including lots of photos and they don't really lay out the way I would like them to, so I would love to have some formatting help.

Meeting my stretch-goal of $800 will allow me to invest more in the above priorities which will result in a higher quality book.

Meeting my additional stretch-goal of $1500 will allow me to also combine a west-coast book tour with teaching workshops as I go. I'll be livin' my dream!

    The Perks

    At the conclusion of this campaign I will send every backer a survey to collect the needed information for the perk chosen. All of the perks that require mailing should arrive before Christmas and include USPS to the lower 48 states.

    Perks explained in detail with pictures:

    1) Blessing
         I will use my healing skills to send a full 5 minutes of blessed energy to you or a loved one of your choice.

    2) Stone Oracle Book
         Hot off the press! You will be one of the very first to see the finished work you helped make possible.

    3) Rune Stones KIT #1
         Get the book plus a set of 10 blank beach stones, hand-chosen and ready for you to create your own inspired set of Runes (like the ones shown here) with symbols that have meaning for you.  This KIT is a great choice for those who do not have easy access to smooth, flat 1.5" stones.

    4) Layout KIT #2
         Includes the book and a designer Jenny Jo layout to cast your oracle stones on. The Triple-Subject side is printed cotton and the other side is luxurious recycled velvet (in a surprise color).

    5) Wisdom KIT #3
         A combination of KIT #1 & #2, the Wisdom KIT is perfect for those who want the designer Jenny Jo layout and want to get started on their own set of Inspired Runes right away, but do not have easy access to smooth, flat 1.5" stones.
      6) Psychic Reading/Spiritual Coaching
           Recently I had a client come to me for a 30 minute Crystal Reading, after a very full 75 minutes he was so moved by the value of our time together that he wrote me a blank check.
           Get a reading yourself or give it as a gift. We will make an appointment to connect over the phone and I will dedicate an entire hour to answering your questions. It's okay if you don't know what your questions are, just share your thoughts or concerns and be open to receiving the wealth of insight that is provided.
      7) Professional Reader KIT #4

story:
The Plea:

Let me get down to it. You're all wondering what kind of shenanigan I'm attempting to pull on the day of my 27th birthday. Some of you know me well, some of you think you do, and to some of you I'm just that girl on Twitter. Regardless, I have a story and it's a wild one. 

I've invited you here because I'm an experienced and disciplined writer currently working on my first book, and get ready: it's a memoir. Let's be real. Literary agents and book publishers aren't exactly seeking out first-time authors who aren't celebrities or the children of celebrities to offer book deals, and I've so far unsuccessfully navigated my way through the exceptionally rare world of government grants for new authors. The best way to get a grant or a publishing deal to cover the full costs associated with writing a novel is to be an author with previously published works, which makes about as much sense as rolling a snowball in hell.

So this is my plea. Help me get on my way to accomplishing my goal of publishing this book that I have been working on for three years.  Since few people like to give something for nothing or for the sheer joy of having helped someone, there are INCENTIVES and REWARDS for you if you do! Yes, I capitalized those words specifically to capture your attention. Ah-ha, a writer's trick!

Firstly, I assure you that I am asking for the bare minimum to get me on my way. If I were able to fund this myself, I of course would do so. For those of you who don't know me, I have been living pay day to pay day since I first moved out on my own at 16, and being seriously ill for three years and unable to work during much of that time ensured a slightly fearsome bit of debt and a drained savings account.  So I come to you with the hope of making this dream a reality, and because in our technologically advanced age, crowdfunding is pretty much socially acceptable. Crowdfunding allows people who believe in a project to donate to it, and in turn they receive incentives and rewards, as well as the satisfaction of knowing they've aided in dreams coming true and careers being formed. 

If the minimum goal is met, amazing. If even more is raised, that would be incredible, because truthfully the costs associated with a first book can be as much as 10x what I'm asking, or more. *IndieGoGo charges me a 9% fee on funds raised IF you don't meet your goal. If you meet your goal, they charge only 4% to me. I will break down a cost estimate below, as well as explain what the immediate needs are, as well as your REWARDS. See, I did it again!

About The Book & Why It Matters:

I'm sure you want to know what kind of book you are supporting, as you should. So here I go. There are maybe five people in the world who know this story in its entirety. Upon telling them, they have all reacted strongly with disbelief, sadness, or awe. The rest who know me merely only know parts, many have made assumptions, and some have believed rumours. But this story is the complete truth of a once-innocent church girl lost in the world of rock and roll, out on her own at 16, touring North America with anyone who would take her as far away from her own reality as she could run. It's exciting, it's heart-wrenching and it's raw. It's the story of how I dealt with sexual abuse, suicide and being a teenage runaway, and ultimately how I came to conquer it all. I managed to change from being a world-hating, broken-hearted pessimist runaway with a mohawk to an optimistic, bright-eyed young woman, and I learned everything (and I mean EVERYTHING) the hard way. Luckily for the reader, that means the stories within are juicier and wilder than one might imagine a small town Canadian girl could ever live through.

Yes, sharing this story is cathartic for me. Yes, this story is guaranteed to entertain you. This is my one big shot at realizing my dream of becoming a published author. And though nearly everyone who has met me has told me to write a book, this book, I hope, will have a much deeper purpose. It is my hope, that above all, sharing my heart and soul will help save others from the brink. Maybe it's self-aggrandizing to think my story can do that, but I know I'm not the only one 

This story is good for a laugh, it's good for a cry, but ultimately, this story is for the people who feel like the biggest screw-ups out there, the ones who have so much to give yet so much pain, the ones who feel lost, invisible, and completely exasperated. It's a story for those who feel like the lowest of the lows, the unlovables, the embarrassments, and the forgotten. It will captivate your heart, it will engage your imagination, but more than anything I want those people to know that if I could survive through this story, they can survive their circumstances. 

Please help me publish this story, because you will love it, and because you are surrounded by these broken people, even if you aren't one yourself. They need to know that the past doesn't have to define their future, and that no matter how deep of a pit they're in, they can always, always, always climb out again and start over. 

I know they can do it, because I did. 

Let me take you on this wild ride that is my true life story.

    Immediate Needs & Costs:

    The immediate needs are listed below. As you will see from the costs outlined, my $3000 is a far cry from the actual costs necessary but will get me well on my way to the editing process at least. If extra is raised, that would be incredible and again, as you will see below, clearly already has a designated use. If somehow I raised more money than I ended up needing, the remainder would be donated to the Kidney Foundation in Canada which is close to my heart due to my kidney health issues. Anything raised will sit in its own bank account to be ready for when the costs come out. 
    The ultimate goal is for a literary agent to shop the book to a publisher, but if that method failed I would self-publish, most likely through Amazon or a similar competitor. The book is about two months out from being sent to my editor. Keep in mind that the time frame for the book being published is fluid, and if you are seeking instant gratification as far as the reward or incentive, this may not be the project for you to support. The book should be published within the year at maximum and all will be updated on its progress regularly, with anyone free to see photocopies of receipts and exact money spent should they wish.

    IMMEDIATE NEEDS:
    - Laptop (Nothing fancy. My only laptop ever died two years ago, and the book has been largely written on a cracked iPad with limited storage space, by hand, and through journal excerpts which will be included in the book.)
    - External hard drive (You'd think I'd have one, but I've been using old school methods.)
    - Editing costs are listed below and will need to be paid within the next 2-3 months. I do have a general editor, and costs should remain in the low end, fingers crossed.

    FUTURE COSTS WITHIN 2-5 MONTHS:
    Developmental Editing - Anywhere from $2000-20,000+
    Copy Editor - Anywhere from $500-5,000+
    Photography and/or Graphic Design - $100-1000
    Literary Agent - Depends on the agent, but not cheap!

    GENERAL COSTS FOR SELF-PUBLISHING:
    Marketing & PR - Low end $100, High end $5000+
    Distribution Fees - Amazon takes a low percentage of each book distributed
    Book Printing - Not required to pay upfront, but a low cost per individual order
    ISBN (International Standard Book Number) $125

    Incentives & Rewards!

    Any help toward this goal is amazing, no matter the dollar amount or whether it is financial help or anything else, and I so appreciate your efforts more than you could possibly imagine. Below are the rewards offered for donating:

    $30.00 = Autographed Book

    $50.00 = 2 Autographed Books for 1

    $75.00 = Autographed Book, Personalized Letter From Author, a Personalized Thank-You in the Dedication 

    $100.00 = Autographed Book, Personalized Letter From Author, a Personalized Thank-You in the Dedication AND Skype Meeting/Real Life Dinner With The Author (depending on where you live!)

    $150.00 = 2 Autographed Books for 1, Personalized Message, Personalized Thank-You in the Dedication, Skype Meeting/Real Life Dinner With The Author (depending on where you live!)

    $250.00 = 2 Autographed Books, Personalized Letter From Author, Personalized Thank-You In Dedication, Skype Meeting/Real Life Dinner With Author, AND Get To Name A Character!!

    $300.00-500.00 = 3 Autographed Books, Personalized Letter From Author, Personalized Thank-You In Dedication, Skype Meeting/Real Life Dinner W. Author, Name A Character, and a $200.00 Donation To Charity of Your Choice If/When Book Sells 7,000 copies.

    $500-$1000 = 3 Autographed Books, Personalized Letter From Author, Personalized Thank-You in Dedication, Skype Meeting/Real Life Dinner W. Author, Name A Character, a $500.00 Donation To Charity of Your Choice If/When Book Sells 7,000 copies, and my soul.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't make a financial contribution but would like to help in other ways, the best way you can possibly help is by promoting this campaign to everyone you know! The more people who hear about the campaign, the more people are likely to jump on board, and word of mouth is incredibly valuable. 

      Thank you for believing in me!

story:
*****This campaign is now 100% fully funded.  Every book will now include one of the illustrator's specially designed bookmarks. *****

*****First 'stretch' goal: if the campaign reaches 120% funding, I will do an eBook conversion and make it available free of charge to every backer of this campaign.*****

Briefly, what’s it about?

Set in Singapore, this exciting tale blends fantasy and realism as it explores racial and religious prejudice, terrorism and the difficult aspects of growing up.  Shouma Tay is a 13-year-old Singaporean boy with a sweet tooth and a telekinetic gift he wishes to be ‘cured’ of. But when, with the help of his brilliant Jewish friend Elijah, he realizes the extent of his powers, he determines to use them to assist his father, a government security agent, in the fight against a terrorist bent on carrying out an Al-Qaeda-style attack.  Meanwhile, Rei, a mind-reading Japanese international student, is tracking down the robber of a jewellery shop with the assistance of Irwan, a Malay boy who is sensitive to the paranormal.  When the two pairs come together, they uncover some frightening truths … and find themselves with their friendships and even their very lives in danger.

*****You can download the first chapter: use the link below and follow the instructions: happy reading!*****

http://bluegreenocean.deviantart.com/art/Chapter-1-467729249

*****You can listen to a reading of chapter 8: use the link below and follow the instructions!*****
http://bluegreenocean.podbean.com/

Just me

The restless, multicultural environment of On Donuts and Telekinesis is a reflection of my own international life experience.  I have been educated in Singapore and Britain, and have spent time in Brunei and Egypt where my parents lived for many years.  I am currently teaching British Literature at Nanzan University, in Japan, and am a published author, with a work of non-fiction (Coleridge, Revision and Romanticism) out with Bloomsbury Publishing.


This is important because...

As a boy, I loved reading fantasy but was always struck by how ‘white’ the genre was (and to a large extent still remains).  On Donuts and Telekinesis is the multiracial and multicultural fantasy novel that I wanted to write for more than twenty years.

Trying to publish it however was a nightmare.  The literary agents in London who liked the work cooled off when they realized we couldn’t ‘talk about it over lunch’.  My publishing contacts in Nagoya didn’t want a novel from me, but an English language textbook.  When I finally found a publishing company in Singapore that was willing to deal with a faraway author, they ran into financial difficulties and pulled out.


Going to it alone

Well, not exactly, since I've the unstinting support of family and friends, including Andriy Ivanchenko who added the beautiful illustrations to the manuscript free of charge.  But you know what I mean.  The money I'm asking for is to cover the printing costs.  On Donuts and Telekinesis will be published no matter what: I've travelled too far to turn back now.  Anything beyond the US$750 that I've asked for will go towards the artist (Andriy might feel otherwise, but he shouldn't be doing all this for nothing), an electronic edition of the book, promotion and marketing.  This is how it breaks down:

  • US$750: to typeset and print 100 copies
  • US$650: for the artist, ebook conversion, marketing and promotion
  • US$700: printing another 100 copies of the book


What I offer you

For your vote in confidence in this project,

  • autographed copies of the book with a unique handwritten dedication or handwritten note of thanks from me
  • signed art cards and posters exclusive only to the backers of this campaign
  • and more!


Risks and challenges?

None that I foresee: the novel is written.  Furthermore, the publishing company that initially wanted the manuscript has had it professionally proofread.  And, as I’ve said, I’ll publish the book even if I don’t reach the funding target.


How you can help

Please follow the ‘On Donuts and Telekinesis’ page that I’ve set up on Facebook and share it with your friends.  When you’ve read the book, please tell me what you think as I’m working on the follow-up.  Yes, there’s going to be a sequel!

story:
CAPTAIN CAREW'S COLOSSAL INTERGALACTIC ALIEN ZOO is a charming, heartfelt family-friendly adventure (animation) about young Og, a shy and impressionable space cadet with a bad case of hero worship for the legendary Captain Carew, ex-astronaut/alien animal trapper. Carew travels the universe, captures alien animals and puts them on display at his huge zoo/amusement park.  When Og wins a week with Carew, he's  thrilled beyond words. His mother, Lucille...not so much. As a field officer to prevent cruelty to alien animals, she's heard some unpleasant rumors about Carew and his zoo. Lucille reluctantly goes along with Og to the zoo (with an ultimatum from her boss to get the dirt on Carew or she'll lose her job).  But things don't quite go as planned, as a horrified Og  soon discovers that neither Carew nor his zoo are what they appear to be, but no one believes him, not even his best friends, Pooks and Rollie. Even worse, Carew and Lucille fall in love. Can Og find the courage to stand up to the man he admires most in the world,  keep his Mom from making a terrible mistake, and stop an alien invasion? Not to mention anal probes.

I'm the screenwriter of the Emmy nominated, critically acclaimed Showtime original family movie MY HORRIBLE YEAR with Eric Stoltz, Mimi Rogers and Karen Allen. In addition, I have THE TOWN THAT BANNED CHRISTMAS, an indie holiday movie. In addition, I've had short stories, articles and opinion pieces published in a variety of markets.  I'm hard-working, dedicated, and passionate about my craft.

I've contracted Brian, an amazing artist (http://www.jbwilliamsart.com/)  to do a series of illustrations designed to highlight and complement my script. I've already garnered interest in the project, and I strongly believe that these drawings will help readers/executives connect with the colorful characters and world that I've created.

My project goal of $900 will pay for the illustrations. Brian's work is fantastic and well worth every penny. Please help me bring Og to life (and to the silver screen). If anyone has questions, please contact me at pjmac56@yahoo.com. I appreciate all donations, even if it's only a $1. Every little bit helps!

For the optimal viewing experience,                                          click the "full screen" button (bottom right of player).

                 OK, …A 12minute video is longer than some…                                 We promise the most empowering 12minutes of your day!!

   Mission Statement 

This campaign’s focus is about triumphant healing and the cure for hate, anger and prejudice through positive expression.

   Campaign Description

Our idea is to create a way for people to express positive messages that promote a color-blind approach to equality and universal love. The creation of t-shirts, coffee mugs, window clings, stickers, magnets, key-chains and pens that express positive messages that contradict hate, anger and prejudice will display these positive messages in a very public way. This type of positive reinforcement of peace and love will not only give the user/wearer the opportunity for positive interaction with others, but also provide a blessing to anyone who sees them. This might just be that unexpected little “pick-me-up” someone needs as well as keeping thoughts of peace and love in the forefront of your mind.

 

 

Campaign Goal Description

   We have recently experienced an incident related to hate, anger and prejudice. (Please read our story below.) We’ve all experienced it at some point in our life. We don’t know what was different about this time but it created a spark. That spark has grown into a passionate flame of inspiration to act out against it in a positive way. When hate and anger are experienced and the victims don’t speak out, that hate and anger lives and therefore exists completely unchecked. My husband and I have created a crowdfunded campaign on Indiegogo.com that would effect a positive change. We are trying to initiate and build an organization that can contribute to the cure for hate, anger and prejudice. Our long term goal is to become a large non-profit organization. Until we grow large enough and acquire non-profit status, our immediate goal is to fund a campaign that promotes positive expression against hate and prejudice. Once established we will be forever committed to giving as much time, effort and revenue as possible to curing hate and prejudice. This will include awareness campaigns like this one as well as anything from feeding hungry children to drilling water wells and so on.

Campaign Goal Amount

Our project goal amount is based on accomplishing initial production runs that are large enough to absorb set-up and design expenses while keeping individual item costs down to sensible levels.

A Word on Perks

Special Indiegogo Edition, United States Flag style Tie-Dyed T-Shirt (double silk screened)

  • on front “Practice Peace, We All Bleed Red”
  • on back “I Supported Peace, On Indiegogo.com”

Any shirt can be a Premium Supporter Shirt

Only Indiegogo Supporters will receive Premium Supporter Shirts. If you don’t want a Flag Shirt, but still want a “Special Indiegogo Edition Premium Supporter” shirt, we will silk-screen the back of any shirt with –“I Supported Peace, On Indiegogo.com”… (Simply add $10 to your support amount and add the word “Premium” to your “number/color selection”.)

Tie-Dyed T-Shirts in YOUR CHOICE of 20 colors or 30 solid colors, silk screened with YOUR CHOICE of any one of 4 Triumphant phrases:

  • “Cure Hate, Live Color-Blind”
  • “Be Kind, Spread the Love”
  • “Warning: Kindness is Contagious”
  • “Cure Hate, Love Thy Neighbor”

Perks Merchandise initially available.

  • Ceramic Coffee Mug
  • 3.75” x 7.5” Vinyl Outdoor Sticker (bumper sticker)
  • 4.00” x 7.5” Static Window Cling (non-adhesive window sticker)
  • 8.25” x 2.75” Car Magnet
  • 2.2” x 1.25” Rubber Tab Key-chain
  • 4 pc. Custom Ballpoint Pen Sets

 All merchandise items will be custom printed with the words: “Cure Hate, Live Color-Blind”

We plan to expand this list extensively. If this campaign reaches high levels of success by the deadline, we will send out emails and/or updates in order to offer our supporters even more options for perks packages within each support level.

Supporters will be listed by name (first name only or anonymous if you prefer) at LiveBlind2Color.com, as contributors to the cure for hate and will receive our thanks and the warm fuzzy feelings associated with being a contributor to world peace.

Minimal Shipping will apply based on location

 

“Our Story”

   We wanted to give everyone a basic summary of what brought us to start this campaign. Daily life in today’s world is filled with both darkness and enlightenment. We believe the outcome of any one person’s day, week, month, year, or life has everything to do with how you deal with the different aspects of positive and negative. Are you a confident happy person that lets the negative roll off like water on a duck’s back or do you get angry when something or someone unfortunate crosses your path? Dealing with the good is the easy part; it’s the negative that provides our struggles. Sometimes its money, sometimes its circumstance, sometimes its someone who has done or said something hurtful or saddening, sometimes its controllable and sometimes its not. This world is full of people who live and give love and kindness to everyone they meet, as well as people who display anger, hate and even prejudice. We believe simply ignoring the negative is a good first step, but to take action and actually do something positive to directly oppose that negative is triumphant.

  We feel it’s necessary to share with you the specifics of a few personal experiences so that you have a clear picture of exactly what has brought us to take the positive action that we feel this campaign represents. We would first like to say that it’s our belief that all life is precious regardless of type or classification. We rarely speak of race, although due to the nature of these experiences, in this instance it is necessary.

  We were recently “road raged” by a guy in a pick-up who passed us on the outside of a turn, horn blowing because he thought we were going too slowly. Purely by chance, approximately two minutes later, we ended up being parked directly on the other side of the gas pump from him. (NOTE: We are in the Carolinas, driving a vehicle with a northern New England registration.) My husband casually said to him, “Hey, that wasn’t all that safe for either one of us.” His reply was to tell us, “To take your ‘blank’ Yankee ‘blanks’ back home.” This must have left quite a look on my husband’s face because the guy followed it with, “You have no idea what you’re dealing with.” (Just to be clear, he was Caucasian and so are we.) Later that afternoon, we were getting a laugh out of what happened to us with a good friend of ours. (Just to be clear, our friend is African American.) In the more serious side of our conversation, he pointed out the underlying layer of discrimination and said that to call us Yankees is the same as someone calling him a “blank”. We then talked in wonder about how anyone could still be ticked off at the abolishment of slavery in this country.

  Experiencing hate and prejudice in today’s world is a subject that many of us could write many pages about. After discussing which experiences really stuck out, we decided that my husband’s personal account of the next two best represent each end of the spectrum. Here’s his story:

  “Let’s rewind fifteen years or so to another experience that has always stood out in my mind. I was out of work and wasn’t having a lot of luck finding any, so I got the bright idea to drive to New York City because I was sure I could get some work somewhere and figured I could always rent a room at the YMCA until I worked out all the details. Wish I had called first; there was a waiting list a month long. Determined to make it, I decided that I could sleep in my van for a bit. It’s kind of like camping, truck stop showers and food out of a can. I worked a little here and there, built a deck, did a roof, but hadn’t found anything substantial or steady, until I hooked up with a company that did cable TV installations. By then the weather had gotten pretty cold and a couple of the other installers noticed the inside of my van one morning, and when they found out I was parking on the street or at the train stations, they told me that it was safer to park behind their house at night. These guys were younger and still living with their mom and when she found out that very night, she sent them down to come get me out of the cold. They let me, a complete stranger, stay with them until I found a place of my own. We became friends and in a conversation about life one day, they shared with me the fact that they knew nothing of prejudice or hate before they came to this country. (Just to be clear, they were from Trinidad.) These people didn’t judge me by the color of my skin; they just saw me, sleeping in the cold.”

  “Now let’s rewind a few more years. I was five or six years old, the TV was on, and I heard something my own father say that broke my heart before I even knew my heart could be broken. He said, “Martin Luther King, Jr. was just another ignorant ‘blank’”. Even at that age where I didn’t really fully understand the scope of the whole thing, I knew what he said had to be terribly wrong.”

  The experiences of life mold you, but it is what you do with those experiences that make you who you are. Some may say we are naive but we believe hate is a disease that can be cured. We believe the more people express themselves in a positive manner, the more contagious love and kindness will become. Please help us fund this campaign. This is a campaign of triumphant expression of peace and love against prejudice and hate. It will create an avenue for those who want to express their positive stance on such an important social and sometimes political issue. Supporting this campaign, wearing these shirts, and displaying these bumper stickers, window clings, and magnets can be your triumphant expression of peace and love against prejudice and hate.

T-Shirt Sizing

      All shirts are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, name brand and are “true to fit”. If your regular size is a bit snug and your clothes are subjected to extra hot dryers (such as Laundromats), you may want to order the next size larger. This is completely up to your discretion. No returns will be accepted.

      Shirt sizes are med, large, x-large, 2xl, 3xl and are available in your choice of 20 tie-dyed and 30 solid colors as well as your choice of 4 messages: “Warning: Kindness is Contagious”; “Be Kind, Spread the Love”; “Cure Hate, Live Color-blind”; “Cure Hate, Love Thy Neighbor”

    Special Edition Shirt – Indiegogo Premium Supporter

Flag – Red Letters    med, large, x-large, 2xl, 3xl and are available

Front – “Practice Peace, We All Bleed Red”.... Back –“I Supported Peace, On Indiegogo.com”

     Any shirt can be a Premium Supporter Shirt

Only Indiegogo Supporters will receive Premium Supporter Shirts. If you don’t want a Flag Shirt, but still want a “Special Indiegogo Edition Premium Supporter” shirt, we will silk-screen the back of any shirt with –“I Supported Peace, On Indiegogo.com”… (Simply add $10 to your support amount and add the word “Premium” to your “number/color selection”.)

    Please select shirts by number and color… also specify size: med, large, x-large, 2xl, 3xl

For larger sizes, please add the following:

Tie-Dyed –       2x – add $1.50 per shirt

                        3x – add $2.50 per shirt

Solid Color -    2x – add $1.50 per shirt

                        3x – add $2.00 per shirt

 

 

     Any shirt can be a Premium Supporter Shirt

Only Indiegogo Supporters will receive Premium Supporter Shirts. If you don’t want a Flag Shirt, but still want a “Special Indiegogo Edition Premium Supporter” shirt, we will silk-screen the back of any shirt with –“I Supported Peace, On Indiegogo.com”… (Simply add $10 to your support amount and add the word “Premium” to your “number/color selection”.)

 

Special Indiegogo Edition, United States Flag style Tie-Dyed T-Shirt (double silk screened)

  • on front “Practice Peace, We All Bleed Red”
  • on back “I Supported Peace, On Indiegogo.com”

 

A Word on Shipping

A penny saved is a penny earned and I don’t want you to have to pay one extra penny over what is necessary for shipping. The most inexpensive solution for everyone is to calculate shipping for your package to your destination individually. Not including the shipping costs with your support also means saving the percentages that are collected from final goal totals.

Please know that handling shipping this way will save you all a lot of money but will also be labor intensive and time consuming for me. That’s ok though, I don’t mind. Shipping amounts on all packages will be calculated and sent to you via email with a notification that your package is ready to be shipped. All payments for shipping will require setting up a PayPal account if you don't already have one. It’s really easy and you can pay using your bank account, debit, or credit card. It’s free, secure, and takes no time at all. Go to www.paypal.com.

For Your Information

Shirt Color Individuality

All shirts are individually tied and dyed; shades and patterns will vary slightly from shirt to shirt. No two shirts are alike. Due to the variation in tie-dyed shirts, the silk screened message may be in either dark blue or white lettering as required. Also, however unlikely it may be, shirt color availability may change.

All shirts are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, name brand and are “true to fit”. If your regular size is a bit snug and your clothes are subjected to extra hot dryers (such as Laundromats), you may want to order the next size larger. This is completely up to your discretion. No returns will be accepted.

story:
“Climb Mount Everest with us!”

If you can't make it for a climb, pre-order my book by making a pledge to help girls like Sarah with Rett Syndrome.

I would like to invite you to pledge your support to win a free all expense paid trip to Mt. Everest when you get my book. At the Advance Base Camp level you will also receive my amazing KReader™ application with the book. At Camp 1 you will also get the powerful all-in-one real time eLearner application for your lifelong reading and learning pleasure.

What would you do to help your child who was having major problems? Go to the Moon? Climb Mount Everest? story:
Summary

I'm Simon Coopey and I'm your Plaid Cymru - the Party of Wales candidate for the 2015 Westminster Elections. I have lived and worked in Newport almost my whole life and, tired of the negativity, decided I wanted to do something to help rather than moan from the sidelines. Plaid Cymru's message is one of hope, and it is this positive message I want to take to Westminster on your behalf - no more of these cruel cuts that punish our poorest citizens disproportionately but an anti-austerity position prioritising improving infrastructure, creating jobs and growth. But nobody told me how expensive running for Parliament would be! So I am asking here if you could spare £5 towards the elections costs?

Every Penny Counts

Getting heard costs money. Leaflets and posters don't come cheap and every penny we receive will go towards the Plaid Cymru campagin in Newport West.  We're not funded by wealthy backers, we're funded by members and supporters like you. Rest assured money will be spent taking our positive message to the streets of Newport as we try to reach as many people as possible by May 7th.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I understand that not everyone who wants to support the campaign can help financially. You can help in other ways. Sharing this page through your social networks, or emailing the link to other potential supporters would be a huge help. If you live in the constituency, you could display a window poster or a garden board (please email mail@simoncoopey.org if you would like one of these). And of course, if you live in Wales vote Plaid Cymru!

    NOTE:

    If you're feeling generous and want to donate £500 or more you will have my eternal gratitude. But, for donations over £500 we are legally obliged to record of the donor's name and address, and to confirm the donor is registered at their address and on the electoral register.  Please call our head office on 029 2047 2272 before making a donation.

story:
THE OUTER DARK SYMPOSIUM ON THE GREATER WEIRD
Saturday March 25, 10 a.m. – 6 p.m.

Atlanta, Georgia at Decatur CoWorks, 708 Church St., Decatur, GA 30030

GUESTS/PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS:

Mike Allen

Daniel Braum

Selena Chambers

Gerald L. Coleman

Milton Davis

Kristi DeMeester

John C. Foster

Craig Laurance Gidney

Orrin Grey

Edward Austin Hall

Valjeanne Jeffers

Nicole Givens Kurtz

Anya Martin

Scott Nicolay

Balogun Ojetade

Eric Schaller

Grafton Tanner

Damien Angelica Walters

Michael Wehunt

FOR MORE INFO: https://www.facebook.com/events/1101994836594036/

Welcome to The Outer Dark on This Is Horror. I’m your host Scott Nicolay bringing you news and interviews with the creative talents who operate far beyond the edge of the firelight. There Are Weird Things Out Here, My Friends…

When I conceived The Outer Dark podcast in 2015, I never expected it to take off like it has and to mean so much to listeners. As the tendrils of the Weird spread further into speculative and even mainstream fiction, film and TV, people keep asking me when we were going to do something more hands-on. Thus was born The Outer Dark Symposium on the Greater Weird.

A key goal is to keep the symposium affordable ($25) for readers and writers, with everyone attending all programming and sharing breakfast and lunch together. We also will be providing an opportunity to continue the conversation at an after-party in the evening. We’ve crunched every figure and cut corners as far as we possibly can, but to rent a great space for an entire day, fly in some out-of-town guests, provide food services, and print a collectible program chapbook still takes money. In other words, to accomplish ALL this at this crazy price point, we ask humbly for your help.

That’s why we created this Indiegogo campaign through which you can purchase:

  • Supporting Membership ($20, includes program chapbook, limited to 100 copies & signed by all 17 program participants)
  • Basic Attending Membership ($25 for day event including meals)
  • Deluxe Membership ($50 for day event & evening party)
  • VIP Membership ($100, includes exclusive brunch with author guests & more)

If you can’t make it but want to hear the programming on The Outer Dark, or if you’re attending and want to help a little extra, our authors and some generous sponsors have contributed some additional perks including:

  • The Outer Dark podcast official T-shirt featuring our logo designed by “Nick the Hat” Gucker & inspired by the art of Lee Brown Coye (men’s sizes M, L, XL, 2XL, & 3XL).
  • Books and chapbooks by our guests & other writers in the contemporary Weird. Many signed & personalized.
  • Two memberships for the price of one to Monsterama, Atlanta’s only convention dedicated to classic monsters in art, film & print.
  • Cthulhu Tiki Mug, finely crafted by Horror in Clay
  • Poe-Pack featuring the Dreadful Ape Tiki Mug, inspired by Edgar Allan Poe’s “Murders in the Rue Morgue” & finely crafted by Horror in Clay, plus a signed & personalized copy of Wandering Spirits: Traveling Mary Shelley’s Frankenstein by Poe expert & cocktail connoisseur Selena Chambers.      

Finally, thank you to the following sponsors who have stepped up with cash or in-kind products and services to help make this one-of-a-kind event possible:

  • ATLRetro.com
  • Alistair Rennie
  • Broadleaf Writers Association
  • Broken Eye Books
  • Coffee Shop of Horrors
  • Dim Shores
  • Dunhams Manor Press
  • Eraserhead Press
  • Horror In Clay
  • King Shot Press
  • Lethe Press
  • Monsterama
  • Mythic Delirium
  • Pseudopod
  • The Revelator Magazine
  • Silver Scream FX Lab
  • Undertow Publications
  • Word Horde

We still have sponsorship opportunities available, so if you’d rather support that way or want to give more generously than the campaign levels offered, please contact us at atlretro@gmail.com.

Whatever you can afford or even if you just share this campaign on social media, you have our deepest gratitude!

Weirdest regards,

Scott Nicolay, Executive Producer/Host

Anya Martin, Associate Producer/Symposium Chair

LISTEN TO THE OUTER DARK ON THIS IS HORROR: http://www.thisishorror.co.uk/category/the-outer-dark/

story:
Story of My Book

China and the U.S. The Race to Develop the Self-Driving Car analyzes the technological, political/regulatory, and business-related difficulties that both nations face in developing and producing autonomous vehicles (AVs). This book discusses the potential benefits of autonomous vehicles for society; some of which include greater freedom of transportation for blind, disabled, or elderly people, reduced traffic congestion, and substantial efficiency boosts to industries such as the long-haul freight trucking industry.

My name is Phillip Wilcox and I am the author of China and the U.S. Race to Develop the Self-Driving Car. I wrote this book after an unfortunate accident in 2012 left me legally blind. In my efforts to recover elements of my independence, I have become very passionate about autonomous vehicles and their potential. Not only do AVs offer individuals like me greater freedom to live day-to-day life, but they also help improve the lives of millions of others when they’re used to improve society.

My hope is that by reading this book you will learn about the challenges that we face in developing AVs. This includes the larger economic and political strife between the U.S. and China, as well as the business challenges in this potentially trillion dollar industry. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the future of AVs in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you evaluate the use of AVs. Hopefully, you will learn to trust AVs and look forward to the incredible safety and productivity benefits they offer.

In this book, you'll learn about:

  • The different financial and/or business models that companies are exploring to make autonomous vehicles profitable 

  • The political problems that the U.S. and China faces in governing the technology behind autonomous vehicles.
  • The technological difficulties companies are facing as they try to build a self-driving vehicle.
  • The many incredible benefits that autonomous vehicles can offer to society.
You will love this book if you are interested in really exciting technology, technology that was previously only thought possible in Sci-Fi movies, or if you are interested in new business models and business policy. 

China and the U.S. Race to Develop the Self-Driving Car is a non-fiction book that speaks to political enthusiasts and people interested in business and new technology. It is for those who are looking at policy for new technology development and international technology competition between great powers for the first time.
 

China and the U.S. The Race to Develop the Self-Driving Car

The book is written in four parts.
Part 1 contains the introduction, which includes a description of the benefits and push-back of autonomous vehicles in the U.S.. It also includes a chapter on the visual sensors of the autonomous vehicle and a chapter describing the “central nervous system” of the autonomous vehicle. This part shows why these two countries are racing towards producing autonomous vehicles and describes what exactly that means.

Part two contains chapters describing the up-hill battle for trust and acceptance of autonomous vehicles in the U.S. It contains chapters on Waymo, Uber, and Tesla. This section shows that even though the U.S. began developing autonomous vehicles before China, problems with a lack of public trust and suitable business models for AVs might cause it to fall behind.

Part three contains a chapter describing Xi Jinping’s desire to transform the Chinese economy, a chapters on Baidu’s Apollo Project and a chapter on the self-driving car company AutoX,. This section describes how a better public-private partnership and greater interest by the CCP in developing new technology is a big reason why China is catching up to the U.S.

Part four contains a section related to the difficulties that the U.S. faces in developing state, federal and global policy towards autonomous vehicles. This section argues that while the problems related to state and national laws governing autonomous vehicles are temporary and can be addressed, the global arena of setting standards will be the next big fight between the U.S. and China in their ongoing trade dispute.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And so much more!

About the Author

Phillip has devoted most of his professional life to better understanding the different economic, political, and cultural dynamics between the U.S. and China. He has earned his M.A. in International Relations from the University of Southern California and his B.A. in Government and English from Georgetown University.

Phillip was first inspired to write China and the U.S. The Race to Develop the Self-Driving Car after an unfortunate accident in 2012 which left him legally blind. Over the years, he developed a newfound passion for autonomous vehicles and their untold potential. Since then, he has become a foremost advocate for the use of the technology in both the United States and China.

When he is not writing or speaking on issues related to autonomous vehicles, Phillip loves to practice his Mandarin Chinese or dominate his friends fantasy football league.

For more information you can connect with Phillip at LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/phillip-wilcox

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ChinaandtheUSRaceforAVs and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Phillip Wilcox

story:
Short Summary

I used to and actually still do lead the usual life of a corporate employee caught in the routine of Work life. After 2-3 years of trying, I somehow managed to collect drops of time and poured them into a bucket. I worked on filling one bucket at a time and progressed at a snail's pace. Converted each such bucket into a story that I wrote mainly during official train journeys from Chennai to Bangalore. A story emerged about two IIT-IIM middle aged friends who come together to write a book. This roller coaster ride through campus life, parties, ghosts, cricket, Bollywood, murder mystery, sci-fi and intense introspection has been sewn together to form a 'connection' of stories called The Book: A train of thoughts. Reference to the train here is a tribute to the journeys undertaken and also to the fantastic journey called life. 

As I kept dreaming about this book becoming a big hit and me becoming a Hollywood script writer in the next few years, I also kept thinking in parallel that it was time to give back to the society in some way. Finally, decided to use my debut book as a tool to make a difference to a niche set of highly deserving people: disadvantaged painters. 

My idea is to use 8 sketches / paintings, one for each chapter. What will be unique is that each painting will be created by a disadvantaged painter. Fortunately, after speaking to several NGOs and organizations, I decided to partner with Spastics Society of Tamil Nadu. They are the most wonderful set of people! My painters have deficiencies of some form or the other but they are incredibly talented. Their works shall adorn my book and am sure you will love to see what they are capable of creating. . So what I want is for people to contribute and I will channelize all profits to make a difference to them. Some funds will go to painters directly and the rest to the school(s).


What I Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I am looking at a funding of $7500 in all. As a debut author and with the idea of inserting paintings / sketches, social cause etc, I wasn't sure if the existing publishing houses would encourage it. Initial reactions were not promising. So, a big chunk of the costs will be the self-publishing piece. The other cost elements are the base price of each painting, marketing and distribution expenses. I have employed a small team of enthusiastic MBA students from NMIMS that work free and a token salary would be a great way to acknowledge their efforts. 
  • The journey has begun and we shall undertake this no matter what. So, if I dont get the full money I am looking for, I will borrow and get this done. 
  • Perk for you is that you not only get a signed copy of the book, I shall add the top 100 contributor names in the book itself. If you contribute more than $15, for each $15 multiple, you can also gift a copy to your close friends. 

The Impact

Inaction is not necessarily equal to no intention or indifference

- Sometimes inaction is due to pursuit of a perfect state

My realization:

- Do you wish to travel around the world? A Journey around the world could be via infinite routes – from West to East, or North to South or any other route ...But whichever route you take, the first step is to open the door to step out. The Art of the Possible starts with the first step and this effort of mine is that step towards making a difference to disadvantaged painters

The impact that you could make is tremendous. The real success would be to create sustainable opportunities but as a start, the opportunities that will get created are:

- Clinical support

- Financial support to run their families

- Survival / Sustenance – food, cloth, shelter

- Career – job opportunities

With Spastic Society, depending on the funds collected and future income streams, I would love to set up a facility that encourages paintings / sketching among disabled kids. If more people come together to sustain this initiative, the impact will be long term and a small difference will indeed be made.  

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many things you could do if you take those tiny steps:

  • Please please please help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Feel free to visit the blog: www.thebookbyranga.wordpress.com and get regular updates on where we are .... 

Thanks for considering to partner with me and looking forward to your support.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
"I would like to see a story that explores the city’s plans, management, maps and budgeting for snow removal," says Kenna.   "Snow removal in Columbia is inadequate at best, bordering on ridiculous."

I'd like to see that story, too.  It hasn't been written yet, and it's important, especially if harsher winters are the new normal. 

But the Columbia Heart Beat -- like so many independent news organizations -- is at a crossroads and we need your help to maintain -- and expand.  We pay our freelance journalists, columnists, photographers, videographers, and such.   Quality in-depth reporting, like our series on development and vanishing trees, costs money. 

Investigative journalism is expensive. 

                      

Just how expensive is illustrated by a lawsuit filed against the Heart Beat over an editorial about the destruction of trees on a publicly visible estate.  Though it was quickly dismissed, the suit could have cost thousands to defend. 

Since 2005, the Columbia Heart Beat has been breaking news, watchdogging power players, and fighting for your right to know.   We've led the way on major issues like Blighting Columbia; Gerrymandering city Wards; closing the humane society; and using eminent domain for personal gain. 

We've had plenty of local firsts, too:  first to cover the Tiger Hotel's troubled new owner; first to investigate Campus Crest, a student apartment developer with a history of complaints; first to reveal a secretive meeting that sought to undermine City Council members; and the only publication to consistently challenge crony capitalism, at City Hall, public schools, and Boone County. 

You -- our readers -- recognize this important work, and we're asking you to help us continue it by meeting this first in a series of fundraising goals. 

                              

Dear Columbia Heart Beat or Hey Mike, the letters, emails, Tweets, and text messages begin.  "Will you please report on," they ask.   But we can't report on anything without a way to pay our journalists, photographers, columnists, and dare I say, ourselves.   

Without your help, we can't report on "the amount of money the city has or is losing by investing in the Prairie State Energy Campus," as Emma requested.

We can't "do a piece on payday, cash advance and title loan companies," as Zach requested.

"Are you going to cover the MU story of University Village and Lt. Britt's death?" 

"How about reporting on Mizzou closing its arts education program?" 

Not without money to pay reporters.

And what about a petition asking the City of Columbia to reduce the new $4.60 charge for online bill payments.   Will the Columbia Heart Beat report on that?
                                                                       

                               

Not without your help.  Please consider moving us toward our first 45-day goal, $1,000.   We've never charged a subscription fee.  We don't believe in paywalls.  And for nine years, we've taken few ads. 

Without watchdogs who alert us before the fact, we can find ourselves like the man in the picture -- from our investigative series Stumped-- watching the world he knows, loves, and cares about slip away, powerless to do much about it.

(If you'd like to contribute by check or money order, mail your contribution to CHB, c/o Mike Martin, POB 125, Columbia, Missouri, 65205).

Please note:  Donations are not tax deductible.
