story:
Our Story

Diary of A Single Father is an inspiring adventure of life through the eyes, heart and pen of Carlos Patterson. With the humble hospitality of his Southern born beginnings and hustler antics from his Brooklyn upbringing, this young author poetically inks history with the untold story of an involved single father. Mr. Patterson opens his uncut diary of tears, fears, joy, inspirations, success and obstacles experienced in his daily well orchestrated balancing act called life. Allow yourself to be superbly intrigued as you enter his world.

 

The Impact

I will take you on my journey as I continue to evolve as a man and a father. Diary of a Single Father will demonstrate how instrumental an involved father is in a child's life. It will motivate all men to make their children top priority.

What You Get

  • $0-20 donation- Thank you message on Diary of A Single Father facebook page.
  • $40 donation- Receive a personal thank you note on "Diary Of A Single Father" blog site.
  • $60 donation- Signed "Thank You" Picture from author and receive a personal thank you note on "Diary Of A Single Father" blog site.
  • $100 donation-  Signed copy of "Diary of A Single Father" with special thank you message, signed  "Thank You"picture from author and personal thank you on "Diary Of A Single Father" blog site
  • $250 donation- Signed copy of "Diary of A Single Father" with special thank you message, signed  "Thank You"picture from author and personal thank you on "Diary Of A Single Father" blog site and a limited edition T-Shirt
  • $500 donation- "Diary of A Single Father"-Wellness Kit-Author will send you a unique package which will include Signed copy of the book with special thank you message and health and wellness products used by author to maintain a healthy mind, body and soul; special thank you message, signed  "Thank You"picture from author and personal thank you on "Diary Of A Single Father" blog site and a limited edition T-Shirt.
  • $1000 Donation-Special VIP invitaion from Author to closet book reading session in your area. Signed copy of "Diary of A Single Father" with special thank you message,"Diary of A Single Father"-Wellness Kit-Author will send you a unique package  which will include Signed copy of book with special thank you message and   health and wellness products used by author to maintain a healthy mind, body and soul; special thank you message, signed  "Thank You"picture from author and personal thank you on "Diary Of A Single Father" blog site and a limited edition T-Shirt.

Diary of A Single Father is an inspiring adventure of life through the eyes, heart and pen of Carlos Patterson. With the humble hospitality of his Southern born beginnings and hustler antics from his Brooklyn upbringing, this young author poetically inks history with the untold story of an involved single father. Mr. Patterson opens his uncut diary of tears, fears, joy, inspirations, success and obstacles experienced in his daily well orchestrated balancing act called life. story:
Thank you!


There are only a few days left, and a bunch of amazing new perks in our campaign, and we wanted to remind you - Not only is every donation its own reward, every donation gets a reward. If nothing on this list whets your palate, make a perk-free donation and we'll send you a surprise gift!

 

We can't thank you enough for supporting us. Help us share the campaign and keep on reading Rover!



WHO ARE WE?

Rover is an online arts magazine offering daily coverage and comment on the wide range of arts in Montreal. Founded in 2008, we have published over 1350 reviews and articles. We cover everything from cutting edge indie music, blockbuster films, ground-breaking literature, and international summer festivals. Our monthly newsletter goes out to 1750 email subscribers with a summary of the magazine’s best content and insider information.  

Now half way through year four, Rover has recently been incorporated as a non-profit organization, and has applied for several arts grants. Up until now, Rover has been a labour of love for the founders and dozens of contributors. This fundraising campaign is part of our Spring 2012 push toward sustainability. Also, we want to pay our writers!

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Spring 2012 marks an important transition for Rover. Like far too many cultural start-ups, we survive on periodic fundraising events and personal contributions. Not to mention hundreds of hours of free labour from contributors and editors. Now, our solid track-record and consistent quality of writing means we are poised to join the growing pool of Canadian electronic periodicals. However, being eligible for arts grants means we have to work hard to raise essential matching funds.  

And because we believe in YOU, we've launched this campaign. Our goal is to increase subscribers to our newsletter and raise at least $3,000. We've compiled a cornucopia of goodies from local publishers, theatres and businesses to sweeten the deal. Let us show you what makes Montreal so worth writing about. Check out our gallery for some preview images!


IMPACT

Dozens of writers contribute articles and podcasts each year. Your contribution to the cause will help us pay the charming, talented, selfless and dedicated writers and editors you fell in love with in our video, and help us to reach a new and larger audience!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Short on cash? We feel you. But you can still help!

  • Share our campaign with your friends!  The more shares our campaign recieves, the more likely we are to be a featured campaign on the indiegogo page!
  • Sign up on our homepage to our free newsletter!
  • Tell your friends about Rover and the free newsletter!
  • Add your voice! Send us a letter, or comment on our coverage at roverarts.com
  • Don't like PAYPAL?  Contact us for information on how to pay by cheque at admin@roverarts.com!

story:
What is Mother of Creation?

Mother of Creation is soon to be my second self-published book, but I need your help to make it happen! It is an epic fantasy novel full of dark twists and turns, the story of a king and his lover, a princess and her twin, a faithful guard, a blind seer, and the isolated, manipulated child of a god. 

Where's Your Money Going?

Publishing a book well actually involves a lot of elements, and all of those elements cost money. I did my last book on a super shoe-string budget of $300, and was honestly not completely happy with the results. This time, my goal is to produce a better quality product with a wider buying pool.

So, how am I going to do that?

First of all, I want to hire a copyeditor. Copyeditors are pretty expensive - right now my rough estimate on this is around $500 minimum. They are expensive because of what they do. A copyeditor goes through your work not only for grammatical errors and inconsistencies like a proofreader does, but also for story inconsistencies and plot reworkings. Needless to say this can be a pretty time-consuming project, which is why they charge so much. Still, the quality of one's work at the end tends to be a bit better when a third party has done a deep dive into its flaws.

The other $500 is primarily going towards my book cover. Last time, I got a great cover from Design for Writers for under $300. However, the cover was only in a format acceptable for ebooks - that meant no print versions of my first book. This time, I want to make my book available in print form. Many of my readers have expressed interest in that format being made available, and I really want to fascilitate that for them. Therefore I'm commissioning a cover that can be used for print books! That's going to cost roughly $400 by my estimate.

So, lastly, where does the extra $100 go? I want to leave room for extra expenses, since the numbers above are just rough estimates. And I want to also make sure that I have enough money to pay Indiegogo's tithe on my earnings! But any extra money that I make, whether because things don't cost quite as much as I expect or you guys come through and blast my goal out of the ballpark, will go towards my next book project! Mother of Creation is actually the first in a trilogy of dark epic fantasy, so look forward to more to come!

Why Do I Need Your Help?

I'm a beginning author, and as you might have figured out by now, I'm pretty young, too. Self-publishing, for me, is a way to make my dreams manifest in a world where that is becoming increasingly difficult to do. I still want to traditionally publish as well, but I feel like at this point in my career self-publishing makes a lot more sense to me. 

However, as with everything, self-publishing costs, and I don't have a lot of financial flexibility in my life at the moment. That's why any help that you can offer, absolutely any at all, is appreciated. I want to someday be able to rely on my sales from previous projects to power this process, but at the moment I am still building my base. Until that happens, I'm grateful to all of you who have helped me to realize my dreams.

What Happens if the Goal Isn't Reached?

If the goal isn't reached, money will be reallocated to website creation and you will still get your perks, thanks to the government giving me tax money back!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, there are tons of other ways you can help. First of all, you can go to any of the pages below and like or follow me for future updates and releases! Secondly, you can spread the word about this campaign or my other book, Child of Brii. And lastly, you can just send me encouraging messages! I like those.

www.twitter.com/skylit1

www.facebook.com/amanda.mcgee13

http://www.goodreads.com/author/show/6948955.Amanda_J_McGee

https://www.smashwords.com/profile/view/AmandaJMcGee

www.1houreveryday.tumblr.com

http://www.amazon.com/Child-of-Brii-ebook/dp/B00BFFE6ZO

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
The Lost is a fiction anthology with nine stories about the lives of the people society has forgotten. The proceeds from The Lost will benefit City Harvest, a charity that feeds the hungry. 

About the Anthology

The Lost is stories of hope, tragedy, and the people the world turns away from. From a young woman struggling with addiction to a streetwise Santa looking out for his friends, these stories range from literary to magical realism. The Lost is an anthology of stories that confront issues of homelessness and the people our society ignores.

The Lost features a great group of writers who have created daring, elegant stories of loss, redemption, and love.

  • Kathryn Watterson: Bumble Bee Brown
  • C.J. Malarsky: Burning Ember
  • Sarah Newton: Circles and Stars
  • K. H. Vaughan: Hell on Wheels
  • Megan Engelhardt: Jimmy Got-It Gets It
  • Stephen D. Rogers: Magpie
  • Meg Jayanth: The Beasts By Their Names
  • Peter Woodworth: The End of Hungry Santa
  • Shoshana Kessock: The Case of George the Curious

Charity: City Harvest

We’re nearly ready to go to print – but we want to give something back. After covering the costs of production – including paying our writers and printing books – proceeds of this fundraiser are going to benefit City Harvest.

Now serving New York City for 30 years, City Harvest (www.cityharvest.org) is the world's first food rescue organization, dedicated to feeding the city’s hungry men, women, and children. This year, City Harvest will collect more than 42 million pounds of excess food from all segments of the food industry, including restaurants, grocers, corporate cafeterias, manufacturers, and farms. This food is then delivered free of charge to some 600 community food programs throughout New York City by a fleet of trucks and bikes. City Harvest helps feed the more than one million New Yorkers that face hunger each year.

We are so happy to have this opportunity to give back. Please join us. You will get a new anthology filled with amazing stories from fantastic writers.
 

Inspiration for The Lost

The Lost was inspired by the role-playing game Kingdom of Nothing, by Jeff Himmelmann. Kingdom of Nothing was released in 2011 and is a role-playing game that allows players to take on the role of a person lost from society. It can be difficult to confront these issues directly, but this game allows people to see things from someone else’s point of view, and hopefully, to change perspectives on the world.

Although The Lost was inspired by Kingdom of Nothing, you do not have to be a fan of the game to enjoy these stories.

Galileo Games has experienced a great deal of success over the years, releasing award winning games and anthologies. Our first goal has always been to create entertaining, fun media that people will enjoy, but Galileo has also been committed to publishing books with a social consciousness.

About Galileo Books

Galileo Books is an award-winning publisher of games and fiction. We have produced several fiction anthologies including Gimme Shelter and Have Blaster, Will Travel. Game designer Brennan Taylor is the President of Galileo Books and J.R. Blackwell is the Creative Director. With a proven track record of delivering to supporters, Galileo has produced books and fiction through crowdfunding and continues to deliver quality fiction and games. 

Timeline

All the stories have been written and edited. We are currently in the layout process. Printing and shipping will take about 2-3 months after the campaign is complete, but electronic rewards will be sent immediately after the campaign ends. Those who pledge at perk levels that have both electronic and print rewards will first recieve their electronic copies, then their print copies.

Special Thanks

Special Thanks to Trillian Stars, Tim Rodriguez, Chris Morse, Russell Collins, Veronica Giguere, Matt Or, Jeremy Morgan, Nobilis Reed and Heather Welliver for recording the audio for this video. Thanks also to Jeff Himmelman (http://jeffreyhimmelman.com/) for creating the beautiful cover artwork for The Lost, and agreeing to allow us to run this campaign based on his wonderful game.

story:
What's This All About?

No video, but here's another stilled image for those of you who don't know me.

I look sincere, earnest, somewhat mature and knowledgeable, right? (this is the section where I am to build trust with you, my potential audience). Good, nailed that.

Basically, I have been a (mostly) vegetarian for over 15 years, and was raised with a health consciousness that I have continued to develop. I recently completed my Health Coaching Certification, started a Counseling business and website (andreakampicwellness.com) and am putting it all together with this first volume in a Series of Health Books. The Skinny on Eating Plants, A Why and How Manual is written and I would like to raise funds to punch it up and publish it. This book outlines the value of a plant-based diet for the health of the animals involved (including us), the health of our planet, and how to make it happen in practice. The second book in this Series, on Detoxing and Cleansing, is underway, and I will begin working on it more diligently once I get this first monkey off my back. Just kidding, it has been a joy. I'm joyful.

Anyway, The Skinny Series is a compendium of multiple books on health that are thin (this one is around 135 pages, but dense, think: steel), and a play on words because if you eat a plant-based diet (or follow along with the advice in any of the the issues of The Skinny Series), you will get skinnier. Oh, and skinny also means information, so it's triple-entendred.

While I may joke around, I am actually very serious about health. I truly believe that prevention is the healthcare of the future, and we are all in this together. Awareness + Education + Support = Change. However, nothing will truly change in terms of our general wellness until we accept that our system is all upside down--we spend inordinate amounts of money treating chronic diseases once they have developed that often could have been prevented with proper, responsible individual decision-making and honest education. One important way to achieve this that has been scientifically proven is to eat less animal products and more plants. I want to help you discover this based on what I have learned from a lifetime of growing Awareness and Education. If you be my Support, together we can Equal Change.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm seeking $2500 to create a polished book from my current manuscript. The general time frame of this first book project is to get the ball rolling while this Indiegogo campaign is running; do any rewrites, proof & edit the text and design the book cover by July 1; have the book available on Amazon by end of Julyish; ship your copies and perks around that same timeish. I will use the proceeds from this campaign and any book sales to fund the future books in this series, so have no fear that this will be an ongoing funds barrage. I'm not like that. And I know you. So we're good.

The funds raised will go toward:

~general fees: ISBN and barcodes, copyrighting the material, Indiegogo fees (4-9% depending on how much I raise), reward fulfillment, shipping costs

~publishing: editorial assistance, layout, cover design, photography, printing expenses, kindle edition formatting costs

~If I raise money upfront through your kind assistance, I can reduce the price of the actual paperback copy, making it more accessible for everyone else (basically a pay it forward situation where you pony up for the next guy). I would like these to be inexpensive, portable, thin, condensed-but-thorough guides on each topic, and it is wildly more important to me to get it out there than it is to get rich. 

If I do not reach my cited goal, I will still publish this volume, but it may delay the release of future books in The Skinny series. I will still want to help all of you stay well, but maybe a little less so.

If by some crazy bit of good luck I raise more than I am seeking, forget about that last snarky comment and know that I am in this with you through thick and skinny. As stated earlier, any additional funds raised will go toward the next book in the Series, paying it forward in a healthy feedback loop.

Please see the sidebar (over there on the right) to see what I am offering for your generous contributions.


Random pretty, tasty-looking vegetable

The Impact

The upshot of these books and why I feel compelled to write and distribute them is because we all know friends, family, loved ones, maybe some jerks even but they're sorry, who have serious illnesses. At this somewhat primitive stage in human development, we still don't know specifically why one person gets sick and another person doesn't. Scientists have put the percentage of the genetic component at around 30%, with the remaining 70(ish)% being environmental influences. These include lifestyle (whether you move your body, stress response, overuse, abuse, excess weight); nutrition (if you provide the proper nutrients to nourish your development while avoiding junk that adds empty, worse-than-useless calories); exposure (pesticides, preservatives, toxic chemicals, heavy metals, water quality, air quality, flame retardants, artificial colors and flavors, heavily processed foods, etc, etc.); as well as X factors of which we are still unaware. 

While we may not know what we have been exposed to or when, we can control what goes into our mouths to ultimately become 'us' at the cellular level. Plants contain all of the necessary ingredients for us to thrive (elephants eat only plants as do all herbivores, and when we eat animals, the nutrients we metabolize from them were all originally from the plants that they or their prey ate). 

I also love and respect animals and feel that they have a lot to teach us. So rather than eat them I would prefer that we recognize that we are as much their students as their masters. And even though we have pretty much forgotten, we are animals ourselves.

There is a strong environmental component in the argument for a plant-based diet as well. Here's the skinny: the monoculture that produces the food for our industrial feedlots, and animal factory farming itself, are disastrously wasteful and polluting and water-intensive. Besides killing us softly, the meat and dairy industries are taking our very breath away (70s emotional song references).

All of these issues and much more! will be touched upon in the WHY sections of The Skinny on Eating Plants, a Why and How Manual. The HOW sections will give you some helpful tools to limit your animal product intake--from purging your cupboards and then restocking, plant substitutions for common animal products, steps to slowly reduce animal food intake, how to identify and stop cravings, menu planning, lots of charts, helpful tips, recipe ideas, pep talks, back pats, and some references for further exploration. I had to read about 100 books to distill all of this information down, you only have to read this one (you will be somewhat less informed but it's a heck of a lot less work). 

My intention with this and subsequent books in this Series is to set you on the path to improved health, and if I succeed, you will then take the mantle further and explore these issues on your own. I hope to lead you to the trailhead after which you will hack your own trail, with a machete if necessary, and guide dogs and a sherpa, breadcrumbs and a sharp stick, all of which are there for you if you seek them out. I find these helpers when I seek guidance, and they are a growing tribe waiting for you to join in. Or you can live on the couch and watch TV and get huge and sick while burning down the rainforest and eating Bambi. Up to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

While not everyone can contribute financially to this project (okay, maybe everyone can give 5 bucks--that would be awesome if EVERYONE gave 5 bucks--but anyway), your support in other ways is equally valuable. Spread the word about this project on facebook, twitter, instagram, emails, in general conversations that you start in the supermarket line with people buying cheetos and ribs, with your doctor, the butcher, at fast food restaurants--everywhere--to raise awareness of this campaign. In true seriousness, I just want people to become conscious of how their choices impact the earth and its creatures, our health and future generations. All the rest is mushroom gravy. Thank you everyone for your kind and loving support! Let's get this done!


In closing, another delicious-looking plant

Photos: Jan Sonnenmair--Thanks Jan!

No video, but here's another stilled image for those of you who don't know me. I look sincere, earnest, somewhat mature and knowledgeable, right? (this is the section where I am to build trust with you, my potential audience). Good, nailed that.Basically, I have been a (mostly) vegetarian for over 15 years, and was raised with a health consciousness that I have continued to develop. I recently completed my Health Coaching Certification, started a Counseling business and website (andreakampicwellness.com) and am putting it all together with this first volume in a Series of Health Books. The Skinny on Eating Plants, A Why and How Manual is written and I would like to raise funds to punch it up and publish it. This book outlines the value of a plant-based diet for the health of the animals involved (including us), the health of our planet, and how to make it happen in practice. The second book in this Series, on Detoxing and Cleansing, is underway, and I will begin working on it more diligently once I get this first monkey off my back. Just kidding, it has been a joy. I'm joyful. Anyway, The Skinny Series is a compendium of multiple books on health that are thin (this one is around 135 pages, but dense, think: steel), and a play on words because if you eat a plant-based diet (or follow along with the advice in any of the the issues of The Skinny Series), you will get skinnier. Oh, and skinny also means information, so it's triple-entendred.While I may joke around, I am actually very serious about health. I truly believe that prevention is the healthcare of the future, and we are all in this together. Awareness + Education + Support = Change. However, nothing will truly change in terms of our general wellness until we accept that our system is all upside down--we spend inordinate amounts of money treating chronic diseases once they have developed that often could have been prevented with proper, responsible individual decision-making and honest education. One important way to achieve this that has been scientifically proven is to eat less animal products and more plants. I want to help you discover this based on what I have learned from a lifetime of growing Awareness and Education. If you be my Support, together we can Equal Change. story:
What’s our project about?

Everyone is so busy these days they don’t have time to help themselves.  Sad but true isn’t it?  There're lots of outstanding self-help books out there, but……who has the time and energy to read a 200 – 300 page book?

Everyone knows that a simple to read, easy to understand and useful self-help book is the obvious solution. And that’s how we came up with the Sticky Steps book series - it’s to the point, absolutely helpful, and fun to read.  Our first book is almost ready, and it’s called Sticky Steps to Create Killer Presentations.


Who are we?

We’re a group of young, passionate and driven individuals from Australia, China, Italy, Romania, Mexico, Russia, Singapore, Ukraine, and the United States of America, and we form the Sticky Steps team!

Our greatest desire is to launch a new book every 3 months on topics that will help anyone and everyone with the usual daily challenges in life.  Our next few topics will cover public speaking, how to influence and motivate others, helping Generation Yers find direction in life, and the list goes on… 




How dare we call ourselves experts?

We were fortunate enough to run into a crazy guy from Singapore, Jeff Tan, an ex-military pilot. Jeff discovered his purpose in life during his 40s, and since then, he has been on a mission to help people make a difference in their lives.  He has equipped himself with all sorts of “life hacking” tools backed by neuroscience that really work, and he’s the source of our expertise and inspiration.  


We need your help! 

Help us spread the love …  This means telling everyone about our cause, especially about our first book that’s guaranteed to cure anyone of their presentation yips and woes! 

In addition to spreading the love, help us with the costs of completing this project – USD 8000.  We didn’t realize just how expensive trademark fees are, not to mention the cost of professional editors and designers who’ve helped and advised us as we excitedly sprint to the finish line.

Today we focus on our first book on creating killer presentations. Tomorrow, it could be how to influence or find direction in life, and next year, who knows what useful topic will come to our attention.

We will get better and better at giving our community what they need. What we really want to do is create a series of fun books that’s easy and fun to read filled with tips and tools that run from the usual to the highly unusual but still easy to do!

Help us help others!  Your donations will go a very long way and your ideas on our Facebook page will inspire us to do more.  Help us live our dreams, and in turn, achieve your dreams through our books!

story:
The Nuyorican Poets Cafe is celebrating its 40th Anniversary this year, and we need your help to send our award-winning slam poetry team to the National Poetry Slam in Oakland this summer! A multicultural and multi-arts institution, the Cafe champions the use of spoken word and music as means of social empowerment for minority and underprivileged artists. Our slam poets have appeared on stage and screen all over the world, and our slam team is consistently ranked in the top five nationwide. Most of our poets are teaching artists who share their love of verse with students and teachers via our literacy and afterschool events.

As we continue to grow our slam program, we need your help to fund the training, travel and lodging expenses for our team's trip to this year's National Poetry Slam. 

The $8000 in expenses for this trip include:

Pass-the-torch event, during which we graduate last year's slam team and inaugurate the new team ($600)

Round-trip airfare for five team members and our coach ($3500)

Hotel lodging for the team for four nights ($2900)

Food during the trip ($800)

Ground transportation ($200)

Perks for contributors to our campaign will include free tickets to upcoming Nuyorican Poets Cafe events, books and recordings that feature our artists and performances by our poets at your workplace or school.

Allen Ginsberg called the Nuyorican Poets Cafe Cafe “the most integrated place on the planet”, the Wall Street Journal says the Cafe is a “a thriving arts center with partnerships across the city” and John Leguizamo says the Cafe "put the street on stage… Made our lives real, our emotions real.”

story:
The Search

Since 2010, award winning author, Tim Z. Hernandez has been on a mission to uncover the names and stories of the passengers behind the famous plane wreck, which inspired the song “Deportee (Plane Wreck at Los Gatos).” Written by Woody Guthrie and turned into a song by Martin Hoffman, the song has been recorded by popular musicians, such as Dolly Parton, Bob Dylan, Bruce Springsteen, Joan Baez, and Pete Seeger, to name a few. In the photo below, the author is kneeling down at the mass grave site with the original placard, which simply read "28 Mexican Citizens who died in an airplane accident near Coalinga, Calif. on January 28, 1948."  

                                      

Since 2010, Hernandez has located surviving family members for six of the passengers aboard the flight. He has traveled to their homes and recorded dozens of hours of testimonies. Along the way, he has unearthed countless historical documents, such as the last letter passenger, Ramon Paredes, wrote home to his wife, numerous private photographs--including those of the pilot and stewardess, the official accident report, personal information on various passengers, death certificates, old newspapers, as well as, audio interviews from eyewitness accounts who witnessed the crash first hand.

                

After locating the list of names in 2013, Hernandez spearheaded a fundraising effort to install a 4 x 8 ft. memorial headstone at Holy Cross Cemetery in Fresno, California where the victims are buried. While the memorial headstone was successfully funded, Hernandez’s ongoing research has strictly been a labor of love. Though he has made several earnest attempts, to date, he has received no funding from outside sources, grants, organizations or private individuals*.  

Your contribution will help correct history. Funding will make the locating of more family members possible and see the completion of Hernandez’s book about this historical incident to fruition. Plus, it will ensure continued documentation of this research via video, audio, and photos, and when complete, the author plans to donate his research to an archive facility, so that future generations will have free access to it. 

                   

 

What We Need 

$6,500 will go directly to locating the families of several passengers for whom Hernandez has leads and information, but not the resources to travel and conduct the necessary legwork. Also, it will go to seeing the book to completion by the deadline of February 1, 2015   

Breakdown of Expenses

1) $4,500 Cost of travel, hotels, car rental, per diem.

2) $1,200 (120 hrs x $10 per hr) Stipend for a Research Assistant to follow up with calls, contacts and leads, digital filing of documents, transcriptions of interviews, and overall research assistance. 

3) $800 Purchase of equipment and materials.                                                                        

If the goal of $6,500 is not fully met, funds acquired will still go directly to the goals set forth here. However, the funding gap will have to be covered by the author, which would reasonably push the project back a couple of years.

                             

 

*In 2013, bay area artist Jane Oriel collaborated with Hernandez on an original limited edition (100) print design commemorating the memorial headstone. Prints and posters were sold as a means of helping with some of the expenses. You can still purchase one of these in the Perks section of this campaign.

story:
Švabo, što sad hoćeš?

Nakon, romana uspješnice 'Ja nisam Švabo', Vedran Kukavica želi napisati drugi dio duologije 'Povratak Švabe'.

Oaza novootkrivenoga morlaštva, otrgnuti Vlajlend, ta zadnja literarna zabiokovska utvrda protuglobalizacijskoga otpora ne smije pasti! 

Previše je propatio naš batinački narod da bi njegova spisateljska epopeja tek tako posustala na prvoj stepenici: neka nam živi jedina i vječita Batina!

Svi su tu: i Načelnik i Iketa, Milena i Ozrenka i svi ostali potomci Tvrtka praBatine Neslomljivog ... I Švabo se vraća zatičući i njih i nove likove batinačkog panoptikuma te nove obrate u potrazi za Jastvom i dobrom juhom od tikvice! 

Što nudi Švabin spisateljski ćaća? 

Može li čovjek dokazati da u išta vjeruje ako to nije spreman pretplatiti? 

Čemu nervoza i jurnjava po knjižarama za neprodanim primjerkom 'Švabe 2' kad knjigu možeš imati na kućnom pragu prije negoli dospije u slobodnu rasprodaju? 

Zašto bi gologlav čekao knjigu kad te vrhunska kapa sa Švabinim znakom već čeka? 

Koja korist od ljetnih šetnji u kojima ostaješ nezamijećen jer nemaš ekskluzivnu Švabinu majicu?

Odaberi svoj 'perks' (stupac lijevo) i gurajući Vedrana Kukavicu u dužničko ropstvo pomozi mu da slomi urođenu lijenost i dovrši 'Švabu 2' na obostrano zadovoljstvo!

Varaš li, Švabo?

A kako? 

Zar batinački obraz nije važniji od svih materijalni dobara ovoga svijeta?

Zar kampanja za prvi roman 'Ja nisam Švabo' na ovoj istoj platformi nije prošla bez ikakvih repova? Roman napisan, svaki 'pearks' isporučen, u svijetu transparentnog interneta (bjelodanog međumrežija) nitko se s primjedbom oglasio nije.

Potpora potiče, zajedništvo ujedinjuje, nakladnike nasrtljive rastjeruje ... zainteresiranost budućeg čitatelja spisateljsko nagnuće raspaljuje i daje kreativan mir.

Hvala svima!

story:
My name is Heather and this is my story. It follows me from marrying my best friend, succeeding through an infertility struggle, to becoming a widow and ultimately a single mother. This is a journal of my life after losing the love of my life to mental illness and suicide. My hope is to help others out there who may be travelling a similar path as I am. 

I had a rather "normal" life. I was 28 years old, married to a wonderful man, seven months into motherhood and following my expected career path. In one night, with the shocking discovery of my husband's death, everything changed. 

I needed a way to heal, to grieve, to get the demons out of my head, and to make something positive from the trauma I’d been handed. That was the start of my blog… The Widow Next Door…​

This book is the story of that journey; a day to day journal of the raw truth of what I was living, and how I survived. 

When I began writing my blog, I really had no idea where it would take me. I knew it was helping to get out my thoughts and feelings, and hoped it was helping others as well. The response was incredible. I was doing it! I was helping and connecting with people. It meant something to others to watch my struggles and successes. There were so many out there that could relate to my stories. It helped some just by knowing there was someone that could relate to their experiences. It helped bring awareness to something so prominent in our society, that no one ever wants to talk about.

By writing this book, it puts everything together, who I was before, how I survived, and where I am now. The positive impact can only grow.

This is my life, and I have not only survived, but thrived. I hope to help others do the same. 

With your donation, I can make the dream come true. I can get my story published. By sharing my campaign, my story can reach farther than I had ever imagined.

story:
Story of My Book

Beyond the Byline: A Look Into The Future of Writing

My name is Lindsay Wigo and I am the author of Beyond the Byline. I wrote this book because I wanted to dive deeper into the different careers that exist in the journalism and media world. Beyond The Byline is a non-fiction book that speaks to young journalists and media lovers who are looking at the future of the industries and how to make yourself stand out for the first time.

My hope is that in reading this book, you will discover there is a lot more to a writing career than just reporting. There is an abundance of ways to hone in on your writing. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for journalism and media in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you decide where you want to take your talents in the future.

In this book, you'll learn about the intersection of business and journalism and the future of digital media. More specifically...
  • The past of journalism— with some help from Jason Feifer. 
  • The rise of digital media— from YouTube channels like Jubilee and Cut.
  • The different media careers - like public relations agency owner, TV news reporter, Editor-In-Chief, video researcher and so many more!

You will love this book if you have a list of passions that fall into both journalism and media— or you want to explore both!

 

The Book - Beyond the Byline

The book is written in 6 parts...

Part 1 contains the introduction + a chapter on a brief history of journalism, with help from a few professionals. You’ll learn about why I chose to write this book, a bit of background info on journalism’s recent history and the 2019 media job cuts. You’ll hear from Entrepreneur Magazine’s Editor-In-Chief, Jason Feifer!

Part 2 contains chapter 2, which is focused on building a business. You’ll hear from Kate Beckman, a woman who started a college lifestyle platform as a freshman when she realized there was a lack of articles on what it was like to be a freshman in college. 

Part 3 contains chapter 3, which is all about taking advantage of social media. You'll hear stories from a TV news reporter, Clancy Burke, who runs a YouTube channel on the side to show her behind the scenes life as a reporter. This section includes tips on growing your social media to help expand and promote your passions.

Part 4 contains chapter 4, which answers some questions you're too nervous to ask— like how do I find out what type of writing I'm good at? How much do I charge for my work? What should my website look like? You'll learn more about my journalism background and some tips I have for fellow creatives. Just some honesty from writer to writer.

Part 5 contains chapter 5, which focuses on branching out of your comfort zone and changing things up within your career. You'll hear from some people who jumped from career to career, like Rahkal Shelton, who ended up finding a passion for working with kids and formed that into a career. You'll also hear a fun story of how one woman met and interviewed TV personality, Andy Samberg. 

Part 6 contains chapter 6, which touches on solutions to different journalism problems we see arising. At this point, we've come full circle and continue to talk about the future of journalism!
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019.
  • The cover design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The copyediting for my book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter!

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a “Special Acknowledgements Section” of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...
     

About the Author

Lindsay Wigo is a writer and editor with more than three years of experience in digital journalism. With a lifelong passion for writing starting in elementary school, she was very excited to branch into the journalism and digital media worlds.

Oftentimes, people think that great writers are destined to be great reporters— and nothing else. However, talented writers can be entrepreneurs, videographers, YouTubers, teachers and so much more. With a passion for many different areas of media and journalism, it can be hard to decide where you want to end up. It can be overwhelming to dig through dozens of careers. This book is aimed to help anyone figure out where they might want to end up— by hearing from people in those positions!

For more information, you can connect with me at www.lindsaywigo.com.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Tag me on Instagram, @heyitslindsss, as well as my publisher, @NewDegreePress, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

-Lindsay

story:
Story of My Book

Unlearning Creativity is a non-fiction book exploring vital concepts such as human connection, the transfer of knowledge, and a socially-defined concept, creativity.

My name is Sam Budiartho, and I am the author of Unlearning Creativity. I was inspired to write this book for two reasons. The first pertains to how the education system fails through labeling only a certain set of students as creative. Where usually these “creative” students excel at traditional art, such as painting, crafts, and music-making. Through my book, I want to showcase how everyone is creative in their specific fields. Individuals who delve in non-traditional art, such as engineering and math, are creative too. The second reason of inspiration is human connection—how learning is facilitated by engaging with those around us, even in unconventional spaces. You never know what the person behind you at the DMV knows that might benefit you. We are all walking databases with x amount of years of knowledge (x being your age). We’ve grown up through different circumstances and go through personal and unique experiences. I write about how it is important to keep an open mind when engaging with anyone and to allow yourself to delve into conversations with individuals you might usually shy away from.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your unique stance in creativity and open your mind up to unconventional connections. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the transfer of knowledge and the arts—both traditional and non-traditional in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you view everyone, no matter if they have a Bachelors degree or not, as a database that may advance your understanding of something trivial, such as tying up your hair with chopsticks, or something heavy, such as the world.

In this book, you'll learn about the different facets of creativity and learning through an array of individuals. I write about the weirdly enthralling conversations with my Uber driver I met twice on two separate trips, to two completely different places. I write about contrasting individuals such as a Computer Science major who fuels his creativity through a string of letters and numbers and juxtapose that with painters and their creativity. The main question I try to answer is, what is creativity’s relationship with logic? [blank] is a lot about adaptability and how you react to given circumstances. Would you fill that blank in with creativity or with logic? I think the definition works for both creativity and logic, but it will vary depending with what you attach yourself most.

You will love this book if you are interested in understanding the facets of creativity, are a people person, are interested in pop psychology, or if you’re a creator (which is everyone in a sense).

 

The Book - Unlearning Creativity

The book is written in six chapters, and every chapter starts with a fictional poem I’ve written. These poems are woven into the non-fictional chapters and are included to convey my creative process without further explaining myself. Show instead of tell.

In the introduction, I primarily talk about the transfer of knowledge and human interaction. I add personal stories about how I was enlightened by a simple, yet deep conversation with my Uber driver about the hierarchy of scale. We spoke about how ants are creatures that work toward survival but would never understand complex concepts such as humans being excited about escape rooms. Then we spoke about something less trivial and more daunting; does a higher power/deity exist that we as humans could never understand?

Chapter 1 pertains to how I people watch and analyze different individuals. I talk about my invisible couch named Solomon, an inspiration taken from many past psychologists such as Freud. I take Solomon wherever I go, and I analyse individuals who sit on him and explain my process of learning. Imitation. A little quirky and hard to understand at a glimpse, but it is honestly a phenomenal tool for learning from others, without their realization.

Chapter 2 involves the relationship with the left and right brain or logic and creativity, respectively. The chapter revolves around a computer science major from the University of Southern California and exploring his creative process through a personalized interview. The interview supports my argument that creativity is found within everyone, even those who do not create traditional art. Though social conditioning has made us believe that logic and creativity are two very different facets, I illustrate how both of these components work in coordination. Without logic, there is no creativity and vice versa.

Chapter 3 is primarily about diving into the unknown, referring to establishing our mental boundaries and breaking away from them. I included interviews of two very different photographers, illustrating how they excel as photographers by diving into uncomfortable situations. In the first interview, the photographer talks about his ADHD and partial dyslexia and how he utilizes perspective to control the viewers through his photography. The second photographer talks about his best friend losing a loved one. The grief and pain inspired him to preserve the emotions of his subjects—no matter how emotionally draining it may be.

Chapter 4 is devoted to my creative process. How I navigate the world through my creative process and how I fell in love with creating hyperrealistic charcoal drawings. It may seem to some that artists are just "born with talent" and are inclined to create art from a young age. This perception was not the case for me. I write about how I was forced into art classes and "failed to succeed" as an artist (according to my teachers) because I didn't want to follow the "conventional rules" of art school. In this chapter, I include photos of my drawings - most of them being deformed portraits - and explain the thought processes behind them.

Chapter 5 is my final chapter. I wrap everything together by writing about synesthesia and multi-hyphenates. Synesthesia is the condition that allows the brain to process several senses simultaneously. Specifically, in this chapter, I talk about my personal experience having grapheme-color synesthesia and how I see specific colors when reading or thinking about particular words. With this in mind, I talk about how my synesthesia affects my writing and creative process. Regarding the multi-hyphenate topic of the chapter, I interviewed a graduate student studying screenwriting with many different pursuits. Through this interview, I analyze how, being a multi-hyphenate himself allows him to develop memorable stories.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

My name is Sam Budiartho, and my fascination for psychology began at the University of Southern California where I studied both unconventional art and anthropology, along with Marketing and UI/UX Design,as well.

As an individual who is enthralled with psychology, unconventional art and anthropology, I’m passionate about writing because I believe I grow through creating all forms of art. Through creating, I am able to embellish my cognitive thoughts into the material world. This book is truly my passion project, and I wish to create positive impact in a world (no matter the gravity of it). My hope for the book is for communities to strive to be closer and for people to connect with one another. On the other hand, I’m curious about the intersection of creativity and logic and how the two relate to one another. Through my book, I’m trying to break through the social confinements of what creativity is, to allow everyone to realize that creativity resonates within them.

Coming from an international background, I sometimes feel out of place with my identity. I was born and raised in Singapore and Indonesia and moved far away from home to further my education in the United States. Despite being uncertain and feeling a little lost in the world, I wrote this book to remind myself of my journey and purpose — something fundamentally related to connecting to a diverse array of individuals, and following the wave of where life takes me.

Check out my art at www.sambudiartho.com/

For more information you can connect with Sam at
Email: budiarth@usc.edu
Instagram: @sambudiarts
LinkedIn: @RainaBudiartho
(Yes, my full name is Raina Samantha Budiartho, and I go by Sam for short)

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #UnlearningCreativity and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all your love and support!

With Love,
Sam Budiartho

story:
Story of My Book

Fooling Sheep is a book about a modern day Turing Test, where coming-of-age meets a psychological AI simulation. It’s a mystery about high schoolers discovering the true nature of themselves and everyone around them, all in an attempt to figure out the identity of the humanoid robot in their lives.

My name is Simone Lamont and I am the author of Fooling Sheep. I wrote this book because I wanted to combine my love for science fiction with my own life experiences growing up, and I wanted to write a story of technology that hasn’t been told before. You don’t often get the artificial intelligence thriller genre in young adult fiction books, much less in a high school environment, and yet I think it’s the perfect place to explore those themes.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover unconventional friendships, suspenseful sci-fi grounded in reality, and a story about developing your personal identity. At it’s core this is a book about human connection in its most experimental form.

The book follows Olivia, the new kid at Park Falls high school. It’s a high school that’s participating in an artificial intelligence simulation where a humanoid robot is anonymously placed among the students. Olivia just wants to fit in with her peers, but even she can’t resist the hunt for the identity of the robot among them. After an unexpected death and a series of impossible coincidences, Olivia and her new friends begin to doubt the authenticity of each other and their own lives.

You will love this book if you enjoy science fiction thrillers like Ex Machina and Westworld, or if you’re looking for a suspenseful young adult story that will constantly keep you guessing.

Fooling Sheep speaks to high school and college students who are growing up in this age of technology and learning how to be adults in a world where the lines between our image and our own identities are blurred.

Ultimately, I hope that Fooling Sheep inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What does it mean to be human in a world where we’re constantly creating new versions of ourselves?
  • Do we really know where we fit into the constructs of our society, or are we just learning to play a role and imitating those around us?
  • What is our generation’s greatest fears about technology and the advancement of AI? How are these fears different from the fears of people in generations before us?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing these subjects of our future generations will change us all for the better.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author


Simone Lamont has combined her passion for science fiction and artificial intelligence with her own previous high school experiences. She wants to explore the impact of technology on her generation and how it will shape their social norms, while also connecting with other people who are still growing up and realizing that it’s okay not to have everything figured out just yet.

Outside of writing and school, Simone is an avid movie and TV buff, casual guitar player, Lego enthusiast, and occasional outdoorsman born and raised in Colorado. She spends her free time with her crazy supportive friends and family, and can’t wait to continue writing.

For more information you can connect with Simone at simonelamontwriting@gmail.com and on Instagram @simonelamontwrites.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FoolingSheep and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Simone Lamont

story:
The Story of Cacophony

What are some noises that are drowning out your heart?

Cacophony is the first novel in a series that explores empathy through the lens of minorities in the US and in China. Juxtaposing the lives of people with insanely different backgrounds, I tried to craft a story that means so much more than me. It's humanity. It's, in my language, 人之常情. 

Dolkar is a survivor of human trafficking- her story is wild but she is resilient. Arno is someone who has been through hell and is back again, serving this world more than anyone ever thought possible. They are met with questions such as: 

  • Is my service to others for my own sanity and ego or is it really out of deep conviction? Are they separable? 
  • How is it possible to forgive them when I can't even begin to forgive myself? 

 

Idalia is an Asian-American whose first love and career direct her towards these moments of awareness that bring her face to face with universal questions such as:

  • What do I want? What do I really want? What have I been taught to want? How do I separate that from what I really want?
  • How far should authenticity go before it becomes rude?
  • How far should I go to chase my heart when it’s been ingrained in my values to respect the shoulders upon which I stand on? Why can’t I have both? Can I make it so I have both?
  • Is he really the one I love or did I take his image and craft an ideal I want?

 

My name is Ruby Wei, and I am the author of Cacophony. I wrote this book because I just couldn’t get this story out of my head. It’s as if it has a life of its own, and all I did was engage with it throughout these past few months. The best I could do for you is to type it out and gift it to you, a time capsule of my entire heart and essence. Here, I didn’t hold anything back.

You will enjoy this book if you love a good story at the end of a long work or school week to carry you away (John Mayer anyone?) from everything grappling with your peace of mind. I have the book, you got the wine? (or get the wine bundle and I'll have the wine and the book for you) 

My sincere hope is that, after reading Cacophony, you’ll embark on the same journey I think we should all be on: to understand before we reply, to empathize before we ostracize, to learn before we judge, to love deeply, to dream wildly, to live- the best way we know how. To be kind- to ourselves as well as to everyone else.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press (https://www.newdegreepress.com/). I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Creative Rights to own my book
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover design
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process
  • And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

  • $5500: the ebook and softcover editions get published 
  • $6500: hardcover edition gets published
  • $8500: audiobook edition (I'll record it for you! I like to believe I have a lovely reading voice) 
  • Every penny above break-even goes straight to charity- to be chosen by you all; essentially I don’t plan on profiting at all and I’d love to see the charities you love and care about be backed up by this book

 

About the Author

Ruby Wei is a student at Texas A&M University who will be graduating in May 2022 with a bachelor’s in Finance and a focus in Nonprofit and Social Innovation.

Cacophony came out of a place of feeling like she’s taken too much from the world and haven’t given anything back. Jokes on her, she went to an extreme and ended up giving everything back. Her whole self. Her whole heart. Everything she’s in love with, spelled out right there in front of you. Yet more than anything, she wanted to learn more about the ideas she touches on in her novel and to take her readers on a similar journey of learning. This book consists of more than just her- it's the voice of an Asian-American battling the invisibility of her people in America. Invisibility carves out space for bias, which catapults into hate, erupting into violence- this is her speaking, not just as herself, but as part of this Asian American legacy. 

Outside of her love for literature, you can catch Ruby wandering somewhere she thought she would be but ended up getting lost at. Seriously, this girl has the direction sense of a rock- if not worse. A rock wouldn’t go so far as to tell you the wrong direction. Travel with her; would you dare? She also has this thing for all action films- Jackie Chan and Marvel, especially.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

1. Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

2. Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

3. Use this form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc0xLDWpu-Dds1Ug1eDulctfRruU_cRRvpURWPQVbq_GLyOnA/viewform?usp=sf_link to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but I’d love your help! Anything goes a long way-
  • please share this Indiegogo campaign page across your social medias
  • please use #Cacophony and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts
Tag:
  • Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/rubyweibingqiao/ / @newdegreepress
  • LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/rubywei/
  • spread the word face to face, through DM, or text- anyone you think would be interested


Thank you so much for all of your love and support- you are about to make my dream come true!

Love,
Ruby

ps: stay tuned for the next novel (the idea is there, the execution? long ways away)

story:
Story of My Book

 

The book is about how new technology and outlets have changed the media industry, specifically in the sports industry. I wrote it because I work in the sports media industry, and I noticed that major media outlets are having trouble connecting with younger sports fans and I wanted to solve this problem. My book will publish in December 2019.

The Intersection of Technology, Sports, & Media in the 21st Century.

This book takes you through the history of media and journalism in America, and how technological advancements have shaped these industries over time, most deeply in the sports industry... I touch on how modern technological advancements have created a type of sports fan that consumes content completely different than in the past.

My name is Camron Brown and I am the author of the Intersection of Technology, Sports, & Media in the21st Century. I wrote this book because I noticed that many sports media companies are having trouble connecting with millennials and the next generation of sports fans. The industry is evolving and this book covers the evolution.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how technology has changed our consumption habits while helping media companies better adapt to “new fans”. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for Sports Media in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you create more interactive content and platforms for fans.

In this book, you'll learn about Technology and Sports Media:

  •  Telegraph to Mobile Phones “Knowing your History”. 
  • Bullet Point - Evolution into the “New Consumer/Fan”...
    • Robert Kraft believes new consumers aren't fans
    • Television Ratings Decreasing
  • Bullet Point - What type of changes need to happen “What Sports Fans Want”
    • Top type of Apps Today 
      • We are clearly stating what type of content we want, but are ignoring the obvious.
    • More & More connection
      • We live in a society where people yearn for more and more connection and the same is in the sports industry.

You will love this book if you are into journalism or the media industry, if you are a sports fan, or if you have followed the technological advancements and their effect on consumption habits. 
The intersection of Technology, Sports, & Media in the 21st Century is a non-fiction book that speaks to New Journalist/ Those who work in Media, Sports Executives, and Sports Fans who are looking at Technology and Sports Media  for the first time.

 

The Intersection of Technology, Sports, & Media in the 21st Century. ​


The book is written in 3 Parts...

Part 1 contains the introduction + History. The first part will walk us through the history of journalism/media in America and technological advancements that have impacted consumption habits throughout time.

Part 2 contains Who/What a New Consumer Fan is. Many executives in the sports industry are losing faith in the next generation of sports fans. New Consumers/Fans are not consuming content the same way as we have traditionally measured it, but they are fans. We have to look at what new fans like and what they are saying they want. 

Part 3 contains What Sports Fans Want and How we reach them. Technology has changed consumption, leading to a new type of sports fan. Sports fans are telling us what they want, so this section of the book will give insight on how to go after these new fans. To reach these fans we have to listen with more than our ears.
