story:
Story of My Book

Letters To My Brown Mother is about the struggles with mental health in the South Asian (desi) diaspora. The book details experiences of everyday South Asian immigrants and children of immigrants.

My name is Muzna Abbas and I am the author of Letters To My Brown Mother. I wrote this book in hopes to dismantle the stigma surrounding mental health in the South Asian community. Mental wellbeing is rarely prioritized or discussed in South Asian households, causing many to suffer in silence without any help and support. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the necessity of discussing and understanding the nuances of this stigma. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn how mental health and culture interact. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you prioritize your mental health and have the difficult (but very important) conversation about this topic with your family and the broader diaspora community. 

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of toxic masculinity, patriarchal gender norms, and the immigrant experience through letters like:
  • Log Kya Kahenge (What will people say?): A story about the impact of placing immense value on image and society’s opinion of how to live your life.
  • Poster Child: Describing the mental health and identity crises we face while balancing being children of immigrants and ‘third-culture kids.’
  • Family Heirlooms: This letter details the consequences of daughters carrying the burden of family honor.
You will love this book if you are interested in learning about how cultural factors make prioritizing mental health taboo. While this book discusses the experiences of South Asian immigrants, many of these stories apply to all immigrant communities.

Letters To My Brown Mother speaks to the immigrant generation, to give them insight on their children’s struggles with mental health. The book is equally for us, their children, to give us a platform and the space to heal. 

Ultimately, I hope that Letters To My Brown Mother inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • How is my mental health affected by my experiences as a South Asian immigrant?
  • How can I have the difficult conversation about mental health with my family and community?
  • What is needed to dismantle the stigma towards mental health in our communities?
  • How can we be better for our future generations?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing mental heath and the South Asian approach to dealing with it (or not dealing with it) will change us all for the better. 
 

The Book - Letters To My Brown Mother

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapter 1. This includes a brief history of South Asian immigration and culture as well as an overview of mental health conditions. The psychology is important to break down, especially because it is the least understood in our communities. 

Part 2 contains chapters 2-10. Here you will find a series of letters based-off of real stories from South Asian Americans around the United States. The letters discuss the many issues our generation has faced. Each chapter will cover a cultural theme or phenomena that either negatively affects mental health in desi communities or further deepens the stigma towards it. Among these are: color-ism, internalized racism, toxic masculinity, misogynistic gender roles, and more. 

Part 3 contains chapters 11-15 and discusses how we can protect our mental health and move forward. I present several strategies recommended and studied by medical professionals, some that I have used. This last part of the book also details how we can have the difficult conversation about mental health with our loved ones. Having these discussions is not only another mechanism to take care of our mental health, but it is also an opportunity for us to break the stigma

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Muzna Abbas (she/her) is a dual-degree Masters student pursuing an MBA and a Masters in Foreign Service at Georgetown University. Prior to graduate school, Muzna was a bilingual educator, teaching 5th and 6th grade students in English and Spanish. 

As a Pakistani-American daughter of immigrants, Muzna wrote this book as an ode to her own struggles with mental health. She hopes that sharing her insights and those of her peers will encourage others to be more proactive in taking care of their mental wellbeing.

In her free time, Muzna enjoys cooking for her friends and trying out new recipes. She is a new dog mom to Baxter and loves spending time with her furry friend. Muzna also enjoys traveling (pre-pandemic) and can’t wait to continue her travels soon. 

For more information, you can connect with Muzna Abbas via:
  • Email
  • LinkedIn
  • Instagram
  • Twitter

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that this is an uncertain time and financial concerns are very real. I would love for you to help my campaign in other ways:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LettersToMyBrownMother and tag me (@muznaa23) as well as my publisher, New Degree Press (@newdegreepress), so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!


Much love and pyaar,
Muzna Abbas

story:
Story of My Book


That (Expletive) Broad: Women Who Broke Barriers in the Casino and Gaming Industry is an exploration of the journeys of amazing women who have defied the odds and pushed the boundaries to make their mark in what many believe is a "man's world." I look at where they came from, what inspired them, what challenged them, and how they overcame those challenges to become the first women to achieve each position or distinction in the world of casinos and gaming.

My name is Jennifer Gaynor and I am the author of That (Expletive) Broad: Women Who Broke Barriers in the Casino and Gaming Industry. I wrote this book because after 15 years working as a casino and gaming industry attorney, I realized that all of the history I'd learned about the industry centers on men. Men like Sheldon Adelson, Bob Stupack, Oscar Goodman, Benny Binion, Steve Wynn, and even the “wise guys” from the city’s mafia heyday, such as Tony Spilotro and Frank “Lefty” Rosenthal--made famous in the movie Casino.

No doubt, these men played pivotal roles in creating the casino and gaming industry as we know and love it today. But what about the women? Surely there were women involved in the birth and growth of the gaming industry. But who were they? What were their stories? I was compelled to find out.

It might surprise you to learn that women have actually played a major role in the gambling industry from its earliest days--as gamblers, dealers, and even gaming establishment owners. In fact, some of Las Vegas’s first and most historic casinos were owned and run by women. Women have even been managers and executives at major gaming companies as well as the regulators shaping the future of the industry. The more I started to research these women, the more inspired I became, and this book was born.

I hope you'll agree with me that the stories of these women are fascinating and entertaining reads in their own right. They give you a unique perspective into the history of Las Vegas and the gaming and casino industry. You get to see this history through the eyes and experience of the women who were there.

These stories are also a must for readers who would like to be inspired by true stories of women who have broken barriers in what is very much a “man’s industry.”

Finally, by looking at the entire journey of the life and careers of these women--not just specific moments or a list of their achievements--this book provides an instructive first-hand look into how ground-breakers are created.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be inspired, as I have been, by these women (our "Broads") and their stories. Just how did each rise to the top in the “man’s world” of casinos and gaming? Although the journey of each woman is very different, they all share certain traits and behaviors that make them exceptional. These women are curious, resilient, and risk-taking. They are all exceptionally hard-working. And they are brave in their willingness to be the first, even when their presence as a woman was not always welcome.

That (Expletive) Broad is Written in Three Parts.

Part [1] contains the Introduction + Chapter 1, which looks at the history of the casino and gaming industry. We dive into how the role of women in the industry has evolved from the early days of gambling in the U.S., asking the question: Is it still a “man’s world?”

Part [2] contains Chapters 2 - 7. These chapters look at the overarching themes we see in the journey of our Broads, the decisions they made, the challenges they faced, and the traits that helped them to become "firsts" in the industry. For example, one of the most impactful lessons I’ve learned from these ground-breaking women is the fact that, for most, their paths to success were winding, rambling, and even, in some cases, had “U-turns,” pauses, or backwards steps along the way. This absolutely turned everything I thought I knew about how to achieve success on its head.

I also learned that our Broads did not find their success by playing “queen of the hill” and fighting off all other would-be female challengers for the one spot at the top. Instead, they found not only great personal satisfaction but also career success through doing the opposite--by helping other women rise along with them. I'm hoping this book will help to change the conventional wisdom about women helping other women in the workforce. Today, the new conventional wisdom should be that “real women, successful women, help other women to come up.”

Part [3] contains Chapters 8 - 11. This is my favorite part of the book, where I get to share the incredible stories of these amazing women.


For example:

You'll meet card players and dealers from the Wild West, women such as Lottie Deno and Poker Alice, who tangled with infamous men such as Doc Holliday, Jessee James, and Wyatt Earp.

You'll meet women like Shirley Brancucci: a cocktail server and cards dealer on the Las Vegas Strip during the 1970s and early 1980s, when the mafia ran things in a rough and tumble manner that mirrored, in many ways, the Wild West.

You'll read the almost-unbelievable tale of Claudine Williams, a high-school dropout who became one of the first women to own and run a casino on the Las Vegas Strip.

You'll be inspired by Sarann Knight Preddy, who went from a keno writer and blackjack dealer in the after-hours clubs on Las Vegas’s segregated Westside during the 1950s to become the first African-American woman to obtain a gaming license in Nevada.

You'll also learn the story of Debra Nutton, the inspiration for the working title of this book. Back in the 1970s and 1980s, when she started working on the floor in Las Vegas casinos, her presence, at least in her positions as dealer and pit boss, was not welcomed by her male peers. In fact, they would often refer to her as “that (expletive) broad.” I’m sure they didn’t mean that as a compliment. But I love it. I hope that this book inspires you, as it has inspired me, to take that risk, to do that thing that you want to do but are scared to do. To be “that (expletive) broad.”


What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this [season of year]

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

And more...

About the Author


This year marks my 15th anniversary as a casino and gaming attorney in Las Vegas, Nevada.
I first got the idea to write this book when I was at a national gaming law conference last year. The large conference room in a well-appointed hotel on the Northern California coast was filled with gaming regulators and attorneys who were in-house with large gaming companies or, like me, in private practice serving clients who are in the casino or gaming industry.

As any bored conference attendee does in the morning while waiting for the conference to begin, I sipped tea and flipped through the overview of speakers and panelists for the day. I noticed immediately that almost all of the presenters were exclusively male. This really struck me. I wondered why, in this day and age, when there are so many amazing women in our industry, that was the case.

I thought to myself, “Well, some things never change.” But then, looking around the room, I saw a number of very powerful women in the audience--women who are leaders in the industry--and I realized that things are changing (despite the lack of diversity in the speaker lineup). I also realized just how much these women meant to me--as role models, friends and mentors--and I wanted to shine a spotlight on them. Not only did I want to highlight the women who have inspired or guided me in my own life and career, but also those who came before and have paved the way for the women in that room, and those yet to come and make their mark.

I decided at that moment that I would make sure that these women are not overlooked when the history of casinos and gaming is written. I wanted to record their stories and make sure they are remembered. This is what my book aims to do.

For more information, you can connect with me at jenniferjgaynor@gmail.com and on Facebook and LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #thatexpletivebroad and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.


You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jennifer Gaynor
story_txt: Story of My BookThat (Expletive) Broad: Women Who Broke Barriers in the Casino and Gaming Industry is an exploration of the journeys of amazing women who have defied the odds and pushed the boundaries to make their mark in what many believe is a "man's world." I look at where they came from, what inspired them, what challenged them, and how they overcame those challenges to become the first women to achieve each position or distinction in the world of casinos and gaming.My name is Jennifer Gaynor and I am the author of That (Expletive) Broad: Women Who Broke Barriers in the Casino and Gaming Industry. I wrote this book because after 15 years working as a casino and gaming industry attorney, I realized that all of the history I'd learned about the industry centers on men. Men like Sheldon Adelson, Bob Stupack, Oscar Goodman, Benny Binion, Steve Wynn, and even the “wise guys” from the city’s mafia heyday, such as Tony Spilotro and Frank “Lefty” Rosenthal--made famous in the movie Casino.No doubt, these men played pivotal roles in creating the casino and gaming industry as we know and love it today. But what about the women? Surely there were women involved in the birth and growth of the gaming industry. But who were they? What were their stories? I was compelled to find out.It might surprise you to learn that women have actually played a major role in the gambling industry from its earliest days--as gamblers, dealers, and even gaming establishment owners. In fact, some of Las Vegas’s first and most historic casinos were owned and run by women. Women have even been managers and executives at major gaming companies as well as the regulators shaping the future of the industry. The more I started to research these women, the more inspired I became, and this book was born.I hope you'll agree with me that the stories of these women are fascinating and entertaining reads in their own right. They give you a unique perspective into the history of Las Vegas and the gaming and casino industry. You get to see this history through the eyes and experience of the women who were there.These stories are also a must for readers who would like to be inspired by true stories of women who have broken barriers in what is very much a “man’s industry.”Finally, by looking at the entire journey of the life and careers of these women--not just specific moments or a list of their achievements--this book provides an instructive first-hand look into how ground-breakers are created.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be inspired, as I have been, by these women (our "Broads") and their stories. Just how did each rise to the top in the “man’s world” of casinos and gaming? Although the journey of each woman is very different, they all share certain traits and behaviors that make them exceptional. These women are curious, resilient, and risk-taking. They are all exceptionally hard-working. And they are brave in their willingness to be the first, even when their presence as a woman was not always welcome.That (Expletive) Broad is Written in Three Parts.Part [1] contains the Introduction + Chapter 1, which looks at the history of the casino and gaming industry. We dive into how the role of women in the industry has evolved from the early days of gambling in the U.S., asking the question: Is it still a “man’s world?”Part [2] contains Chapters 2 - 7. These chapters look at the overarching themes we see in the journey of our Broads, the decisions they made, the challenges they faced, and the traits that helped them to become "firsts" in the industry. For example, one of the most impactful lessons I’ve learned from these ground-breaking women is the fact that, for most, their paths to success were winding, rambling, and even, in some cases, had “U-turns,” pauses, or backwards steps along the way. This absolutely turned everything I thought I knew about how to achieve success on its head.I also learned that our Broads did not find their success by playing “queen of the hill” and fighting off all other would-be female challengers for the one spot at the top. Instead, they found not only great personal satisfaction but also career success through doing the opposite--by helping other women rise along with them. I'm hoping this book will help to change the conventional wisdom about women helping other women in the workforce. Today, the new conventional wisdom should be that “real women, successful women, help other women to come up.”Part [3] contains Chapters 8 - 11. This is my favorite part of the book, where I get to share the incredible stories of these amazing women.For example:You'll meet card players and dealers from the Wild West, women such as Lottie Deno and Poker Alice, who tangled with infamous men such as Doc Holliday, Jessee James, and Wyatt Earp.You'll meet women like Shirley Brancucci: a cocktail server and cards dealer on the Las Vegas Strip during the 1970s and early 1980s, when the mafia ran things in a rough and tumble manner that mirrored, in many ways, the Wild West.You'll read the almost-unbelievable tale of Claudine Williams, a high-school dropout who became one of the first women to own and run a casino on the Las Vegas Strip.You'll be inspired by Sarann Knight Preddy, who went from a keno writer and blackjack dealer in the after-hours clubs on Las Vegas’s segregated Westside during the 1950s to become the first African-American woman to obtain a gaming license in Nevada.You'll also learn the story of Debra Nutton, the inspiration for the working title of this book. Back in the 1970s and 1980s, when she started working on the floor in Las Vegas casinos, her presence, at least in her positions as dealer and pit boss, was not welcomed by her male peers. In fact, they would often refer to her as “that (expletive) broad.” I’m sure they didn’t mean that as a compliment. But I love it. I hope that this book inspires you, as it has inspired me, to take that risk, to do that thing that you want to do but are scared to do. To be “that (expletive) broad.”What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. story:
Podcasting in the World of Social Media is about me and my podcasting journey while helping others to discover their podcast dreams

My name is Maggie Kooi and I am the author of Podcasting in the World of Social Media. I wrote this book because I have a passion for podcasting. I wanted to share with you the freedom to speak your mind that podcasts have to offer--through the creation of your own podcast and through the knowledge of other podcasters.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that podcasting has the potential for many doors to be opened such as working with other podcasters and participating in podcast events. In this book, I hope to instill my passion for podcasting in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you start your very own podcast from the ground up.

In this book, you'll learn about The Target Girl, Lauren who has created a podcast name for herself, Podcast and Do's & Don'ts of Podcasting:

The Target Girl and her podcast inspire to do your podcast your own way.

Do edit your podcast once you start recording your podcast.

Don’t fret when it comes to learning more information about your podcast-it's all here.

You will love this book if you are already a podcast listener or want to start your own podcast.
Podcasting in the World of Social Media is a non-fiction book that speaks to podcasters and podcast listeners who are looking at podcasts and how podcasts are created for the first time.

The Book - Podcasting in the World of Social Media

The book is written in 3 Parts...

Part 1 contains the Introduction + Chapters 3-8. Readers will learn that podcasting is hard work in this section, there are many layers to podcasting. This section includes an interview with The Target Girl, Lauren who has her very own podcast and why she has chosen the podcast path to head down. We will also dive into the business and background of podcasts and social media, as well as why you should listen to podcasts over the radio.

Part 2 contains Chapters 10-15. Readers will learn all about empowering women in podcasting, along with special guests you bring on your episodes through the connections that you will make. This section will also be about the power of Facebook groups in podcasting and how marketing is involved in podcasts.

Part 3 contains Chapters 17-18. Where my passion for podcasting comes from is in this section, along with looking through the behind the scenes of a blogger who is a fellow podcast listener.

What I Need & What You'll Get

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019. This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Maggie Kooi is a student at West Georgia who has gone through a plethora of radio classes and discovered that podcasting was her niche as a listener and future podcaster.

I wrote this book because my passion lies in podcasting, hearing those with real stories talking to real people. I also really enjoy podcasting because it’s a creative outlet. In my spare time outside of podcasting as my interest, I enjoy going to breweries with my family in Michigan and I love to watch Netflix.

For more information, you can connect with Maggie at MaggieKooi@yahoo.com, @maggiekooi on Instagram, or @maggiekooi on Twitter.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #WorldPodcast and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Maggie Kooi

story:
Please Note:

   All proceeds and contributions will go to the publishing and publicity of the poetry to help the author avoid the expansive price of out of pocket expenses. Any money raised for the printing and publishing of said book above the 10,000 dollar campaign goal will be donated to the Dubai Foundation for Women and Children. 

يرجى العلم أن جميع العائدات والمساهمات ستخصص إلى نشر الشعر و الدعاية المطلوبة لمساعدة المؤلف على تجنب النفقات الهائلة التى سيتحملها شخصيا.كما يرجى العلم انه سيتم التبرع لمؤسسة دبي للنساء والأطفال بأية أموال اضافية يتم جمعها فوق 10000 دولار و هو الهدف من حملتنا

 

It's Been a Long Time Coming (Background to our Project) 

(لقد مر وقتا طويلا (خلفية المشروع الخاص بك

   My name is Benjamin Raymond and I have something very dear to me I’d like to share with you, but first, a little about myself. 

اسمي بنيامين ريمون ولديّ شيء عزيز على قلبي أود أن أشاطركم اياه، لكن أولاً ، دعوني أخبركم قليلاً عن نفسي.

   I am an international educator and author from Santa Cruz, California who has been living in the wondrous city of Abu Dhabi for the past four years, and what a marvelous time it has been.

أنا مدرس دولي ومؤلف من سانتا كروز ، كاليفورنيا ، عشت في مدينة أبو ظبي الرائعة على مدار السنوات الأربع الماضية ، وقد كان وقتا رائعا بالفعل

   Nevertheless, it’s time for me to leave this glorious part of the world in just four short months to return to my long-lost home of California after seven years living abroad. If truth be told, it’s time for my wife and I to start a family, but we want to contribute something to you before we are gone. That’s why I am here talking to you through the miracle of the internet.  

ومع ذلك ، فقد حان الوقت لي لمغادرة هذا الجزء العظيم من العالم في غضون أربعة أشهر فقط للعودة إلى منزلي الذى افتقدته في كاليفورنيا بعد سبع سنوات من العيش في الخارج.لكى اكون صادقا ، لقد حان الوقت لزوجتي وأنا لبدء عائلة ، لكننا نريد أن نقدم لكم شيئًا ما قبل مغادرتنا.لهذا السبب أنا هنا أتحدث إليكم عبر معجزة الإنترنت.

   During my time in Abu Dhabi, I have been a poet, public speaker, and most importantly, a 7th grade teacher at the American International School. I have spent my time traveling this part of the world and experiencing new cultures and customs, but the truth is, what I will miss most is my relationships with my students.  

خلال فترة وجودي في أبو ظبي ، كنت شاعراً ومتحدثاً عاماً وقبل كل شيء مدرساً للصف السابع في المدرسة الأمريكية الدولية.لقد قضيت كل وقتي في السفر حول هذا الجزء من العالم وتجربة ثقافات وعادات جديدة ، ولكن الحقيقة هي أن أكثر ما سأفتقده هو علاقاتي مع طلابي.

   They have been a huge inspiration for me, encouraging me to grow, to write, and to become a better man. They have helped me redefine my understanding of what a hero is, and what it takes to inspire and change this world for the better. 

لقد كانوا مصدر إلهام كبيربالنسبة لي ، فقد شجعوني على النمو والكتابة وعلى ان أصبح رجلاً أفضل.لقد ساعدوني في ضبط فهمي لما يصنع بطلا ، وما يلزم لإلهام وتغيير هذا العالم للأفضل.

   And as I am leaving so soon, I wanted to do something special for them before I depart.

وبما أنني سأغادر قريبًا ، أردت أن أفعل شيئًا مميزًا لهم قبل مغادرتي.

The Power of Poetry (What We Need & What You Get)

(قوة الشعر (ما نحتاج إليه وما نحصل عليه بالفعل

   What I am here to tell you is that I am writing an English and Arabic bilingual book of poetry for beginners. It is for anybody, for kids and adults that are not well-versed in the magic and might of poetry, and for those well-acquainted with its mystery and magic. In many ways, the book is for my students to read after I am gone, but in truth, it really ought to be shared with the world. 

ما أنا هنا لأخبركم به هو أنني أكتب حاليًا كتابًا للشعر باللغة الإنجليزية والعربية للمبتدئين.انه مناسب للجميع ، للأطفال والكبار ، لأولئك الذين ليسوا على دراية جيدة بسحر وقوة الشعر ، ولأولئك الذين على دراية بغموضه وسحره.بشكل عام ، هذا الكتاب مخصص لطلابي لقراءته بعد رحيلي ، لكن لكي أكون صادقا ، يجب مشاركته مع العالم أجمع.

   The book will teach its readers how to truly read poetry, how to write poetry with inspiration and passion, and ultimately, how to live a poetic life. This book is my last advice, my last speech, my last act before I am gone. It is the gift I want to leave all the students I have had. It is a gift for their families. It is a gift for the community. And that is why I need your help.

   My name is Benjamin Raymond and I have something very dear to me I’d like to share with you, but first, a little about myself. 
اسمي بنيامين ريمون ولديّ شيء عزيز على قلبي أود أن أشاطركم اياه، لكن أولاً ، دعوني أخبركم قليلاً عن نفسي.
   I am an international educator and author from Santa Cruz, California who has been living in the wondrous city of Abu Dhabi for the past four years, and what a marvelous time it has been.
أنا مدرس دولي ومؤلف من سانتا كروز ، كاليفورنيا ، عشت في مدينة أبو ظبي الرائعة على مدار السنوات الأربع الماضية ، وقد كان وقتا رائعا بالفعل
   Nevertheless, it’s time for me to leave this glorious part of the world in just four short months to return to my long-lost home of California after seven years living abroad. If truth be told, it’s time for my wife and I to start a family, but we want to contribute something to you before we are gone. That’s why I am here talking to you through the miracle of the internet.  
ومع ذلك ، فقد حان الوقت لي لمغادرة هذا الجزء العظيم من العالم في غضون أربعة أشهر فقط للعودة إلى منزلي الذى افتقدته في كاليفورنيا بعد سبع سنوات من العيش في الخارج.لكى اكون صادقا ، لقد حان الوقت لزوجتي وأنا لبدء عائلة ، لكننا نريد أن نقدم لكم شيئًا ما قبل مغادرتنا.لهذا السبب أنا هنا أتحدث إليكم عبر معجزة الإنترنت.
   During my time in Abu Dhabi, I have been a poet, public speaker, and most importantly, a 7th grade teacher at the American International School. I have spent my time traveling this part of the world and experiencing new cultures and customs, but the truth is, what I will miss most is my relationships with my students.  
خلال فترة وجودي في أبو ظبي ، كنت شاعراً ومتحدثاً عاماً وقبل كل شيء مدرساً للصف السابع في المدرسة الأمريكية الدولية.لقد قضيت كل وقتي في السفر حول هذا الجزء من العالم وتجربة ثقافات وعادات جديدة ، ولكن الحقيقة هي أن أكثر ما سأفتقده هو علاقاتي مع طلابي.
   They have been a huge inspiration for me, encouraging me to grow, to write, and to become a better man. They have helped me redefine my understanding of what a hero is, and what it takes to inspire and change this world for the better. 
لقد كانوا مصدر إلهام كبيربالنسبة لي ، فقد شجعوني على النمو والكتابة وعلى ان أصبح رجلاً أفضل.لقد ساعدوني في ضبط فهمي لما يصنع بطلا ، وما يلزم لإلهام وتغيير هذا العالم للأفضل.
   And as I am leaving so soon, I wanted to do something special for them before I depart.
وبما أنني سأغادر قريبًا ، أردت أن أفعل شيئًا مميزًا لهم قبل مغادرتي.

story:
This is a book about a child, "Aiden" who can't help but correct others,  and sometimes that makes things a bit tricky for him.

I am a parent of three wonderful children, and have been working with children for 20 years, often supporting social and emotional development in  book smart kids who sometimes need some social guidance.  In that time, I have been a therapist, a social skill mentor, a teacher, and more recently, a parent. 

In every setting that I have worked in, I have known children who are struggling with finding a container for their depth of knowledge that doesn't alienate them from others. This book addresses that question for children and those that support them.

As the information age has taken the world by storm, it has become more and more apparent to parents of gifted children and those who support them, that Academic gifts can only take you so far. Those that really thrive, learn the social skills necessary to use their intelligence thoughtfully... and kindly.

What we need and what You Get

  • What You Get: (Aside from a kinder child):   Perks range from paperback book to a hardcover book, all the way to a personalized, in person,  workshop for parents, teachers, or counselors. 
  • What We Need: At this point, every sale takes us closer to our goal of being able to donate 100 books to schools and teachers that need it.   

The Impact

Do yourself a favor,  find a parent of a really bright child. Ask parents of a bright child if their child's intelligence has ever played a role in an awkward moment. If so, this book makes a great gift. If you are a school counselor, therapist or AIG teacher, this book can help you.

Risks & Challenges

I believe this book has broad appeal to many parents and children, I know how to appeal to parents of the bright kids who struggle socially. I am an engaged participant in the Autism,  Gifted, and ADHD communities, and have been talking about this book with hundreds of parents for the last two years.

Additionally, my professional work brings me into contact with therapists, teachers, and parents who all have expressed interest in this book.

Finally, the low startup cost of a Print on Demand Publisher like Ingram means I can always start with more conservative goals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me spread the word!

story:
ORDER THE BOOK HERE

Click on the link above to learn more. 

 

Story of My Book

 

Generation Optimism


My name is Juan David Campolargo, and I am the Author of Generation Optimism. I wrote this book because I realized that my generation (Gen Z)  and most of the population are shifting to be more pessimistic. In fact, my generation is one of the most pessimistic in the history of humankind.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will learn more about Optimism, the science of why we tend to be negative, and much, much more. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for optimism and perspective in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take advantage of the benefits of living an OPTIMISTIC life.

In this book, you'll learn about Optimism and Gaining perspective:

  • My personal journey of Optimism and how it has helped me
  • Deep understanding of our own human psychology & why we are wired to be negative
  • Inspiring stories of other people’s journey of optimism. You will learn from people like Mark Cuban and other super interesting personalities.
  • You will love this book if you are looking to alter your perspective and an “Outlook of Optimism” is not your strong suit.

 

Generation Optimism is a non-fiction book that speaks to younger generations and individuals who perceive life in a pessimistic way. After reading this book, I am sure you will dare to be an Optimist.

 

The Book - Generation Optimism


The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction and Chapters 1-5. In the introduction, I start by giving you a different standpoint that I use to see life and the world. After that, the first chapters will include identifying how you think, whether you’re an optimist or a pessimist, the current state of the world, reasons for pessimism, the psychology of Optimism, and a little GIFT.

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-10. These chapters will be focused on Learning To Be An Optimist. Optimism is a skill, and like many other skills, such as coding, public speaking, drawing. They can be LEARNED. That’s why I developed a method to start being an Optimist NOW.

Part 3 contains Chapters 11-12. This part of the book will look to the future. The world will have difficulties, adversities, and challenges that have never existed before. With all the negativity and pessimism, we will not be able to solve them unless we proactively create and encourage more people to be optimistic... we might never solve them.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Christmas

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish:
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

 

Juan David Campolargo is a 16-year old in high school. He was originally born and raised in Venezuela and recently moved to Chicago 2 years ago. When he first arrived in the U.S., he knew no English but mastered it in less than 6 months. The following year he started taking college-level and honors classes after just a year of moving into the country and learning the language. Juan David speaks four languages (Spanish, English, Portuguese, and Chinese).

He is also the CEO & Founder of Optimum Smart (a company that helps and advises businesses in social media and marketing). He’s also learned to invest in the stock market, cryptocurrencies, and startups, and has started a small hedge fund.

Juan David wrote this book to inspire the next generations. After reading an article that described how his generation (Gen Z) and millennials are the most pessimistic in history. He knew he had to take ACTION. Juan David quickly reached out to different people and started to research the best way to make an IMPACT. And that’s how the book came into being.

When he’s not pursuing an opportunity or a crazy challenge (like building/designing underwater objects). He’s playing soccer, running, volunteering at the largest museum of the Western hemisphere, or learning about science at America's particle physics and accelerator laboratory. But honestly, he’s mostly looking for things to do, challenges to overcome, and successes to achieve.

For more information, you can connect with Juan David at jdcampolargo@hotmail.com or LinkedIn

Connect on Instagram/Facebook/Twitter at @jdcampolargo

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #GenerationOptimism and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

  • Thank you so much of all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Juan David Campolargo

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

 
About the Author
 
Juan David Campolargo is a 16-year old in high school. He was originally born and raised in Venezuela and recently moved to Chicago 2 years ago. When he first arrived in the U.S., he knew no English but mastered it in less than 6 months. The following year he started taking college-level and honors classes after just a year of moving into the country and learning the language. Juan David speaks four languages (Spanish, English, Portuguese, and Chinese).He is also the CEO & Founder of Optimum Smart (a company that helps and advises businesses in social media and marketing). He’s also learned to invest in the stock market, cryptocurrencies, and startups, and has started a small hedge fund.Juan David wrote this book to inspire the next generations. After reading an article that described how his generation (Gen Z) and millennials are the most pessimistic in history. He knew he had to take ACTION. Juan David quickly reached out to different people and started to research the best way to make an IMPACT. And that’s how the book came into being.When he’s not pursuing an opportunity or a crazy challenge (like building/designing underwater objects). He’s playing soccer, running, volunteering at the largest museum of the Western hemisphere, or learning about science at America's particle physics and accelerator laboratory. But honestly, he’s mostly looking for things to do, challenges to overcome, and successes to achieve.For more information, you can connect with Juan David at jdcampolargo@hotmail.com or LinkedIn Connect on Instagram/Facebook/Twitter at @jdcampolargo
 
Risks & Challenges
 
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
 
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #GenerationOptimism and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,Juan David Campolargo

story:
Brady Plays the Fiddle – A Children’s Lyrical Picture Book that Inspires Love of Music in Young Readers

 

The Goal

Hi! I’m Melissa Auell, mom of 2 beautiful boys, and creative enthusiast! I love creating things and this book has been a labor of love! 

The goal of this campaign is to fund a print run to self-publish Brady Plays the Fiddle, a 18-illustration 5.5"x7" boardbook. The story is targeted at Children from 0-6.

©

Inspiration

I was inspired to write this book while looking for a simple children’s book that would encourage interest and love of music for my sons.  Our whole family is made up of musicians and, after searching extensively, I wasn’t able to locate any children’s books that fit.

It’s quick and fun to read while inspiring interest in music and instruments through bright, colorful images and rhythmic, lyrical text.

©

What’s Inside

Brady, the main character of the story, wants to play an instrument, but doesn’t know which one to choose.  He goes to a bluegrass festival and makes new friends who play different stringed instruments.  The story describes each instrument briefly and speaks to the different sounds that each one makes.  Brady’s parents come along with him on the adventure, helping to explain and offering encouragement.  Brady chooses his favorite instrument, learns how to play, practices, and then forms a band with friends he made along the way. 

The text and illustrations were all done by me.  The illustrations were sketched by hand and colored using Photoshop. 

©

Who am I?

I am a stay-at-home mom living in the mountains of Colorado by day, and a writer/illustrator by night.  While my professional background is in marketing and engineering, my passions include art, music, and the outdoors. 

©

Risks and challenges

Risks are low.  I have already completed the copy and illustrations for Brady Plays the Fiddle, and I have designed and laid out the interior pages and the front cover.

The only steps remaining are design the back cover and to submit the files and get them printed.

Timeline:

After I submit the files:

3 weeks for final review, back cover design, and acquiring ISBN number

2 weeks to receive proof

3 weeks to create and manufacture board books

6 weeks shipping from China

4 weeks for packaging and shipping books to your door!


There is always a chance that the proof is sub-par or the printer encounters a problem, which is why there are conservative delivery dates on the hardcopy rewards. Rest assured, I will only approve the book if I'm pleased with it and will work with the printer to get the best possible product. If delays occur, I will communicate them with you promptly.

©

 

What We Need

The goal of this campaign is to raise $5,000.  The majority of this will cover printing costs for the first print run of 1000 copies of the board book; the remainder will go towards publishing costs, get and ISBN, shipping, and the Indigogo cut.

©

What You Get

There are tons of fun Brady Plays the Fiddle schwag you can get from different levels of pledges.  You can read the details in the pledge boxes.  

Digital copy of the book

Board book copy or copies of the book

Stickers

Pin

Tote bag

11”x17” Poster

Blanket

The next book in the series dedicated to you!

 

©

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, no worries. You can still help by taking the time to share my campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!

Not only will you help the fundraiser, but you will also be spreading the word about the book itself.

 

ALL IMAGES AND TEXT COPYRIGHT © 2017 MELISSA AUELL.  ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.  PLEASE CONTACT ME FOR PERMISSION TO USE MY IMAGES.

story:
¿Qué?

Huellas es una novela que no te dejará indiferente; ahonda en uno de los momentos más oscuros y dramáticos de nuestro país, desde el presente, pero que leerás con una sonrisa amable siempre en el rostro.

Tras una decepción, Elisa deambula por el rastro de Madrid donde encuentra una caja que emite un enigmático susurro... Una nostalgia poderosa la llevará a reconstruir el pasado de un desconocido, que mucho tendrá que ver con el de su propio abuelo. Por una sucesión de casualidades, y algún golpe de suerte, se verá envuelta junto a tres amigos en una delirante, surrealista, y arriesgada misión.

Sensible, divertida, actual pero con memoria, como esas huellas del pasado que regresan con luz propia. Cuatro amigos tratarán de enmendar el destino de otros, aliviando el suyo propio gracias, sobre todo, al descubrimiento del verdadero amor que se les presentará sin buscarlo.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Eleonor Gil.

Nació en Madrid, en el año 1972. De niña, lo que más le gustaba era que su abuelo le prestase su máquina de escribir, de la que brotaron numerosas poesías. Más tarde comenzó a anotar reflexiones sobre cualquier cosa y, de este modo, quizás por la consciencia del paso del tiempo, fue adquiriendo el hábito de trasladar al papel sus pensamientos... así como un amor desmesurado por las palabras.

Sus grandes pasiones siempre han sido la literatura, la música, y los viajes. Ha visitado más de nueve países, toca la guitarra, el piano, y le apasiona leer y escribir. Huellas es su primera novela y esta es la primera vez que se plantea publicar un libro.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como una ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Huellas que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Eleonor Gil vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
What is the novel about?

“Mrinalika,” is a contemporary, literary romance about the love affair of two very dissimilar persons. Mrinalika and Rafael meet in New York while attending a UNESCO sponsored conference. Differences in culture, long separations, and marriages to other people will test and strain their relationship until it reaches its inevitable conclusion twenty years later and again in New York.

Rafael Artebuz has a Ph. D. in Latin American Literature. Yet, he is a lowly municipal worker wasting his life as director of a small museum in Guadalajara, Mexico. He says he has taken the job while waiting for the city government to build a cultural center of which he has been promised the directorship.

Much to his surprise, he receives an invitation to a UNESCO sponsored meeting in New York City. The invitation is especially surprising since the object of the meeting is to petition the UN to declare 1986 as “The Year of Autochthonous Cultures,” a subject of which he knows little and cares even less about.

But, he does want to go to the Big Apple: there's an ex-lover is there: a woman who works for UNESCO and whom Rafael suspects is the one who managed to get him invited to the meeting so he could have an excuse to go the New York. He had a love affair with her two years before and he certainly would not mind a repeat performance.

But, he is too low on the municipality's hierarchy to rate travel expenses. Knowing that his boss has always wanted to go to the United States, a country that has banned his entry due to his leftist-socialist activism, Rafael appeals to Roy Miller, a friend in the American Consulate. He would like Miller to use his influence to get Rafael's boss a visa in exchange for approving Rafael's travel requisition. Roy Miller does so in exchange for a future favor. “You will owe me big time,” he says to Rafael.

Rafael plans to spend his week in New York avoiding his boss and “boozing around town with the Belgian” as he puts it. But, his plans are interrupted by Mrinalika Sundaripara, an engaged artist from New Delhi. She, unlike Rafael, is interested in autochthonous cultures, especially their arts and crafts. The UNESCO meeting is not the only reason she has come to New York: she is also there to negotiate a deal with the publisher who wants to publish her book on saving autochthonous art, and she is going to have a solo exhibition of her art in a SoHo gallery.

As unlikely as it would seem, these two persons of dissimilar character, background, and outlook in life, fall in love. Initially, it is Mrinalika who does the pursuing, much to the befuddlement of Rafael. He will discover that she has a special reason for doing so. He resists her advances but soon surrenders to her charm.

“Mrinalika and Rafael,” is the story of their love affair and how the differences in the their cultures, their customs, the social and political background of their countries influence their relationship, causing it to ebb and flow, to flare up with passion, and sometimes, to succumb to anger and distrust.

The love affair that starts during the week that Rafael is in New York City, will last twenty years. It will experience long separations, difficult trials, and unexpected tribulations. But, eventually it will change their lives as it comes to its inevitable conclusion.

Why do I need funding?

“Mrinalika, a Third World romance” (working title), is 103,000 words long. The reason I am asking for funding is that I would like to have it edited and critiqued by a professional editor with more than twenty years of experience in the publishing industry. In today's publishing environment, in which thousands of books come to market through self-publishing, Kindle, and ebook production houses, it is difficult to get agents and publishing houses to consider books by unknown authors. By having my book edited not only for the usual grammar and style issues but also critiqued for the value of its content, I will increase the possibility of agents and/or a publishing houses showing interest in it. Also, this particular professional editor offers to help in reaching agents and publishers that to her knowledge are the best to approach according to the type of novel I have written.

I hope this text not only gives you an idea of what my novel is about but that it will also encourage you to support it by funding it. Please consult the rewards section to see what I offer in return for certain amounts of funding.

The Impact Your Contribution Will Have

Independent book editors  are persons qualified to better a manuscript by editing it for grammar, punctuation, and format issues; they can also give an author advice on content, structure, and style. The manuscripts of even the best writers can benefit from an objective and qualified review by an experienced editor. Small things like typos, bad grammar, and awkward sentence construction can keep an agent or publisher from seriously considering a manuscript or even from reading it. Here are a few reasons more why it makes sense to use a professional, independent editor:

  • Agents or editors that work in a publishing house are not bound by contract or pay to do the best job possible on a manuscript; they also have several manuscripts to work on at the same time, thus giving only partial attention to yours.
  • Working with a professional editor will insure that my manuscript receives full and focused attention; communication with such an editor will give me insights into the construction and development of plot and characters that would be impossible reach on my own.
  • Editors work in a network of agents, publishers, and other editors which might result in interesting referrals.

Risks and challanges

It is important to note that using a professional editor to edit and critique a manuscript does not guarantee that the manuscript will be accepted by an agent or a publisher. Today's publishing environment is more difficult than ever and both agents and publishers are more concerned with the business aspect of publishing than in literary merit. Even if an agent accepts to represent a writer, or a publisher signs a contract, it may be months or years before the manuscript turns into a published book. Having said that, I do believe that attempting to get an agent interested in my manuscript without having it polished and edited professionally, would make it even harder to see it published as a book and/or distributed widely as an ebook. To minimize the risk, I plan to:

  • Pick an editor with a track record of success and who is knowledgeable in the genre of fiction I have written.
  • Once the manuscript is in the best form possible, send queries and samples only to agents best suited to the manuscript's content.

Other ways you might help

Some of you might not be able to contribute, but that does not mean you cannot help. If you can't contribute, you can still help my by:

  • Sending the link and information about this campaign to your list of friends.
  • Remember that if you are in Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media, you can point people to Indiegogo where my campaign resides.

Thank you one and all for reading this. Don't forget to look in the REWARDS section.

story:
"Breaking the Hush Factor is a joy to read! Dr. Karen Rayne is a trusted, expert authority on speaking with children about sex and sexuality. Her voice is caring and compassionate as she guides parents with practical tips and common sense advice for starting “the talk” and keeping them going. Parents will want to read this. Parents need to read this."
Bill Taverner, MA, CSE
Executive Director, Center for Sex Education


Breaking the Hush Factor is a new kind of parenting book. It isn’t only for parents, it doesn’t make assumptions about gender or sexual orientation, and it won’t scare you. Instead, you’ll find ten concrete rules to strengthen your relationship with your teenager so that you can start to talk about sex. Because most people have sex and everyone needs to talk about sex. Teenagers have adults in their lives who can help them. Breaking the Hush Factor will teach those adults how.

With a Foreword by Heather Corinna, Founder and Director of Scarleteen:

"Karen Rayne is a sexuality educator and advocate with a rare gift: she has always appeared equally, and greatly, skilled at educating and advocating for youth and parents alike. Few of us can make that claim, but if she wanted to, she truly could."
Heather Corinna


What do you mean, breaking the hush factor? What is this "hush factor" of which you speak and write? 

Sexuality is one of our great social taboos - not just in the United States, but in many parts of the world. It is one of those things humans are very hush-hush about, even in the face of clear evidence that talking about sexuality is one of the most effective ways to increase sexual safety, decrease unwanted sexual outcomes, increase sexual pleasure, and reduce sexual stress. Out with the bad, in with the good, and all from talking about sex! 

Breaking through the sexual hush factor is the first step towards a healthy sexuality, both individually and culturally. Breaking the Hush Factor is written to support parents and other adults as they begin or continue their journey of talking openly with young people about sex and sexuality. 

But before we go any further, we want to reiterate something important: if you want to read a book and be scared, don’t read this one. The hush-hush about sex and sexuality is made so much worse by scaring parents about it, and so that’s not the goal here. If you want to be supported in opening dialogue in honest ways, then you’re in the right place. 

Meet the Author, Dr. Karen Rayne 

Karen has been talking with teens and parents about sexuality for almost a decade. She originally started working in sex education because she believed in teenagers’ rights to support, love, community, and information - and she still does!

Why you know you're in good hands with Karen, by the bullets:

  • She's the Chair of the National Sex Ed Conference (third year running)
  • Associate Editor of the American Journal for Sexuality Education
  • She just returned from a trip to Zimbabwe where she was implementing a sex ed curriculum project she created with the United Nations Population Fund
  • She's the founder of Unhushed, where she teaches private, comprehensive sexuality education for youth in Texas, and consults parents in need

QUESTIONS & ANSWERS

Some of them asked (please use the Comments page to ask questions you'd like to have answered here, as well as to show your love and appreciation for Karen), some of them anticipated, here's what you need to know:

"Will you include my name in the Thank Yous if I don't want it there?"

No. The MENTION perk (only available in the first week of the campaign) is for folks who want it -- and you'll have to request to be named and thanked. We won't thank you without your consent, and we want an enthusiastic yes.

"Will the book be in bookstores? Or, how will I be able to get it if I don't preorder?"

Yes. The book will be available through all the major retailers (Amazon, Barnes, etc.) as well as any indie stores that want to carry it. Even better, the E-book will be available at BreakingTheHushFactor.com for the very low cost of pay-what-you-want -- and yes, that means $0 if you want it free.

However, this is your best chance to get signed paperbacks, and your ONLY chance to get the special edition hardcover (also signed).

About the Indiegogo Campaign

The primary purpose of this Indiegogo campaign is to allow folks to preorder the book, and to allow a small group of parents to be part of the cocreation of the second edition. Unlike some Indiegogo campaigns, this is not a fundraiser that -- if our goal isn't reached -- will have an impact on the eventual creation of the thing. The thing, in this case the book, will be a thing no matter what.

Why the $3000 goal? Where will that money go?

Directly into publishing! A big percentage of the money raised will go toward fulfilling the rewards (e.g., printing/shipping the books). The rest will go toward covering initial design and publishing costs -- hoping that the majority of the royalties, once the book is available to the public, will go where they should go: to the author, Karen.

What’s the timeline? 

The book will be shipped to Indiegogo campaign contributors after the campaign ends in June! And you’ll be just tickled pink at how pretty it is when you hold it for the first time!

Parents need to read this."
Bill Taverner, MA, CSEExecutive Director, Center for Sex Education
Breaking the Hush Factor is a new kind of parenting book. It isn’t only for parents, it doesn’t make assumptions about gender or sexual orientation, and it won’t scare you. story:
Short Summary

Have you ever wondered about different supernatural creatures, what they are really like, what they do, and if and how you need to protect yourself from them? This book is designed to entertain and to keep you safe from vampires, werewolves, djinn, and other supernatural creatures that share our world. Have you wondered if these are purely fictional creatures? This book will help you separate the fact from the fiction and be better equipped to handle whatever supernatural entities come your way. Be ready for Halloween and beyond because these creatures know more about you than you know about them. This book will have you wondering, is that monster costume, really a costume? Boo!

Who is Laura Powers?

Laura is one of the top psychics in the City of Angels and has clients all over the world.  She is a psychic medium, angel communicator, actress, singer, and host. She is also an avid writer and adventurer who travels as much as her imagination allows.  She received her bachelor’s degree in theatre and her master’s degree in political science from the University of Colorado. In addition to seeing clients, Laura teaches classes on the psychic realm and writes about her experiences.  This is her 6th book on the psychic and spiritual realm and she is already working on her 7th and 8th.  When she is not writing or traveling, you may find her exploring the unknown.  You can find more information on her work in the spiritual and metaphysical realms at www.healingpowers.net and more on her acting, singing, hosting, and creative work at www.laurapowers.net

What the Book is About

This book is about different supernatural creatures, how they interact with us, how to recognize them, and how to protect yourself. In the book, I talk about angels, ghosts, demons and dark entities, faeries, dragons, vampires, werewolves (and other werecreatures), hunters, witches, devils, fallen angels, djinn (genies in western terminology), and zombies. You might be surprised by what is really out there!

How the Funds Will Be Used & What You Get

Funds generated through the Indiegogo campaign will be used for professional editing of the manuscript, cover photo and design by Penny O photography, printing by Create Space, and formatting of the book in ebook formats for the kindle and other ereaders (mobi and epub format).  This budget covers getting the book print-ready, printing, and epublishing only.  Every dollar we raise above the $1385 budget will be used for marketing and traveling to promote the book. 

*Proposed budget of what your money will be used for:

· Library of Congress registration - $35

· Cover design and layout - $525

· Editing and formatting services for print and ebook - $525

· Printing and shipping - $300 and up depending on number of orders

$1385 estimated

Any additional funds raised will be used for marketing. Here are proposed budget items:

· Audio book production - $500 or more

· Marketing and promotion on Facebook and other marketing platforms - $150

Note: These are all projected expenses

If you support the project, you will receive some or all of the following depending on what level or support you sign, up for: mobi and epub versions of book, signed hard copy of book, specially designed "Vampires Don't Kiss and Tell T-Shirt."

The Impact

This will help me get this book out faster and with specific funds for marketing and production.  My other five books Life and the After-Life: Notes from a Medium and Angel Communicator and Angels: How to Understand, Recognize, and Receive Their Guidance, and Diary of a Ghost Whisperer, and The Diary of a Psychic have been successfully self-published and are selling well on Amazon.  This book will help people better understand the psychic world and how to handle it. For those who are just curious about the psychic realm, this will provide a fun and entertaining read.

You can find my other books on amazon here.

Risks & Challenges

I am doing pre-orders and releasing this book quickly so I am doing a short campaign! I got the psychic message that this book needed to be out for Halloween so I hustled to make it happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me get the word out, share on Facebook etc!  Ask the angels to help me (really it works!).

Thanks in advance to everyone for their support!

story:
I was born and raised in the heart of the Bible belt, and my faith has always been an extremely important aspect of my life. Since I was only seven years old, I knew that I was supposed to be in the ministry, spreading the message of Jesus Christ. The problem was that since around that same time, I also knew that I was gay, and these two did not work very well together.

So, I suppressed my feelings and put on a mask that I called “Straight-Face.” Straight-face had one duty: to convince everyone else – including God – that I wasn't gay. Straight-face and I fought back and forth for control, and journeyed together to figure out life, faith, doubt, sexuality, and everything in between.

This book is a memoir of that journey; it is my story. But, the story does not belong only to me – this is the same story that many are living out every day, which is why this story needs to be heard. There are thousands that are still being suffocated by their own masks, and they need to experience the true freedom that Christ offers. Even more, there are others that want to know what it is like to live in the closet in a conservative environment. This memoir details the intense psychological side of constantly trying to hide your true identity, all the while silently suffering in the solitude of shame.

My journey has not been easy, but the result has been beautiful, and there are many others that need to know that their journey is going to end beautifully, as well. This memoir is about Jesus, Straight-Face, and I all trying to figure out how to get along – and realizing that sometimes, three really can be a crowd.

Why an Indiegogo campaign?

The book is set to release on May 31st, but just publishing a book is not enough. For the story to really get out there, I am in need of a publicist, as well as other marketing materials. This is going to cost me a pretty penny, and as a school teacher, it is a pretty penny that I do not have! I am going to need about $5000 to get this thing going, but I believe enough people out there know that the future is bright, and will want to help get us there with their minor gifts towards the cause. Your gift, no matter the size, will help get this story into the hands of other people who are suffering inside their masks, and can hopefully lead them to freedom.

The Perks

$1 Get Your Feet Wet Level-

You may want to help, but you really can't give much. That is perfectly fine! Every dollar helps! Just by giving a dollar, and sharing this campain with your friends and family all over social media, you will be making a difference! I promise!

$25 Contributor Level-

You will forever have my gratitude for believing in this project enough to donate, and I will add your name to the acknowledgements of the book.

$50 Essential Contributor Level-

Beyond having my infinite gratitude and your name in the acknowledgements, you will receive an autographed copy of the book. Consider this a pre-order on steroids! (International shipping will need to add $25)

$100 Partner Level-

Beyond having my infinite gratitude, your name in the acknowledgements and an autographed copy of the book, we will also give you a free download of the ebook for your Kindle, Nook, or Ipad.

$250 My Personal Hero Level-

Beyond having my infinite gratitude, an autographed copy of the book, the free download of the ebook for your Kindle, Nook, or Ipad, I would also like to thank you personally via Skype or on the Phone.

$500 Benefactor Level-

Not only will you receive all of the other perks, I would like to speak in person (if within driving distance) or via Skype with your book club, or your church's small group. I can’t wait to meet you because without you, this thing would not have been possible!

$1000 The Ridiculous Level-

You'll get all of the perks from before, but you'll also have the title of being my personal superhero that I will forever consider the greatest person ever!

About the Author

Brandon Wallace is a Memphis based author/speaker/schoolteacher that grew up in Cherry Valley, Arkansas. His first book will be released in late May 2014. Brandon also runs the popular blog TheGayChristian.com. You can contact him via Facebook at www.facebook.com/brandonwallaceauthor or by email at brandon@thegaychristian.com.
