The Story - Rough Edges

Rough Edges explores themes of self-discovery and true love in a world where our online persona can sometimes feel the most real, but competes with the draw of human connection in the real world.

The story follows a small-town high school girl, Casey, who uses the world of online games and instant messaging to find a place to fit in. The screen gives her the confidence to be the person she desperately wants to be in real life, causing her to get lost in the charm of constant attention and acceptance. As time pushes ahead and she transitions to college in the city of Philadelphia, she discovers that it is just as easy to be herself without the screen. But there’s something holding her back from detaching herself from her online life; a void that would appear if that part of her were to completely dissolve. She attempts to keep both halves of herself in separate boxes, but the question is, what happens when both worlds collide? She’ll have to make a choice, if there’s even one left for her to make.

The book is written in Two Parts:

Part One is titled Reflection. Casey will take you back in time to join her on the roller coaster that is her online romance. She battles the obsession of constant attention from the person on the other side of the screen and the fear of missing out on the experiences of her friends as they enjoy their final summer before college.

Part Two is titled Reinvention. We jump to the present and explore themes of self-discovery and reinvention as Casey makes her way to Philadelphia—a city of over a million people where she can be whoever and whatever she wants, regardless of the private online life she keeps hidden from the real world.

 

The Impact

I wrote this book with hope in my heart. The experiences I’ve put in writing are some of my own and aim to take you through the highs and lows of online relationships, and the sometimes difficult task of coming back to reality. I’m telling this story to let people who have been through these experiences, and those who have not, know that there is a kindred spirit out there. Hopefully, it will make all of us feel a little less alone.

Rough Edges speaks to both young and early adults who want to be transported back to the nostalgia of their high school days. The days of AOL Instant Messenger, MySpace, and the sometimes messy transition into college or adulthood. You’ll feel like you’re re-living your adolescent years along with the main character, Casey.

You will love this book if you are a fan of Nicolas Sparks’s many love stories and thrillers, like Luckiest Girl Alive, The Last Mrs. Parrish, and Not That I Could Tell. I like to think of it as your next beach read, or perhaps next month’s book club choice.

When I think about the reflection and dialogue that Rough Edges may inspire, I hope that readers will contemplate the ideas of:

  • Our engagement and relationship with technology
  • Dating in the 21st century, specifically online dating becoming the new normal (think Tinder, Bumble, Hinge)
  • What it’s like to live a double life, whether by choice or out of necesssity

I look forward to exploring these thoughts and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing our responses may surprise us all.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish next Spring. When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

 

Exclusive Pre-order Rewards

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • A personal, handwritten Thank You note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“With Special Thanks To”).
  • Early access to the Introduction and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover. 
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book and a behind-the-scenes sneak peek into the publishing process. 
  • Original Rough Edges bookmark from my good friend and fellow author Torri Heat (@TorriHeat on Instagram).
  • Original Rough Edges wine glass or mug from my good friend and creator of Bubbly & Brûlée (@bubblyandbrulee on Instagram)
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Sarah Marron is a Finance Manager at Johnson and Johnson by day, satisfying the analytical side of her brain that requires organization and structure. While on maternity leave, she decided to take on the second biggest project of her life (apart from raising a child) and finish writing her novel.

Growing up, Sarah loved the freedom that reading affords us: to live in a completely different world with different truths. It is a way to escape reality by living vicariously through the characters. Gravitated to the idea of being someone else, she decided to write a story that would transport her audience into the world of her main character, putting them squarely in her shoes and allowing them to experience all of the emotions, choices, and consequences along with her.

Currently, Sarah resides in New Jersey with her husband, five month old son, and two cats. She enjoys reading, writing, and running when she’s not spending time with friends and family.

For more information, you can connect with Sarah at SarahMarron.Author@gmail.com and SarahMarron_Author on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished product to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just aren't able to contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. You can use #RoughEdges and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • Share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page directly via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • If you feel comfortable, please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Cheers,
Sarah Marron

story:
A coffee table book, and a meditation on the question:

 

How would God respond to a Trump tweet?

 

This 60 page gem features Trump's greatest absurdisms, each one matched with a piece of timeless wisdom from the world's greatest religions, spiritual paths, philosophers and gurus.

(8x8 in, hardcover, gold edges, high production quality)

 

Testimonials

 

"This book provides emotional release, support, peace, perspective and calming in turbulent political times."  ~ Lisa Ferland, author, coach and contributor at Huffington Post

 

"There's deep psychology in here."  ~ Steven Sal Debus, Managing Director, Modernature 

 

"Terrific, great production quality." ~ Mitch Horowitz, Author, The Miracle Club: How Thoughts Become Reality

 

"Its a gag gift with intelligence." ~ Brian Jenkins, Creator, The Art of Winning Bigly.

 

 

 

EARLY REVIEWS


 

 

COMEDY, SPIRITUALITY, ART, & ABSURDITY

 

SAMPLE PAGES

 

HELLO FROM THE AUTHOR

 


 

 

 

 

 

Where will the funds go? 

 

 

 

Who created this book? 

 

A little background: In 2017, I got addicted to Trump news in the day while reading Buddhist books at night.  The two worlds collided in my brain, and the explosions wouldn't stop until "The Trump Guide to Spirituality" became a reality.  

For work, I'm a college instructor in downtown Vancouver, Canada, and live near Gastown in the Downtown Eastside. My walk to work takes me past Gucci shops next to welfare housing, and million dollar condos sprinkled with syringes at their doorsteps. The contrasts are extreme and leave a lot to be pondered, as does the gap between Trump's Twitter feed and age-old wisdom: a contrast that this book plays with. 

On a personal note: I have no pets, an old bike I ride obsessively, a wise, hilarious, and beautiful girlfriend named Toy, a Swiffer, 2 plants, 1 padded rug, and a freakishly polarized view of both sparkly downtown Vancouver and less sparkly Pigeon Park.  

I made this book to spark more interesting conversations while bringing levity to a loaded topic at an unprecedented time. Equally important: sharing the principle of equanimity and waking up on beaches a few more weeks a year.  10% of proceeds go to The Writers' Exchange, a non-profit in Vancouver that gets kids excited about reading, writing, and their own potential. 

I think you'll enjoy this book.Vancouver, Canada

 

 

Tablet Version 

(available as an addon after you select a perk and enter the checkout)

 

 

 

 

 

;)
